story:
My mother was taken from my family by a drunk driver. He had 4 passengers in his car who possibly COULD have stopped him. Police have released that at the time of the accident he was going 100mph when he lost control of his car and became airborn. He collided with a bus stop where a crowd of people was waiting. On this tragic day 4 people died, one of which being my mother Johnni Lee Garner. I was not able to find a youtube video which stated her name but I will include several links to the articles. 

 

My children (5 &2) and I lived with my mother. She was the main income in our household. I am struggling to come up with the money for a proper funeral. I hate to have to ask people to help but I have no idea what else to do. No one expected this. No one thought that this could happen to our family...

 

My daughters continue to ask for their grandmother. They don't understand why she isn't coming home, why they can't see her face or hear her voice. I myself do not understand why this happened. I am still trying to come to terms with the fact that this is real, that it really happened... I cannot believe yet that she isn't coming back. 

 

My mother was a very kind and loving person. She was a Nurse at Sunrise Hospital. She helped people on a daily basis. She loved everyone. I don't think she ever had one bad thing to say about someone... You always saw her with a smile on her face or she was giggling at something that was said. She always put others before herself, even people that she did not know. 

Any donation amount is grealty appreciated. I thank you for helping my family in this time of need...

 

Nichelle Garner. 

 

http://www.mynews3.com/mostpopular/story/Driver-in-fatal-bus-stop-crash-has-long-criminal/WQLThpieY0SHukGoaiBv8w.cspx

 

http://www.mynews3.com/content/news/local/story/Spring-Mountain-passengers-ponder-what-might-have/MAHPYCFPmUmsoaCd7RoNlg.cspx

http://www.8newsnow.com/category/28259/8-news-now-video?clipId=7727816&autostart=true

story:
HEALTHY CHANGES BITE BY BITE

SCHOOL DINING ROOM and KITCHEN RENOVATION + YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS

                                   = PROMOTING HEALTHY EATING HABITS AT A YOUNG AGE

 

 

Harbor Country Day School is a Preschool through Grade 8 non-sectarian, non-profit independent school with a fun and exciting summer camp. In 1958, the school began with a gift; a group of parents purchased the buildings and grounds of Tulip Knoll. Founded by energetic and generous local parents, Harbor Country Day School cherishes childhood, cultivates wonder, and inspires confident learners and leaders.

 

No independent school can exist on tuition dollars alone. We are dependent on the good will and the generosity of our community. As the Parents' Association President at Harbor Country Day School, I am starting this campaign to raise the money necessary to renovate the school’s dining room and kitchen facilities. We want to be able to provide healthy and well-balanced meals and all the nutrition needed for the kids to succeed at school. We want to serve nutrition every day.

 

Our campaign is focused on shaping children’s eating habits by providing healthy choices at snack time and at lunch time. Our current dining room and kitchen facilities and equipment are out dated and cumbersome, not utilizing the limited space in the best possible way. Our renovation plans include adding a salad and soup bar, and upgrading our kitchen equipment so that we may have a functioning kitchen to prepare and serve a greater array of healthy options for our children.

 

WHY WE NEED TO PROMOTE HEALTHY EATING?

Below, I share staggering statistics which reveal the importance of doing our part to better serve our children and their future by encouraging them to adopt a healthy lifestyle starting at a young age, bite by bite!

Research shows that healthy eating can improve children's concentration and help them do better in school, says pediatric behavioral nutritionist Janice Baranowski from Baylor University in Houston. Baranowski adds that getting the proper nutrients is especially important for young brains that are still growing and developing. Nutritionist Beth Reardon from Duke University's integrative medicine center in Durham, North Carolina, adds that research also suggests that certain foods may affect kids with attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, either in a positive or a negative way.

Read more: http://www.livestrong.com/article/192724-how-does-healthy-eating-affect-childrens-concentration/#ixzz24Q7WaWq7

 

Stamina

  • Children need the food from lunch to fuel their bodies and keep them alert for the rest of their school day. A healthy lunch provides this fuel, while an unhealthy lunch makes children more sluggish and unaware. Kids who eat a healthy lunch are more prepared for their school day.

Full Stomach

  • Children do not always eat well at home. Lunch may be the only healthy food they get on any given day. A healthy lunch may provide these children with the foods they need to fill their stomach at least once a day.

Knowledge

  • A healthy lunch teaches children about eating healthy. They will learn what is healthy versus what isn't and how their bodies react to different types of foods. They will also learn what a balanced meal looks like and hopefully be able to re-create those meals for themselves someday.

Physical Health

  • We know that good foods are good for our bodies, and because children are constantly growing and developing, they need good, healthy lunches to promote healthy growth. Unhealthy school lunches only help children grow more round, while healthy cafeteria food help them grow tall and strong.

Mental Health

  • The University of Michigan Health System has shown that children who eat a healthy lunch with a limited amount of sugar tend to learn better than when they have an unhealthy lunch, no lunch, or lunch with a lot of sugar and carbohydrates.

Comfort

  • Some children may get some comfort from their healthy lunch. It shows that somebody actually cares about him/her and is willing to make healthy foods and spend a little more money on those healthy foods rather than serving them unhealthy foods.

 

Obesity Among Children and Adolescents

In 2009-2010, 16.9 percent of children and adolescents aged 2-19 years were obese. This includes 18.6 percent of boys and 15.0 percent of girls.

Among children and adolescents aged 2-19:

  • The prevalence of obesity was higher among adolescents than among preschool-aged children.
  • The prevalence of obesity was higher among boys than girls.
  • Among children and adolescents aged 2-19, more than 5 million girls and 7 million boys were obese.

                       
NOTE: Obesity defined as BMI ≥ 95th percentile.
Source: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey, 2009-2010.

Data Source:

  • National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES)– collects information about the health and diet of people in the U.S. NHANES is unique in that it combines a home interview with physical examinations and laboratory tests conducted in a Mobile Examination Center. NHANES can directly measure conditions and provide reliable information on health conditions regardless of whether the survey respondent is aware of them. (NHANES Website)

 

YOUR TAX DEDUCTIBLE(*) GIFT WILL PROVIDE HEALTHY CHANGES BITE BY BITE

The  total campaign amount is $25,000.  In order to retrofit our Dining Room and Kitchen to provide the proper and healthy choices for our children, we need to purchase the following equipment.  In some cases we are replacing inoperable equipment, and /or equipment that is not working effectively.

 

Quantity           Description                                                                                          Cost

1    Cold Pan Serving Counter                                                                   $3925

Vollrath Co Model # R38716                               

1    60 “ Tray Slide Model # 39960                                                            $585

1    Merchandiser Refrigerator                                                                   $2475

      True Food Service Equipment Model #GDM-41

1    48” Stainless Steel Top Work Table                                                     $225

      KCS Metal Products Model # WS-3048-B

1    Electric Convection Oven                                                                    $3167

     Moffat Model #E32D5

1    Hand Sink                                                                                            $115

      KCS Metal Products Model # KCS-HS2-SP

1    Three Compartment Sink                                                                     $530

      KCS Metal Products Model # KCSD316-1818-3R

1     Faucet                                                                                                  $119

       T & S Brass Model # B-0231

1     Wire Shelving/ Hardware                                                                     $51

1     Dish Cabinet                                                                                        $755

       L & J Restaurant Manufacturing Import Model # ST-318-108

1     Soup Kettle                                                                                          $190

      Thunder Group Model #SEJ30000C

1    Chest Freezer                                                                                       $635

      Summit Commercial Model # WCH15

1    Cube Style Ice Maker w/ bin                                                                  $1635

1    Freight Charges (Uncrating, and assembling)                                       $225

 

Total Equipment Only Costs                                                                                        $14632

The above costs do not include applicable sales tax.  It also does not include the installation of the above equipment, or any electrical and plumbing work, final connections to any equipment, as well as structural alterations necessary for all equipment to fit properly.

The estimated construction costs to complete the project are stated below.

Total Construction Costs                                                                                              $10000

 

 * Harbor Country Day School is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) and contributions made qualify for tax deductions according to the Federal tax laws.  Generally, contributions are tax-deductible minus the fair market value of any perks you receive.  To receive the full value of your contribution, you may choose not to receive the perk.  For questions about tax deductibility, you should contact your tax advisor.  Harbor Country Day School will provide the value of any goods/services received in your acknowledgement letter.

 

If you have questions please feel free to contact me at Stephen.hussey@hotmail.com.  I suggest visiting the school’s website as well www.harborcountrydayschool.org.

If you can’t make a monetary donation, but are able to donate any of the equipment needed please contact me for further information.

story:
Short Summary

Traci is a nurse from south Georgia. She could have never imagined the roles would be reversed and she would become the patient, especially not for an extended period of time!

Please help hit this one out of the park for good! As if the diagnosis of breast cancer in 2006 was not devastating enough, it had the audacity to return not just once (2011) but reared its ugly head a third time (2012) even after a voluntary double mastectomy with reconstruction! You can not fathom the toll this is taking on Traci & her family! We are seeking to send Traci to the most advanced cancer treatment center in America - MD Anderson!

Financial burdens are insurmountable at this point. Therefore, the only option remaining is your support! Please help! Her 2 beautiful children, her loving husband , & a multitude of devoted friends need her to get better! Join our team & contribute today!

What We Need & What You Get

788 miles away from her daughter who is preparing to start her high school senior year, away from her son who vows not to live without his mom and away from her faithful husband of over 10 years...Traci has enough to deal with!

We are seeking the funds necessary to help with the trip expenses to Texas and to cover the daily household needs!

You get the satifaction in knowing that you were able to help someone truly in need. You will be the fuel to Traci's fired up will to live and beat this disease!

The Impact

If you assist in this campaign for Traci you will be making her world so much more bearable! Traci has already committed that when she gets on the other side of this she is going to do something profound with her life story! Motivational speaker? counselor to newly diagnosed cancer patients? The possibilies are endless! Make an impact on Traci's world so she can make a new mark on society!

Other Ways You Can Help

After you have given whatever you can please spread the word about this cause! Link through facebook, make flyers & take them to work, pass it along to family and friends.

Visit Traci's campaign often because it increases our gogofactor which will get us featured on the home page! Thank you so much!

story:
Who We Are:

SpeakWithDoc, Inc. is a Health Information Company founded by Dr. Shaun Jones and co-founder Bill Williams in response to the need for accurate, relevant and concise information to be provided outside the confines of the doctors’ office. With the SpeakWithDoc web, iOS, and android applications, our goal is to stream-line and sync all communications between healthcare providers and patients.  

At SpeakWithDoc we understand the importance of proactively managing your health and we believe everyone should have access to healthcare providers anytime and anywhere. By better equipping Physicians and Pharmacists, and by empowering YOU- the Patient, SpeakWithDoc will improve patient care, efficiency and convenience, ultimately creating a Healthier World.

What SpeakWithDoc Provides:

  • Locate Physicians and Pharmacies
  • Schedule appointments, 
  • Set medication reminders, 
  • Get live and immediate health answers from Physicians and Pharmacists, 
  • Order home lab test, 
  • Get health reminders and more, all within a friendly interface.
  • **Physicians can consult with specialist colleagues, refer patients to colleagues, review appointments,  & hold secure LiveChats with their patients**, Plus more...
 

The Journey & The Genesis

One evening in 2009, an old college colleague called. The family had been seeing the specialist but was now completely frustrated with the lack of answers and no apparent resolution. I interviewed them a bit more and had them write down my recommended plan. I told them to be very polite with the Specialist, but ask if he could accommodate my plan- I had recommended a particular surgery. 

One week later they called back- the surgery was done, and it was a huge success! I was humbled by the experience but I also felt troubled by it....It was then that I had the epiphany. I thought to myself how much healthier the world would be if as Physicians we were all communicating more and if we were more connected with our patients.  This was the tipping point, and so I decided to create the means to grant improved healthcare access to all.  In December 2009 I started my R&D.

R&D

As tedious as R&D sounds, I've been having a whale of a time at it. The truth is, I had formal Computer Science training prior to medical school and so I'm comfortable in the zone. Our research was extensive, exhaustive and expensive but definitely worth every effort we put in. We covered everything from internet law and the HIPAA Technical Standards, to mobile commerce, mHealth trends, iOS, Google, and their myriad of SDK's. In spite of all that was available, nothing met my full requirements and so I had to do some designing.

The design focus was client-centric and it started with the question: "If there is a patient/client in a new city and knowing no one, how could that person get access to a physician with minimal hassle?" My answer, "Connect directly to a Physician". My next question: "How?" And this was the question I answered with the design. At the end of several months of hibernation and 18 hour days,  the SpeakWithDoc Concept was born.

We reviewed the requirements and then went shopping for additional developers. Due to the nature of the interface we had development teams in California, New York, Texas, and Pennsylvania. We finally released our Beta in January 2012. To date, we still have not released the entire interface and that is what this project is about.

Our Experience With The SpeakWithDoc Beta

We've had thousands of exchanges with users from all across the US, and across the globe. We have assisted users in London,  Egypt, Ireland, Spain, Australia, India, the United Arab Emirates, the Caribbean, among others. We have assisted the entire age range of iPhone and Android owners from teenagers to grandmothers.

Problems, Solutions, & Benefits

Second Opinion

Ok, so you just returned from the doctor, you have a bunch of medications but for some reason you are still not sure what is happening or what each medication is for. So what can you do? Well, with the SpeakWithDoc app you can securely get a second opinion or get additional information from one of our physicians. Additionally, you could have our Pharmacist help you understand the medications you received. Problem Solved 

College Students

You are in college or you have kids in college. At this stage, being away from home and having sensitive health issues to deal with, do college kids want to call their parents? Probably not. Do parents want them to take advice from other college friends about their health? Again, probably not. Enter SpeakWithDoc and the student gets to speak privately with his physician or with our physician on the fly. Now everyone is happy, Problem Solved.

Post-Surgery

You've just had surgery, and you are at home recovering. It's a rainy Sunday afternoon, but you are fairly comfy at home watching the football game. Suddenly you feel a slight pain in the area of the surgery and it looks a little different to you. Your Surgeon's office is closed but there is an ER about an hour away, what do you do? Enter SpeakWithDoc. You open a chat with your physician and send him your symptoms. From the SpeakWithDoc interface you also send him a couple pictures of the surgical area. He reviews it, assures you that its ok and your Sunday relaxation is saved. No need for a trip to the ER. Problem Solved.

Chronic Illnesses

You are diabetic and hypertensive and you have a pharmacy of medications to take- which you tend to forget because there are simply too many. You have several complications of these chronic illnesses and you experience new symptoms quite often. Many times you don't know what to do and you feel scared. You visit your doctor for your regular appointments and you don't even know where to begin. In any case, there wouldn't be enough time. So how can SpeakWithDoc help? 

Well, as the symptoms appear, you could easily start an instant chat and have an immediate discussion with one of our physicians who would provide you with the information and guidance you seek. even while the symptoms are taking place. Using our Medication Reminder System, you could enter all your medications and get prompt reminders of when to take each medication. This combined assistance would prove invaluable in improving your general health. So there you have it, Problem Solved.

The Newbie

So, you have just moved into town and you need to find a physician. If you find one, then you need to schedule an appointment. So what do you do? You open your SpeakWithDoc App, head to the Health Tools, and choose "Near Me". You are provided with list of health providers and their location in relation to you. do you want to head to one of them? Then just click his name and get directions. Or probably you prefer to schedule an appointment. No problem. back to health tools and choose "Get Appointment" (hmmm-clever naming of the choices right?) Now find your provider, choose your time and appointment type and book your slot. You're done!!  Ok, so you're not. You're picky and you want to ask some questions before you go to the appointment. Hhhhmmm- oh well, we can do that. Just send a message from your appointment and voila!!- Problem Solved.

Home Care

So you take care of your Mom or your Nan who lives at home with you. She needs her Cholesterol checked and her doctor tells you this has to be done in the morning before she eats anything.  The problem- you are on the morning shift at work and you have already used up all your allowed time, plus your commute is an hour and fifteen minutes one way. What do you do? Elementary really... Launch your SpeakWithDoc App, go to "My Health Tools", choose her Cholesterol Test, enter her info and address, submit. Her Test Kit arrives in the mail, you do a finger stick early the next morning, and on your way out you deposit the pre-labeled return envelope containing her sample in the mail box. You're done!! Problem Solved. Anything else...? I guess not.

More Solutions...?

Now I am going to stop myself here because I am sure that by now you get the picture. SpeakWithDoc solves a tremendous number of health related logistical problems. We connect you to what you need, when you need it. Its that simple.

What We Have Accomplished:

We already have an Android & iOS Beta application that provide the LiveChat, the Health Trivia, and a few other functionalities. This has been of tremendous help to the users we have had over the last several months. We have submitted our algorithm for Patent protection and have secured several trademarks and copyrights for works related to SpeakWithDoc. Our development has been managed by myself and Bill, my cofounder and software developer. Because of the scope of the project's design, Bill creates the architectural framework and then we use teams across the US to complete different sections of our requirements. It has been an interesting and demanding process. 

What We Hope To Accomplish With Your Help

On the face of it, we have made the SpeakWithDoc App pretty simple and user friendly but the algorithm powering this baby is anything but simple. Unlike most other applications, we are coding for bandwidth considerations, HIPAA level security, SSL encryptions, response times, device security, various server authentication protocols, management of direct communications, secure calendars and much more. All this is done while also providing our users with basic click to calls, maps, click to email, and health education through our Health Trivia Game.

The sheer scope of what I am trying to accomplish could be considered overwhelming but we don't think so, we have been working tirelessly for the past three years. The first thing we want to accomplish is to share this vision with you, a vision of improved access to healthcare information and healthcare providers. A technologically driven environment where your care is no longer limited by your geography or who you know. Instead you will always have access to health information, healthcare providers and appointments. We don't want this vision to simply remain with us while we hope to complete it, you deserve to know what we want for you.  

Funding our current goal will achieve several immediate development objectives for our iPhone interface. Our iphone interface already has the major architectural framework needed for these implementations. Our immediate objectives include:

  • A transfer of our server to the Amazon Web Services
  • Implementing the Physicians' Appointment Calendar
  • Implementig the Clients' Appointmemt Calendar
  • Implementing Appointment Reminders
  • Implementing Refill Reminders
  • Acquiring and Implementing various healthcare databases 
  • Implementing the automatic "Near Me" search functionality
  • Implementing the Medication Reminders
  • Implementing All HIPAA Security Protocols
  • Updating All Source Codes
  • Implementing All Authentication Protocols
  • Implementing Updated Server Monitoring Systems

Any additional funding received will be directed towards our Android interface as the next priority. If this can be achieved we will then implement the web interface to mirror the app functionality.

Our Target Goal is Sixty Four Thousand Dollars ($64,000.00). We ask that you FUND our cause as you see fit. We also ask that you spread the word to family, friends, co-workers and colleagues. Finally we ask that you review our accomplishment to date by downloading and testing our free Beta that is currently in both App Stores. Our heart-felt Thank You,  for considering our project, we appreciate every single effort that will allow one other person to achieve better health.

 

Meet Our Core Team:

SpeakWithDoc is led by two extremely dedicated individuals with over two decades of combined experiences in medicine, healthcare management, software development, customer care, marketing, and business development.

Dr. Shaun Jones, MD - Founder, CEO, & Chief Information Officer

Bill Williams - Co-Founder, Chief Technology Officer

 

Meet Our Extended Team

Dr. Donette Morris-Bryant, MD - Resident Physician in Charge of Client Affairs

Mr. Darrell Willis, B.Pharm - Resident Pharmacist in Charge of Medication Compliance.

Chris WIlliams, MBA - Creative Director

Sra. Lori Estrada-Willis -  Cliente Representante Experiencia

 

Risk And Challenges

Product Quality 
We have always been challenged to improve the quality of our App, particularly with respect to the user interface and the functionality. My experience with my own patients have allowed me to remain focused on a very client-centric solution, and I have had the benefit of their feedback as we continued to develop the interface. The intricacies of the requirements of our source code have been challenging to some teams due to my design requirements. During these instances, Bill has always been able to focus some attention to the specific problem and code the solution. As one who honed his software skills in the aeronautics industry, Bill provides a multifaceted, solution oriented level of coding to our development. We expect to continue our dedication to this seminal task.

HIPAA Security 
Securing Health Related information is of paramount importance to us and to all users of the App, both clients and physicians. We have employed the NIST protocols in implementing the HIPAA Security Rule on our interface. It is out of a serious sense of commitment to this high level of security that we will be transferring our server to Amazon Web Services. As a Family Physician, my commitment to this security process is second to none.

Service Experience 
One of the larger challenges that we face is to ensure the service experience of our clients remain at the highest level. As one who has provided exceptional service to my patients over the last several years, I remain vigilant in ensuring that the value that users derive from our app is in keeping with their highest expectations. This is our commitment to the process and to you the user.

Getting The Word Out 
One final challenge is getting the word out so people can improve their health by using this interface. We do our best with social media and other tools we have available but we require your help in telling everyone you know about the interface. We have created an Affiliate Program and we will host an Affiliate Challenge so we can add some fun and prizes to the process. Stay tuned to our indiegogo updates, our facebook page, and our website for those announcements.

 

Last Call

In closing, we ask for your commitment to making this world a healthier place for all of us. Choose any method you like, but please do something:

  • Spread the word
  • Fund this project
  • Download and test our Beta from either App Stores 
  • Send us your feedback

 

Our Sincerest Thanks...! May you find a sense of peace and fulfillment from your association with this project.

With Deepest Regards, 
Your SpeakWithDoc Team

 

NOTE

**WE WILL NEGOTIATE BULK SHIPPING RATES FOR OUR INTERNATIONAL SUPPORTERS AND COMMUNICATE THOSE AS NECESSARY**
story_txt:
Who We Are:
SpeakWithDoc, Inc. is a Health Information Company founded by Dr. Shaun Jones and co-founder Bill Williams in response to the need for accurate, relevant and concise information to be provided outside the confines of the doctors’ office. With the SpeakWithDoc web, iOS, and android applications, our goal is to stream-line and sync all communications between healthcare providers and patients.  
At SpeakWithDoc we understand the importance of proactively managing your health and we believe everyone should have access to healthcare providers anytime and anywhere. By better equipping Physicians and Pharmacists, and by empowering YOU- the Patient, SpeakWithDoc will improve patient care, efficiency and convenience, ultimately creating a Healthier World.
What SpeakWithDoc Provides:

Locate Physicians and Pharmacies
Schedule appointments, 
Set medication reminders, 
Get live and immediate health answers from Physicians and Pharmacists, 
Order home lab test, 
Get health reminders and more, all within a friendly interface.
**Physicians can consult with specialist colleagues, refer patients to colleagues, review appointments,  & hold secure LiveChats with their patients**, Plus more...


 
The Journey & The Genesis
One evening in 2009, an old college colleague called. The family had been seeing the specialist but was now completely frustrated with the lack of answers and no apparent resolution. I interviewed them a bit more and had them write down my recommended plan. I told them to be very polite with the Specialist, but ask if he could accommodate my plan- I had recommended a particular surgery. 
One week later they called back- the surgery was done, and it was a huge success! I was humbled by the experience but I also felt troubled by it....It was then that I had the epiphany. I thought to myself how much healthier the world would be if as Physicians we were all communicating more and if we were more connected with our patients.  This was the tipping point, and so I decided to create the means to grant improved healthcare access to all.  In December 2009 I started my R&D.
R&D
As tedious as R&D sounds, I've been having a whale of a time at it. The truth is, I had formal Computer Science training prior to medical school and so I'm comfortable in the zone. Our research was extensive, exhaustive and expensive but definitely worth every effort we put in. We covered everything from internet law and the HIPAA Technical Standards, to mobile commerce, mHealth trends, iOS, Google, and their myriad of SDK's. In spite of all that was available, nothing met my full requirements and so I had to do some designing.
The design focus was client-centric and it started with the question: "If there is a patient/client in a new city and knowing no one, how could that person get access to a physician with minimal hassle?" My answer, "Connect directly to a Physician". My next question: "How?" And this was the question I answered with the design. At the end of several months of hibernation and 18 hour days,  the SpeakWithDoc Concept was born.
We reviewed the requirements and then went shopping for additional developers. Due to the nature of the interface we had development teams in California, New York, Texas, and Pennsylvania. We finally released our Beta in January 2012. To date, we still have not released the entire interface and that is what this project is about.
Our Experience With The SpeakWithDoc Beta
We've had thousands of exchanges with users from all across the US, and across the globe. We have assisted users in London,  Egypt, Ireland, Spain, Australia, India, the United Arab Emirates, the Caribbean, among others. We have assisted the entire age range of iPhone and Android owners from teenagers to grandmothers.
Problems, Solutions, & Benefits
Second Opinion
Ok, so you just returned from the doctor, you have a bunch of medications but for some reason you are still not sure what is happening or what each medication is for. So what can you do? Well, with the SpeakWithDoc app you can securely get a second opinion or get additional information from one of our physicians. Additionally, you could have our Pharmacist help you understand the medications you received. Problem Solved 
College Students
You are in college or you have kids in college. At this stage, being away from home and having sensitive health issues to deal with, do college kids want to call their parents? Probably not. Do parents want them to take advice from other college friends about their health? Again, probably not. Enter SpeakWithDoc and the student gets to speak privately with his physician or with our physician on the fly. Now everyone is happy, Problem Solved.
Post-Surgery
You've just had surgery, and you are at home recovering. It's a rainy Sunday afternoon, but you are fairly comfy at home watching the football game. Suddenly you feel a slight pain in the area of the surgery and it looks a little different to you. Your Surgeon's office is closed but there is an ER about an hour away, what do you do? Enter SpeakWithDoc. You open a chat with your physician and send him your symptoms. From the SpeakWithDoc interface you also send him a couple pictures of the surgical area. He reviews it, assures you that its ok and your Sunday relaxation is saved. No need for a trip to the ER. Problem Solved.
Chronic Illnesses
You are diabetic and hypertensive and you have a pharmacy of medications to take- which you tend to forget because there are simply too many. You have several complications of these chronic illnesses and you experience new symptoms quite often. Many times you don't know what to do and you feel scared. You visit your doctor for your regular appointments and you don't even know where to begin. In any case, there wouldn't be enough time. So how can SpeakWithDoc help? 
Well, as the symptoms appear, you could easily start an instant chat and have an immediate discussion with one of our physicians who would provide you with the information and guidance you seek. even while the symptoms are taking place. Using our Medication Reminder System, you could enter all your medications and get prompt reminders of when to take each medication. This combined assistance would prove invaluable in improving your general health. So there you have it, Problem Solved.
The Newbie
So, you have just moved into town and you need to find a physician. If you find one, then you need to schedule an appointment. So what do you do? You open your SpeakWithDoc App, head to the Health Tools, and choose "Near Me". You are provided with list of health providers and their location in relation to you. do you want to head to one of them? Then just click his name and get directions. Or probably you prefer to schedule an appointment. No problem. back to health tools and choose "Get Appointment" (hmmm-clever naming of the choices right?) Now find your provider, choose your time and appointment type and book your slot. You're done!!  Ok, so you're not. You're picky and you want to ask some questions before you go to the appointment. Hhhhmmm- oh well, we can do that. Just send a message from your appointment and voila!!- Problem Solved.
Home Care
So you take care of your Mom or your Nan who lives at home with you. She needs her Cholesterol checked and her doctor tells you this has to be done in the morning before she eats anything.  The problem- you are on the morning shift at work and you have already used up all your allowed time, plus your commute is an hour and fifteen minutes one way. What do you do? Elementary really... Launch your SpeakWithDoc App, go to "My Health Tools", choose her Cholesterol Test, enter her info and address, submit. Her Test Kit arrives in the mail, you do a finger stick early the next morning, and on your way out you deposit the pre-labeled return envelope containing her sample in the mail box. You're done!! Problem Solved. Anything else...? I guess not.
More Solutions...?
Now I am going to stop myself here because I am sure that by now you get the picture. SpeakWithDoc solves a tremendous number of health related logistical problems. We connect you to what you need, when you need it. Its that simple.

What We Have Accomplished:
We already have an Android & iOS Beta application that provide the LiveChat, the Health Trivia, and a few other functionalities. This has been of tremendous help to the users we have had over the last several months. We have submitted our algorithm for Patent protection and have secured several trademarks and copyrights for works related to SpeakWithDoc. Our development has been managed by myself and Bill, my cofounder and software developer. Because of the scope of the project's design, Bill creates the architectural framework and then we use teams across the US to complete different sections of our requirements. It has been an interesting and demanding process. 
What We Hope To Accomplish With Your Help
On the face of it, we have made the SpeakWithDoc App pretty simple and user friendly but the algorithm powering this baby is anything but simple. Unlike most other applications, we are coding for bandwidth considerations, HIPAA level security, SSL encryptions, response times, device security, various server authentication protocols, management of direct communications, secure calendars and much more. All this is done while also providing our users with basic click to calls, maps, click to email, and health education through our Health Trivia Game.
The sheer scope of what I am trying to accomplish could be considered overwhelming but we don't think so, we have been working tirelessly for the past three years. The first thing we want to accomplish is to share this vision with you, a vision of improved access to healthcare information and healthcare providers. A technologically driven environment where your care is no longer limited by your geography or who you know. Instead you will always have access to health information, healthcare providers and appointments. We don't want this vision to simply remain with us while we hope to complete it, you deserve to know what we want for you.  
Funding our current goal will achieve several immediate development objectives for our iPhone interface. Our iphone interface already has the major architectural framework needed for these implementations. Our immediate objectives include:

A transfer of our server to the Amazon Web Services
Implementing the Physicians' Appointment Calendar
Implementig the Clients' Appointmemt Calendar
Implementing Appointment Reminders
Implementing Refill Reminders
Acquiring and Implementing various healthcare databases 
Implementing the automatic "Near Me" search functionality
Implementing the Medication Reminders
Implementing All HIPAA Security Protocols
Updating All Source Codes
Implementing All Authentication Protocols
Implementing Updated Server Monitoring Systems

Any additional funding received will be directed towards our Android interface as the next priority. If this can be achieved we will then implement the web interface to mirror the app functionality.
Our Target Goal is Sixty Four Thousand Dollars ($64,000.00). We ask that you FUND our cause as you see fit. We also ask that you spread the word to family, friends, co-workers and colleagues. Finally we ask that you review our accomplishment to date by downloading and testing our free Beta that is currently in both App Stores. Our heart-felt Thank You,  for considering our project, we appreciate every single effort that will allow one other person to achieve better health.

SpeakWithDoc is led by two extremely dedicated individuals with over two decades of combined experiences in medicine, healthcare management, software development, customer care, marketing, and business development.
Dr. Shaun Jones, MD - Founder, CEO, & Chief Information Officer
Bill Williams - Co-Founder, Chief Technology Officer


 
Meet Our Extended Team

Mr. Darrell Willis, B.Pharm - Resident Pharmacist in Charge of Medication Compliance.
Chris WIlliams, MBA - Creative Director


Sra. Lori Estrada-Willis -  Cliente Representante Experiencia

My experience with my own patients have allowed me to remain focused on a very client-centric solution, and I have had the benefit of their feedback as we continued to develop the interface. The intricacies of the requirements of our source code have been challenging to some teams due to my design requirements. During these instances, Bill has always been able to focus some attention to the specific problem and code the solution. We expect to continue our dedication to this seminal task.

story:
You Can Clean Water Contaminants without Chemicals

There is a simple way to clean your water.  According to multiple U.S. Government studies, any time viruses, molds, and bacteria come in contact with copper they are killed.  If you add zinc to the mix, you eliminate chlorine, chloramines, iron, lead, hydrogen sulfide, and hundreds of other problem contaminants from the water supply. It also reduces scale and water hardness.  Scale is a huge problem worldwide.

If you put zinc and copper together in water and do so in a special way, the net effect is these harmless metals interact to destroy virtually all the things in water that harm you.  Using sophisticated software and a 3D printer, we created a product that you can drop into water and clean the water.  Put it in a drinking glass and your water is cleaner.  Put it in your dishwasher and you eliminate water spots, scale, mold, viruses, and bacteria throughout the whole dishwasher load even while you clean the device itself.  And, these devices will be cheap to make and to own.

I got into this because I live in Florida and we have a horrible mold problem.  You can scrub it and bleach it, but it keeps coming back and it is nasty stuff.  I started looking into ways to get rid of the mold that did not involve chemicals.  I kept finding that mold will not survive contact with copper.

So I tried a test.  I put two Cool Whip bowls full of plain tap water.  In one bowl, I put just nothing but water.  In the other bowl, I dropped in a copper scrubber.  After a month, the plain water bowl was nasty and had more than just mold.  The bowl with the copper scrubber was crystal clear.  the pictures above tell the story.

I went further.  I decided if copper worked on viruses, bacteria, and mold; what would get rid of all the other contaminants.  I hit on zinc.  Zinc is amazing.  Steel everywhere is coated with zinc so zinc is safe to be around.  But, wait.  There’s more.

If you put zinc and copper together in water, they become an electrical cell and release ions.  These ions disrupt and destroy a whole host of other nasty things like chlorine, iron, lead, hydrogen sulfides and hundreds of other water-borne contaminants.  They even prevent scale from forming.  The problem is combining copper and zinc in just the right way.

I worked out the mechanics of the problem with computer software.  Once I had the physical design down, I printed a device with my 3D printer.  It worked.  Then, using the best water testing methods I could find, I proved water exposed to this device was almost instantly cleaner and safer.  The water tasted better and looked clearer.

What I have to do now is raise the money to get the molds made and the manufacturing started.  Millions of people all over the world are sick and dying because of contaminated water.  This little, inexpensive device could help save those people.

My Pledge:  If I reach my funding goal, I will donate one device to the proper charities for each device that is sold.  I will also donate one device for everyone that is claimed by a perk through a contribution.  If I do not reach my funding goals, I will print the devices on my 3D printer and send them to the contributors.

We can do this.  We can make a difference.

story:
Who are we?

   Bread Beaker was born from the idea that people want gourmet level flavor in their sandwiches, but may not have the time or money for the various ingredients.

 We use local, NON-GMO flour from Four Star Farms located right here in Massachusetts.

 +   =  

 All of our ingredients are wholesome, natural and are sure to breathe life into any dish.

                                         
          This is Bonnie & Gene                                                This is Liz                                     They own Four Star Farms!          She delivers all of our NON-GMO flour :-)


How did we get started?

  Bread Beaker was started by our founder Perry Livingston who has been cooking and baking for 10+ years. His passion came from years of watching his mom cook in the kitchen and experimenting with as many new cuisines and dishes as possible. On top of his experience cooking at home, Perry graduated from The Ohio State University with a strong focus in the sciences; perfect for honing his skills in baking bread! Seeing people smiling after they take a bite of something he has made, is one of Perry's greatest joys. 

  

To be able to share his culinary creations with the country will be a dream come true.  


  One day, Perry sat down trying to figure out how he can use both his love of cooking and science to start a business. He ran through many ideas from bake shops, fast-casual restaurants, and food trucks. It was at that moment that he got an idea. There are so many food trucks that people enjoy that make delectable gourmet sandwiches with various delicious ingredients, but what about everyone who wants to make them at home who may not have the means to buy the many ingredients these food trucks provide? What is the solution? Infuse high quality ingredients into the bread! 

What We Offer!


We offer two Three delicious Flavors that are great for any meal of the day!

Chipotle:



Bourbon Brown Sugar:


Thai Coconut:



We have a collection of recipes to get you started in our recipe guide!

                        

                



Testimonials!

Here are some great things people had to say after trying Bread Beaker Buns:

"The buns are awesome! It's so great to have extra flavor you weren't expecting when you use these buns. One less thing to worry about when you're cooking and they're full of so much flavor!

-Ali                                                                                                                                              Somerville, MA

"The Bread Beaker Buns are a delicious addition to any sandwich. Perhaps the only thing better than the taste is the appetizing smell before you take a bite."

-David                                                                                                                        Billerica, MA

"Bread Beaker rocks! They supplied the buns for my BBQ of over 20 people. We paired them with hamburgers, turkey burgers, and veggie patties. The Bourbon Buns added a sweet tang, while those interested in more kick, spiced things up with the chipotle. I will be ordering Bread Beaker for all my future parties!"

-Lizzy                                                                                                                          Jamaica Plains, MA

"The Bread Beaker Bourbon Brown Sugar Bun was extremely satisfying paired with a cheeseburger. The subtle sweetness serenaded my taste buds. I will be a loyal customer!"

-Amber                                                                                                                                      Boston, MA

"Bread Beaker Buns add a little zing to your everyday brown bag lunch!"

-Michelle                                                                                                                                     Malden, MA

"They have a light and subtle hint of flavor perfect for any sandwich."

-Kaitlyn                                                                                                                                      Boston, MA

"The Chipotle Bun is a great way to add a kick to even the most simple sandwiches!"

-Alex                                                                                                                                           Lancaster, MA

" These buns are delicious! I love the fact that you can intensify the flavor in a burger without adding mounds of condiments and other items. These are a must buy for my next BBQ.

-Jen                                                                                                                                             Charlestown, MA

"Bread Beaker Buns have Changed the way I think about sandwiches. The flavors were prominent but not overpowering, elevating the sandwich. They're soft but also strong enough to hold up to any size burger you want. My favorite was the Chipotle Buns, but I loved them both.

-Mike                                                                                                                                          Billerica, MA


Your Support

$0 - $2,500

Kitchen Rental + Distribution + Product Development

Our goal is to raise $2,500. First, we will use the money to pay for kitchen space at an amazing shared kitchen called Kitchen Local in Amesbury, Massachusetts. With this state-of-the-art kitchen, we will be able to craft our buns at a commercial level where we will grow and start to share our delicious flavors with the entire country.

                                    

In addition, it will be used to pay for state licensing fees, packaging material, bar codes, and product development of new bun flavors. Lastly, this will also allow us to travel to various supermarkets and provide them with all of the necessary paperwork so we can share our flavors with you!


$2,500+

Cross-country Visibility + Additional Product Development

All additional Funding will be dedicated to having Bread Beaker be apart of Food Festivals across the country.

 Some food festivals that we would like to attend to debut our buns include:

  • Boston Local Food Festival                       Boston, MA
  • The National Hamburger Festival            Akron, OH
  • Craft Beer Festival & Burger Bash           Palm Beach Gardens, FL
  • Austin Food & Wine Festival                      Austin, TX
  • Savor The Central Coast                            San Luis Obispo, CA

On top of attending these great food festivals we will also use the extra funds to continue to develop more unique and delicious flavors of buns as well as branch out into new categories of bread.

What do you get?


               

               

                                   Limited edition Bread Beaker T-shirt


           

                                      Exclusive Bread Beaker Sticker


                 

                                    Limited Production Recipe Guide


                          

                       

                    Limited edition and stylish Bread Beaker Tote-Bag



Your Impact

  With every contribution we get one step closer to bringing our flavors to supermarkets and homes across the country. We want to change the bread industry for the better, forever. We can only do that with your support!


Risks & Challenges

  Based on extensive research and discussions with other industry professionals, the challenge that would most likely cause delays would be delays in FDA approval of product labels and packaging for wholesale production. There are no other risks that we haven't already tackled. As soon as funding is complete we can start taking additional orders almost instantaneously.


 Once approved, Bread Beaker buns will be in production, shipped to our backers, in supermarkets across the United States and eventually the world!


Thank You!

  We wanted to take the time to thank you for coming to our indiegogo page and reading about what we have to offer.

                                    If you are unable to donate, that's ok :-)! 

                                               You can help in other ways. 

 If you believe in what we do, please share this page with everyone you know ^_^:

  • Friends
  • Family
  • Pen-pals
  • & even your pets!

  Thank you again for your support and we can't wait to show you what comes next!


Additional Information

Timeline

June 18th - July 23rd: Campaign                                                                                   July 23rd - September 2nd: Finalize kitchen rental and reward fulfillment         August 15th - December 31st: Expand to supermarkets nationwide &                                                                             apply to food festivals nationwide.


Shipping & Delivery

  We Will start delivering your Bread Beaker Buns and other swag October 2nd. Please be sure to inform us of your mailing address. We will keep you updated about the shipping status by email.

      No Matter where you live in the United States, we unconditionally                                  guarantee freshness of your buns upon arrival.


  *If you live outside the United States we will do our best to deliver your buns in the fastest, most efficient manner possible.

FAQ:

  • Will you be at any farmers markets?                                                             Yes! Starting in the first few months after successful funding, we will be at several farmers markets in the Greater Boston Area.
  • Are Bread Beaker Buns gluten free?                                                                   At this time we do not offer gluten free buns, although, we will in the very near future.
  • Can I order buns in bulk for a private event?                                                  Yes! Depending on the size of your order, and your location, we would need at least one weeks notice. In addition, we would be happy to hand deliver your order right to your door to ensure safe travels!

  • Do you provide buns to restaurants?                                                                     Yes. Please contact our owner Perry and he will discuss your needs to accommodate restaurants of any size.

  • Do they actually charge for bar codes?                                                             Yes. There is an organization called GS1, They ensure that any bar code we receive is unique against all other bar codes registered across the globe. For more information on bar codes, please visit: www.gs1.org

Contact Us

  If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at:                                                                                                                                                                                         plivingston@breadbeaker.com

Twitter: @BreadBeaker

Find us on Facebook:  www.facebook.com/breadbeaker

Visit our website:  www.BreadBeaker.com
story_txt:
Who are we?   Bread Beaker was born from the idea that people want gourmet level flavor in their sandwiches, but may not have the time or money for the various ingredients. We use local, NON-GMO flour from Four Star Farms located right here in Massachusetts.
 +   =  
 All of our ingredients are wholesome, natural and are sure to breathe life into any dish.                                                   This is Bonnie & Gene                                                This is Liz                                     They own Four Star Farms!          She delivers all of our NON-GMO flour :-)How did we get started?  Bread Beaker was started by our founder Perry Livingston who has been cooking and baking for 10+ years. His passion came from years of watching his mom cook in the kitchen and experimenting with as many new cuisines and dishes as possible. On top of his experience cooking at home, Perry graduated from The Ohio State University with a strong focus in the sciences; perfect for honing his skills in baking bread! Seeing people smiling after they take a bite of something he has made, is one of Perry's greatest joys.   To be able to share his culinary creations with the country will be a dream come true.    One day, Perry sat down trying to figure out how he can use both his love of cooking and science to start a business. He ran through many ideas from bake shops, fast-casual restaurants, and food trucks. It was at that moment that he got an idea. There are so many food trucks that people enjoy that make delectable gourmet sandwiches with various delicious ingredients, but what about everyone who wants to make them at home who may not have the means to buy the many ingredients these food trucks provide? What is the solution? Infuse high quality ingredients into the bread! What We Offer!We offer two Three delicious Flavors that are great for any meal of the day!Chipotle:Bourbon Brown Sugar:Thai Coconut:



We have a collection of recipes to get you started in our recipe guide!

                        
                

    
Testimonials!
Here are some great things people had to say after trying Bread Beaker Buns:

"The buns are awesome! It's so great to have extra flavor you weren't expecting when you use these buns. One less thing to worry about when you're cooking and they're full of so much flavor!
-Ali                                                                                                                                              Somerville, MA
"The Bread Beaker Buns are a delicious addition to any sandwich. Perhaps the only thing better than the taste is the appetizing smell before you take a bite."
-David                                                                                                                        Billerica, MA

"Bread Beaker rocks! They supplied the buns for my BBQ of over 20 people. We paired them with hamburgers, turkey burgers, and veggie patties. The Bourbon Buns added a sweet tang, while those interested in more kick, spiced things up with the chipotle. I will be ordering Bread Beaker for all my future parties!"
-Lizzy                                                                                                                          Jamaica Plains, MA


"The Bread Beaker Bourbon Brown Sugar Bun was extremely satisfying paired with a cheeseburger. The subtle sweetness serenaded my taste buds. I will be a loyal customer!"
-Amber                                                                                                                                      Boston, MA

"Bread Beaker Buns add a little zing to your everyday brown bag lunch!"
-Michelle                                                                                                                                     Malden, MA


"They have a light and subtle hint of flavor perfect for any sandwich."
-Kaitlyn                                                                                                                                      Boston, MA



"The Chipotle Bun is a great way to add a kick to even the most simple sandwiches!"
-Alex                                                                                                                                           Lancaster, MA
" These buns are delicious! I love the fact that you can intensify the flavor in a burger without adding mounds of condiments and other items. These are a must buy for my next BBQ.

-Jen                                                                                                                                             Charlestown, MA

"Bread Beaker Buns have Changed the way I think about sandwiches. The flavors were prominent but not overpowering, elevating the sandwich. They're soft but also strong enough to hold up to any size burger you want. My favorite was the Chipotle Buns, but I loved them both.
-Mike                                                                                                                                          Billerica, MA

story:
WHO WE ARE:  The Cancer Prevention and Treatment Fund is a small national charity that helps people of all ages reduce their chances of getting cancer, and helps them choose the best treatments. We’ve been designated one of America’s Best Charities.

Do you have #2minutes4cancer?  You can spend 2 minutes struggling to use the office copy machine or warming up your day-old coffee, OR you can spend it helping cancer patients get the help they need! All you need is 2 minutes on this page.

                                    

Help our team of scientists and health professionals help you and those you care about to prevent cancer and diagnose it early, and get the most effective treatments – avoiding the treatments that are likely to do more harm than good. If you’ve already been treated for cancer, we’ll help you keep it from coming back.

This Indiegogo campaign will help us share the latest treatment information with the people who need it most – the thousands of women and men facing two of the most common cancers: breast cancer and prostate cancer.

OUR CAMPAIGN: Our goal is to find new friends and supporters of all ages and from all 50 states to help us raise $10,000 to create new prostate and breast cancer guides -- and each $1 you donate will be matched by $2 more for our cancer hotline, which helps thousands of patients get the best possible treatment.

Groundbreaking cancer research is wasted when patients and their doctors don’t have immediate access to the latest results. 100-page grant proposals take too long to write and get funded.  With your help we can quickly finalize and distribute cancer guides that include the most up-to-date research – free help for whoever needs it!

OUR PROMISE TO YOU: We are worth 2 minutes of your time. Check out our web site (stopcancerfund.org) or send us your questions at info@stopcancerfund.org. And when you donate, be sure to tell us something special about you or which state you live in, so we can give you a special shout out if you’re a “first” for the campaign [So far we have New York, Florida, Massachusetts, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Colorado, Virginia, Washington, DC, California and …]

story:
Liberia is in the midst of the most lethal Ebola epidemic in history.

The Ebola virus disease is highly contagious, has no known treatment or cure, and is fatal within days or weeks in most cases. 

The rapid spread of the Ebola Virus Disease throughout Liberia since March 2014 continues to overwhelm the country’s healthcare system, thus limiting the ability of the nation to respond.  In an effort to contain the disease, the President declared a State of Emergency on August 6, instituted a nation-wide curfew and established the National Ebola Task Force. As the outbreak continues to grow, access to information on the risks of Ebola still remain a challenge. The international community understands that West African countries, including Liberia, cannot beat Ebola on their own. The challenge now is for all the international, national and local actors to work together in an efficient way to tackle the Ebola outbreak.

“There is a dire need for emergency response funds and intervention plans. Most hospitals lack basic equipment and are chronically understaffed. Health systems strengthening is crucial”.
 
“We can’t lose this battle. We need to scale up the response immediately to ensure that people do not continue to die of preventable diseases and neglect.  Right now, what we do have is a committed young people who have passion in humanity, capacity and strategy to reach out to the most marginalized communities of Liberia. If youth within their various communities can get the message across that, public health workers are working to eradicate the virus, it can mobilize communities to work alongside government in the fight against Ebola.”

This is the first major outbreak of the Ebola virus in West Africa and communities in the region are struggling to contain the epidemic. To respond to a public health crisis on this scale, organizations on the ground need fresh medical supplies for people who have been infected and protective equipment to prevent further spread of this deadly disease. Your donation will help buy these vital supplies.

It’s easy to take it for granted, but educational campaigns are just as important as gloves and face masks when fighting an epidemic. Citizens in Liberia lack basic knowledge about Ebola, how it spreads, and what to do if you think you or a family member might have it. Your donation will help dispel misinformation and prevent ripple effects that can have life-and-death consequences.
Witnessing an epidemic of this severity from afar can feel overwhelming. We are seeing a rare, deadly disease devastate communities that have never before dealt with an outbreak on this scale.

Your gift and donation today can help make sure that the Youth Partnership for Peace and Development (YPPD) Liberia on the ground has the best chance of stopping this outbreak before it spreads further.

Supportive care by concerned citizens and well-wishers the world over can reduce the number of deaths and help contain the spread of the disease. Since May of 2014, we have also spearheaded an ongoing, awareness campaigns, educating hundreds of thousands of people on Ebola prevention and care.

The objectives of this campaigns are as follow:

i. Tell others about how they can reduce and stop the spread of Ebola

ii. Tell others about how to protect themselves, their families and their communities from Ebola

iii. Show others the different ways they can protect themselves and stop the spread of the deadly Ebola virus

iv. Report on the different Inter-Personal-Relation (IPC) activities about Ebola that we conduct in our community and

v. Refer any child who shows signs of malnutrition.


The project will provide:

  • 30 days door to door 'meet one and teach one' awareness raising campaign in the four (4) sub-cities of Montserrado County and 7 Districts of Lofa County, targeting at least 3000 households
  • Provide food stuffs to at least 25 quarantined households
  • 2500 posters printed with anti-ebola and violence prevention messages and the KAP tool use to gauge feedback from the target communities
  • 30 Street theaters, 7 community radio broadcasts in the 2 Counties of Liberia
  • 1000 hand washing stations with dettol/chlorine and soap made available across the Montserrado and Lofa Counties encouraging people to abide by the basic preventive measures of washing hands frequently

Supporting one quarantined household/family, one at a time will continue restoring confidence. Help us breath life into an already serious situation in Liberia.

What We Need & What You Get

As a single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees. The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves as no person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.

Together, we can make a healthier country once again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us reach out to more potential supporters out there as together we all search for solutions. Sharing this page and personally reaching out to other philanthropist is a good ways to help support this campaign.

2500 posters printed with anti-ebola and violence prevention messages and the KAP tool use to gauge feedback from the target communities
30 Street theaters, 7 community radio broadcasts in the 2 Counties of Liberia
1000 hand washing stations with dettol/chlorine and soap made available across the Montserrado and Lofa Counties encouraging people to abide by the basic preventive measures of washing hands frequently
Supporting one quarantined household/family, one at a time will continue restoring confidence. Help us breath life into an already serious situation in Liberia.
What We Need & What You Get
 
As a single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees. The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves as no person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
Together, we can make a healthier country once again.
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 Help us reach out to more potential supporters out there as together we all search for solutions. Sharing this page and personally reaching out to other philanthropist is a good ways to help support this campaign.

story: Our four year old little boy, Nathan has been sick his entire life. He has suffered from extreme eczema that has caused systemic infections, food allergies (he can't have anything containing milk,eggs,corn,soy,sesame seeds, peanuts,tree nuts and mustard.... we have had to get very inventive :) ), environmental allergies, Asthma, reactive airway disease, sleep apnea, leg deformities and constant infections. He has never gone a single week without being on medications. He is in constant misery but he tries so hard to keep a smile on his face. He is so understanding about not being able to have the same things (food) that other kids can have.( Nathan asked since Santa is magic if he can ask for all of his "owies and sick" to go away instead of a present how sweet). Nathan is so brave, he visits doctors on average a couple of times a week. He also has a couple of surgeries coming up in a couple of weeks. The doctors believe that he has a rare genetic disorder called Job syndrome. With this syndrome Nathan has essentially no immune system and it causes bone deformities so it is unhealthy for him to be in a daycare environment. Nathan's mom who is a nurse is no longer able to work so she can stay home with Nathan to keep him as healthy as possible. We held out so much hope that someday he would grow out of all of this and become a healthy little boy that he should be but we found out that there is no cure for Job syndrome, all we can do is treat the infections, home IV therapy and someday maybe a bone marrow transplant. Lifespan for this syndrome is 3-29 years old but we know that Nathan can beat the odds. Our goal is to prevent infections and to keep our little man as comfortable as possible. With all of the medical bills and one less income this has become a huge finical issue. Any money raised will help pay medical bills and to be able to keep Nathan home in a safe environment. Please pass the word around for us. We could use any help we can get. If nothing else, please keep Nathan in your thoughts and share his story with others. This little guy has had to deal with so much that most adults haven't even had to deal with but yet he will be the first to give a warm snuggly hug when someone else is feeling sad. He is so caring and loving.

story:
Our Camp Care Therapeutic Riding Program needs your help in supporting the expansion of our program and its ongoing operations! Your donation will help more individuals with disabilities to ride and to achieve the many benefits the program has to offer.

In the past, our big fundraisers have been in the form of a gala or program event. This year we decided to present our fundraiser with an outreach directly to the community so you can see, hear and know some of the amazing people (and horses) who benefit from this program.

 
"This program has benefited my daughter Sophia in a magnitude of ways.  Frankly, its priceless.  You see my daughter cannot talk.  She has avenues at communication, but this is extremely difficult for her.  When she is upset she will cry, when happy she will smile.  The sole point in my living is to see or facilitate her smiles.  As her father I try my hardest.  But I have found, nothing will stimulate her smiling like that of working with the Camp Care horses and staff.  There is a bond here, particularly with the horses, which I cannot explain.  The horse of course is non verbal as is my daughter.  Yet there is this energy/feeling/bond which exists between the two.  This time provided is just so important for my daughter’s overall health, and energy.  The positive effects here apply to our whole family as well.  When Sophia smiles, our whole family smiles", Sophia's dad

Our riders, donors, volunteers, and staff want to invite you to be a part of our community! This venue allows you a chance to see, hear and feel what transpires at the Camp Care Therapeutic Riding Program, and promises that the majority of dollars raised will go directly to the program.

Camp Care's Therapeutic Riding Program

Camp Care provides equine assisted activities to individuals with disabilities through a therapeutic riding program.  The therapeutic benefits of horseback riding are numerous and recognized as beneficial by many medical professions, including the American Physical Therapy Association and The American Occupational Therapy Association. The Therapeutic Riding program began in 2003 with one riding session and in November 2012 expanded to a year round program due to the completion of an indoor riding arena.

Camp Care’s Therapeutic Riding Program has been named a Premier Accredited Center by PATH, Int’l, The Professional Association of Therapeutic Horsemanship, and International. This prestigious accreditation recognizes Camp Care’s excellence in providing equine-assisted activities

“It has given me such joy. I also get my horse ready before I ride, and it helps me to get closer and more mature. Riding makes me feel very happy and proud.” rider Ben

The Impact

The therapeutic benefits of horseback riding are numerous and recognized as beneficial by many medical professions, including the American Physical Therapy Association and The American Occupational Therapy Association.

“As physical therapists we believe in the value of exercise and movement. We encourage stretching, strengthening, stability and balance exercises. We also promote movement through the developmental sequence, especially with individuals with special needs. No matter what our abilities, our bodies thrive through movement. Therapeutic riding provides a unique opportunity for the rider to understand, be inspired, and respond to the horse's gait pattern. The horse is a wonderful adjunct to encouraging movement and expanding the rider's world.” Laureen Moran PT, Executive Director, Camp Care

Expanding Our Program

We have now begun construction on a new “Sensory Trail”. A Sensory Riding Trail is a rich learning environment of woodland path that consist of natural sights and sounds, and man-made “activity stations.” This integrated environment challenges the students’ balance, stimulates their senses and encourages them to interact with the world around them. We will keep you posted with updates as we progress!

 

Our Status

Camp Care Inc is a 501 © 3 non profit organization and all donations are tax deductible. We have recently earned Gold Star status from GuideStar because of the high level of transparency as a non profit organization. GuideStar's Mission is to revolutionize philanthropy by providing information that advances transparency, enables users to make better decisions, and encourages charitable giving.


“The work they do makes a real difference in the quality of people’s lives.” Donors Arlene and Dr. Milt Berkman

“We donate to the Camp Care Riding Program because one of us, Joan, participates and experiences its benefits. We see how much the lessons help children and adults become physically, mentally, and emotionally healthier.”

--Joan & Stu Sidney

story:
We have successfully reached our original minimum goal of raising 30,000  dollars!

Our next goal is 50,000 dollars.

If we will reach that goal we will donate 10 EyeControl sets for patients in developing countries

                             

ALS (also known as Lou Gehrig's Disease or MND) patients represent a subgroup of people with fully functional cognitive abilities who gradually lose their speech and the use of their upper limbs, and cannot communicate with their environment due to physical limitations (they’re "locked-in").

The existing communication means are expensive, cumbersome to calibrate, but most of all, they're not mobile.


Even if a patient can afford to buy them, those tools cannot be used without a dedicated computer.


These means limit the communication to times when patients are in front of the screen and cannot be used when in bed, on the go (perhaps on a wheelchair), in the car etc. 


This limits the patient and can endanger their lives.
       

Improve the quality of life for "locked-in" patients by providing a cheap, accessible, automatically calibrated and mobile means of communication.



 

An infra-red camera connected to a simple glasses frame and communicates
with a credit-card sized computer which identifies and translates the blinks and movements of the user’s eyes into commands which will output in sound, to earphones and to a speaker. 

In addition, it can transmit these to a smartphone via bluetooth.

 The smartphone run application which enables the patient to communicate using text to speech mechanism.
 We provide a 3 modes solution:

  1. An alert sound,calling for assistance.
  2. Choosing from predefined sentences (e.g. "I'm cold", "My hand hurts", "I need to pee").
  3. Composing sentences using virtual boards which resemble the alphabet.



  • Patent pending 
  • Working prototype
  • Application to the Israeli chief scientist office
  • Last preparations for a pilot with patients - insurance, bug fixes, caregivers etc.
  • With your help we will bring this innovative solution to the market at an affordable price so “locked-in” patients from all over the world can own one.

  • With your help we will begin a comprehensive pilot with the participation of dozens of patients in order to make the necessary improvements that make it as effective as possible.

  • With your help we will design a head mounted device for the camera, improve the eye tracking algorithm, and develop more features for our mobile app.

                              

        

 

 

            

    




Omri Hotam 
Avichai KremerGaya Nathan




                                     
                                             
            

                                                                
      

                

 
            

Q: How long have you been working on the product?

A: A year , since June 2014.


Q: Where you want to see this product in 3 years?

A: We want this product to be used in every locked-in patient house, worldwide.


Q: What are your plans for the R&D for the next year?

A: We want to continue to develop the EyeControl, To make sure that there are no bugs in it. To improve its calibration and its free speech abilities.


Q: How did you fund the project till now?

A: We got donations by private people, companies and a foundation.


Q: Do you have any IP?

A: Yes, we are in the stage of patent pending.


Q:How can you know the device is safe for the eyes?

A: The infra-red camera was tested by the standards institution of Israel and was approved.


Q:Why do you ask for 30,000 dollars?

A: We are waiting for approval of funding from the Israeli chief scientist. Together with the money from the Indiegogo campaign we will be able to achieve our next R&D plans.
