story:
Meet the 6GCool Mobile Air Purifier

The world´s most powerful portable air purifier. The 6GCool goes with you anywhere so you can have clean air everywhere.

HEPA + PECO Filtration = The Best Protection

6GCool's advanced filtration system offers unrivalled performance compared to other air purifiers of similar size or even many of the much larger devices. 

 

The first powerful high-tech air purifier that fits in your pocket

The innovation is simple, yet radical. We compressed the power of larger air purifiers into a pocket-sized device.

 

 

Small, yet powerful!

6G inhales dirty air from the bottom and releases clean fresh air out from the top, through an adjustable outlet. ​Our team has over 30 years of dedication to innovation in air filtration technologies. The 6GCool is the first air purifier to use the industry standard HEPA filtration together with state-of-art PECO filtration technology. 

 

 

Enjoy Clean Air Everywhere! 

The 6GCool uses our patented 4-step filtration process to create a zone of safe air around you. 6G allows you to take clean air to where it has previously been impossible. It is perfect for:

 

 

More comfortable than a normal mask

Face masks are great for protecting OTHERS, but the 6GCool is made for protecting YOU. The 6G is not only more comfortable to wear but it has the most sophisticated filtration system available in a carry on size.

 

 

 

The Science Of Clean Air

6GCool uses our patented 4-step filtration process, including HEPA filter, anti-bacterial TiO2 layer, air ioniser and UV light.

 

6GCool  is capable of outputting 2.43 m3/h of clean air, an impressive number for a small air purifier!

 


A Revolutionary Way To Purify Air

Instead of cleaning the ambient air around you, 6G creates a personal zone of clean air where you need it. This is a new innovative approach to cleaning air!

 

The 6GCool uses 4 filtration steps for maximum protection!

6GCool has been tested by renowned independent laboratories to global standards, including particle filtration test PM2.5, PM1.0 and PM0.5 (GB/T 18801-2015). 

 

 

Order your 6GCool now on Indiegogo

Shipping in January 2021!

What you get? The 6GCool Mobile Air Purifier, Adjustable Neck Strap, Charging Cable and 5 x Filters (typically gets over 6 months of use).

Replacement filter packs are available with the checkout.

 

 

 

Press

 

 

Scandinavian Design & Function

 

But I already have an air purifier inside my home, why would I need the 6G?

The problem is often you are the most exposed to dirty air while you are on the move: commuting, travelling, at the office or socialising. Before there has not really been a good way to protect yourself. Now there is with 6G. We think this is a revolutionary new approach to clean air. 

 

Unboxing the pre-production samples! 

 

When we started designing 6G over a year ago, we had no idea we would be launching it amidst the worst air catastrophes in our generation. Over the last few months, we have had to do a lot of additional tests to make sure the 6G is 2020 proof. 

 

Shipping in December 2020!

We have worked extra hard to bring the 6GCool to the market and we are happy to announce the device is ready to start shipping before the end of 2020. 

 

 

 

Quiet 6200 rpm/min fan

We designed 6G to have 3 operating modes – turbo, medium and silent – to suit your busy life. Turbo Mode expels larger volume of clean air out and is perfect for when you are on the move or in a crowded environment whereas the Silent Mode is perfect in a more stationary situation where you need the air purifier to work in the background.

Turbo mode pushes as much as 2.8m/s of filtered clean air out through the adjustable outlet.

 

 

Adjustable neck strap

Every air purifier includes an adjustable neck strap for you to easily carry the device around your neck while using it or to attach it to your outfit. Our neck strap includes quick release clips for easy removal and safety breakaway clip.

 

Testing & Certifications

The power of 6G is based on the innovation of creating a personal clean air zone. Instead of cleaning a large room, 6G focuses on cleaning the air around your face.

 

Performance testing

We have tested 6G against the common air pollutants PM2.5, PM1.0 and PM0.5. For more test results please visit our website.

We have teamed up with globally renowned labs in Europe and Asia to run the 6GCool through some of the most rigorous testing protocols. 

 

 

Simple To Use

We designed the 6G to adapt to your life on the go. 

 

 

Our Patented 6G Filter Technology

1. Pre-Filter guides the air for the HEPA filter below and protects it from direct exposure to large particles. 2. HEPA Filter (High efficiency particle filter) 3. Titanium Dioxide Coated membrane is the chemical element of the photo electrochemical oxidation or PECO. 4. Air Ionizer is charging air with negative ions and is the electro element of the photo electrochemical oxidation or PECO. 5. UV type-A LEDs radiate disinfecting UV light on the titanium dioxide-coated filter surface and hence is the photo element of the photo electrochemical oxidation or PECO. (NOTE! We don’t use UV-C type LEDs that can emit harmful Ozone into your breathing air) 6. Electric Fan has two fan speeds: Turbo & Quiet mode 7. Lithium Ion Battery: 1450mAh lithium ion battery 8. Clean Air Guide allows you to direct the air flow towards your face  

 

How does the particle filtration work?

1. H12 HEPA filter: HEPA filter is our first filtration step and already captures the majority of the airborne particles. 

2. Titanium Dioxide coating initiates a chemical reaction (with UV-light) which creates mini compounds called hydroxyl radicals. These mini compounds then react with bigger harmful chemicals/compounds and chop them down to harmless compounds.

3. Ionizer: Negative ionizer enhances the filtration efficiency of UV-light and TiO2 coating.

4. UV-A LEDs finalizes the chemical reaction (with TiO2 coating) which creates mini compounds called hydroxyl radicals. These mini compounds then react with bigger harmful chemicals/compounds and chop them down to harmless compounds.    

 

6G Filters With Antibacterial TiO2 Layer

 

 

How often does the filter need replacing?

 

For Indiegogo, we will give 6 months worth extra filters for free with every device!

 

 

Pledging

Note! Shipping and Taxes (if applicable) will be charged after the campaign.

Shipping prices are fluctuating heavily during these times, so we will collect them after the campaign has ended, through a separate survey we sent to every backer.

We want to offer a couple of different shipping options for our backers based on the urgency to get the product. Please refer to the table below for shipping charge estimates.

 

 

Shipping, taxes and duties (if applicable) will be calculated and paid for after the campaign, through a separate survey we will send to every customer.

 

  • Guaranteed Delivery — 6GCool has already entered mass production and we have made significant investments to produce the tooling, buy the materials and components needed to produce the first production run of the product.

  • 1-Year Warranty — If the product malfunctions during the first year of use, we will replace it for you!

 

 

Technical Specifications

 

 

Innovative Design

A lot of out-of-the-box thinking went into the 6GCool.

Compressing all the state-of-art technology into a size of a smartphone was a big challenge. Besides superior function, we wanted 6G to be ergonomic to use.  The predominant design feature is the eye-catching front grill that optimises the air suction to the underlying HEPA filter.

Keeping the product clean and easy to disinfect was also important. In the end we arrived to a minimalistic design.

Working on the final CAD drawings for the production molds. 

Injection tooling ready at our factory in October 2020.

 

Product Timeline

When we started designing 6G over a year ago, we had no idea we would be launching it amidst the worst air catastrophes in our generation. Over the last few months, we have had to do a lot of additional tests to make sure the 6G is 2020 proof. The design has now been completed, the product has gone through initial testing and we are now moving into production with our manufacturing partners. All the electronics have been sourced and we have a trusted manufacturing partner who can assemble the product. We do our own quality control and order fulfilment from our Hong Kong office. Currently, we are looking at December 2020 to start shipping the products to our first backers.

 

Meet The Founder

Janette Mäkipää, CTO of 6GCool

Growing up in Finland, Janette got used to two kinds of fresh air: the clean air out in the pristine Finnish wilderness and the clean air that the technologies her family business produced. After completing her Masters degree in Air Quality Control at the University of Stuttgart in 2018, Janette joined the family business. It didn´t take long for some fresh new ideas to take shape, leading eventually to the creation of the 6GCool, a consumer device encapsulating the most state-of-art technology to clean air.

 

Meet the Team

 

6G Cool is a Lifa Air spin-off company. 

6G is a family company, founded by clean air experts, Vesa, Eppu and Janette Mäkipää, after discovering the growing demand for the right to healthy air in metropolitan cities around the world.

They created 6GCool as a spin-off company from the family business Lifa Air, a globally renowned manufacturer of clean air solutions with over 30 years of experience in the field. Read More about Lifa Air.

Year 2020 has been quite a year in the air purification industry! 

6G is using the next generation purification technology and is our first direct to consumer product. For these reasons and for the ambitious goal to revolutionize personal clean air, we have decided to go to market through crowdfunding with a spin-off company. 

Professional Associations: Member of EVHA, Associate member of NADCA (USA), Member of Finnish Indoor Air Society, Member of Association of Finnish Hospital Engineering, Member of REHVA (Federation of European Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning Associations

Our Research and Development Partners: VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, HUT - Helsinki University of Technology, Tekes - Finnish Funding Agency for Technology and Innovation, UEF - University of Eastern-Finland, HKPU - Hong Kong Polytechnic University

Awards: iF design award in 2017, RedDot design award in 2017

 

Are you ready for a life under the new normal?

We designed 6G before 2020 - the worst year in air quality the world has ever seen - but the 6GCool sure can handle it.

story:
What We Need

  • By reaching out goal of $8000, we can help buy and build a water filter for a small town in India called Nemua, Bihar.
  • If you donate, through Humanure Power, you will be updated on their progress and success.
  • If our goal is not reached, we will still donate our money in efforts to relieve families of the sanitation crisis that effects their lives every day.

The Impact

  • Only 31% of India's population has access to improved sanitation. 
  • 67% of families in India do not treat their drinking water, even if it is contaminated.
  • 50% of India's population defecates outside.
  • This contaminates the water and contributes to the spread of disease.
  • By helping these families, we can see these statistics improved and people just like you will stand a chance.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page and our video with friends and family and help get the facts known!
  • You can make a difference!
story_txt:
What We Need

By reaching out goal of $8000, we can help buy and build a water filter for a small town in India called Nemua, Bihar.
If you donate, through Humanure Power, you will be updated on their progress and success.
If our goal is not reached, we will still donate our money in efforts to relieve families of the sanitation crisis that effects their lives every day.
The Impact
Only 31% of India's population has access to improved sanitation. 
67% of families in India do not treat their drinking water, even if it is contaminated.
50% of India's population defecates outside.
This contaminates the water and contributes to the spread of disease.
By helping these families, we can see these statistics improved and people just like you will stand a chance.
Other Ways You Can Help
Share this page and our video with friends and family and help get the facts known!
You can make a difference!

story:
Short Summary

*Update: Diem was so sure she didn't have enough friends to meet our goal of $3,000, but we've raised nearly $6,000 already. Her surgery can cost up to $12k, so thank you to everyone for your love and well wishes.

Diem was diagnosed with breast cancer this past December. She will be undergoing surgery for a double mastectomy, and having her eggs frozen to preserve her fertility options after chemo and hormone therapy. Insurance covers most of the cancer treatment, but freezing your eggs is considered elective and we're raising funds to help Diem offset the costs.

While we can't make her cancer disappear, we can help Diem find a little peace of mind amidst the chaos that is cancer. We felt that this was the best way to show our support and love for Diem--to give her the chance to start her own family, as we all begin to start ours. 

We've set our fundraising limit at $3,000, but the treatment can cost up to $12,000. Indiegogo takes a much bigger % if you don't meet your fundraising goal. Every bit helps, so thank you for reading!

Wait, did you say Diem has breast cancer?

It's relatively rare for a person under 40 to be diagnosed with breast cancer, but the lump in Diem's breast turned out to be a tumor. Diem has invasive lobular cancer (ILC) and has decided to have a double mastectomy, followed by breast reconstruction. We don't know if the cancer has spread, and won't know until the doctors check her lymph nodes during the surgery. But whatever it is, Diem is going to battle her way back to health and come out on top. 

What does breast cancer have to do with fertility?

Women are born with a finite number of eggs. Diem will be undergoing 12 weeks of chemo following her surgery. One of the unintended side effects of chemo is that it damages your ovaries and kills your eggs in reserve. But while Diem will only lose three months worth of eggs during her chemotherapy, she has to wait an additional five years before she can get pregnant. During that time, she will be taking tamoxifen, which acts as an anti-estrogen, since estrogen fuels the growth of her cancer. At the age of 34, your eggs are less viable than they are when you are 28. And considering that chemo and tamoxifen could send Diem into menopause as early as 35, she's doing everything she can to maximize her chances of starting a family. 

Doesn't insurance pay for this? 

Fortunately, Diem's insurance covers most of the costs associated with her cancer treatment, including the mastectomy, breast reconstruction, chemotherapy and hormone treatment. However, insurance only covers the freezing of eggs, if you are already infertile. In Diem's case, she can get the treatment at a reduced cost, but will still end up paying $6000 - $12,000 out of pocket, since she's only at risk of infertility.  

What's my donation get me? 

For those of you who know, grew up with, and love Diem, you know that she is the biggest sweetheart. We can't imagine a world without her and her future little ones! Diem promises to take her progeny out for playdates with you/your family. And of course, a thank you from the bottom of her heart. As a special one time offer, order today and get regular video updates from the lady herself!

While we can't make her cancer disappear, we can help Diem find a little peace of mind amidst the chaos that is cancer. We felt that this was the best way to show our support and love for Diem--to give her the chance to start her own family, as we all begin to start ours. 

-- With love from Niki and Monica (with Diem's consent)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Send Diem photos of the cutest animals you find on the interwebs
  • Send photos of your favorite breasts for inclusion on (NSFW!) the blog (NSFW!)
  • Help spread the word by sharing our campaign for the Lil' Diems Fund
story_txt:
Short Summary*Update: Diem was so sure she didn't have enough friends to meet our goal of $3,000, but we've raised nearly $6,000 already. Her surgery can cost up to $12k, so thank you to everyone for your love and well wishes.Diem was diagnosed with breast cancer this past December. She will be undergoing surgery for a double mastectomy, and having her eggs frozen to preserve her fertility options after chemo and hormone therapy. Insurance covers most of the cancer treatment, but freezing your eggs is considered elective and we're raising funds to help Diem offset the costs.While we can't make her cancer disappear, we can help Diem find a little peace of mind amidst the chaos that is cancer. We felt that this was the best way to show our support and love for Diem--to give her the chance to start her own family, as we all begin to start ours. We've set our fundraising limit at $3,000, but the treatment can cost up to $12,000. Indiegogo takes a much bigger % if you don't meet your fundraising goal. Every bit helps, so thank you for reading!Wait, did you say Diem has breast cancer?It's relatively rare for a person under 40 to be diagnosed with breast cancer, but the lump in Diem's breast turned out to be a tumor. Diem has invasive lobular cancer (ILC) and has decided to have a double mastectomy, followed by breast reconstruction. We don't know if the cancer has spread, and won't know until the doctors check her lymph nodes during the surgery. But whatever it is, Diem is going to battle her way back to health and come out on top. What does breast cancer have to do with fertility?Women are born with a finite number of eggs. Diem will be undergoing 12 weeks of chemo following her surgery. One of the unintended side effects of chemo is that it damages your ovaries and kills your eggs in reserve. But while Diem will only lose three months worth of eggs during her chemotherapy, she has to wait an additional five years before she can get pregnant. During that time, she will be taking tamoxifen, which acts as an anti-estrogen, since estrogen fuels the growth of her cancer. At the age of 34, your eggs are less viable than they are when you are 28. And considering that chemo and tamoxifen could send Diem into menopause as early as 35, she's doing everything she can to maximize her chances of starting a family. Doesn't insurance pay for this? Fortunately, Diem's insurance covers most of the costs associated with her cancer treatment, including the mastectomy, breast reconstruction, chemotherapy and hormone treatment. However, insurance only covers the freezing of eggs, if you are already infertile. In Diem's case, she can get the treatment at a reduced cost, but will still end up paying $6000 - $12,000 out of pocket, since she's only at risk of infertility.  What's my donation get me? For those of you who know, grew up with, and love Diem, you know that she is the biggest sweetheart. We can't imagine a world without her and her future little ones! Diem promises to take her progeny out for playdates with you/your family. And of course, a thank you from the bottom of her heart. As a special one time offer, order today and get regular video updates from the lady herself!While we can't make her cancer disappear, we can help Diem find a little peace of mind amidst the chaos that is cancer. We felt that this was the best way to show our support and love for Diem--to give her the chance to start her own family, as we all begin to start ours. -- With love from Niki and Monica (with Diem's consent)Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Send Diem photos of the cutest animals you find on the interwebs
Send photos of your favorite breasts for inclusion on (NSFW!) the blog (NSFW!)

Help spread the word by sharing our campaign for the Lil' Diems Fund

story:
Beat Cancer - Nuke the Leuk!

Levi was recently diagnosed with Leukemia, a cancer of the blood. Unfortunately for cancer, Levi is a certified gunslinger, pokemon master, and personal trainer. 

He's ready to battle, and all of us are ready to support him in this battle.

Levi and #TeamPratt need you

While Levi is most certainly ready to battle, he could use everyone's support. Levi and Mayra are facing some tough emotional, physical, and economical times. We hope to be able to support them in all of these areas through our campaign.

There are several ways to donate and show your love and support. Every bit helps. If you feel the desire to donate money, there are several options available. For each option, there are different gifts we'd like to send your way. Even if you can't, remember that your prayers are most important!

#TeamPratt Swag

(Note: We will make two orders for t-shirts so as to keep costs low. The first will be for those who donate prior to April 15. The second for those who donate between April 15 and June 1.) 

Bracelets will read #TeamPratt and Beat Cancer - Orange is the color for Leukemia 

Post Your Pics

Once you get your swag, post your pics to the Team Pratt facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/teampratt

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray. Pray. Pray. And share the word. Your love and prayers are felt.

Even if you can't donate but you would like wristbands, send an e-mail to loganmpratt@gmail.com and we will make sure you represent #teampratt

Thank you!!!

story:
It was really hard to make a decision with making this campaign, but we all have tough times and would like some cushioning to get back our feet. Ever since I lost my apartment back in August it's been terrible finding work and I exhausted my savings.  I currently stay on campus at my university to alleviate my living situation temporarily, but it's close to the end of the semester and it seems like my luck with funds have run out, so if you are able to donate, it would really help me out so much. Thank you. /(*x*)\

This is what you're helping me with!

  • Summer Storage for Stony Brook University from May-September
  • Transportation for job hunting
  • Phone coverage for 2 months
  • Food for groceries

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Share the link if you can!

story:
On 5/9/12 Nikki (Jayden's mommy) took him and his brother Jaxson to the doctor, both were sick with colds. She was told that Jayden had a double ear infection, they were sent home with some medicine. By 5:30 PM that evening, his parents had him at Parkview Main's E.R... Jayden was lethargic, his eyes glazed over, his little body so weak he couldn't move. It was when they got him to the E.R. that he started to seize every 3 to 4 minutes. He was given medicine but still continued to have the seizures. It was then that they decided to transport him to Parkview North's I.C.U... He was in the I.C.U. for approximately a week. He didn't open his eyes for two days. He just lay there not moving. There were numerous vials of blood taken for testing, (2) MRI's, a Spinal Tap, E.E.G. and many more tests. After all that, there is still no diagnosis; however, after several weeks, Jayden IS making progress. He has woken up, smiles and moves his arms and legs. He still does not talk, walk, feed himself or hold his head up. It's as if Jayden has reverted to a newborn baby and has to re-learn how to be a 3 year old. They still have no diagnosis, no answers to what caused this devastating illness and the regression it produced. For now they are calling it a "virus". Mommy has had to stop working to be with Jayden. Jayden was released from the hospital May 23rd; they believe being in his home environment will be the best therapy for now. They will keep assessing his progress and may decide he needs in house therapy in the future. The family feels blessed just to have him home to celebrate his 3rd birthday May 28th! Please pray for Jayden so that he continues to get better every day!

News:

http://www.fortwayne.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20120602/NEWS/320116005

story:
The Foreplay (Backstory)

On the 1st March, 'Conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh called a Georgetown Law School student a â€œslutâ€ and a â€œprostituteâ€ the week after she argued that birth control should be covered by health insurance at religious institutions' as reported in the Washington Post.


The Main Event (Idea) 


Make the man who is so opposed to birth control the face of birth control at Colleges around America. We will make sure that he is literally at the front line of birth control by making custom Rush Limbaugh condoms to be distributed for free at Colleges around America. 


The Cuddles (Execution) 


We will create 500 condoms with Limbaugh face on every condom, produced by Condommania and then personally hand them out to NYU students. We will make sure to get plenty of photos of this joyous occasion.

story:
The Southerner

***PLEASE NOTE! ***
MANY CONTRIBUTORS HAVE HAD ISSUES MAKING PAYMENTS, MAINLY BECAUSE INDIGOGO'S PLATFORM DOES NOT SUPPORT OUTDATED BROWSERS. IF YOU ARE HAVING TROUBLE, PLEASE TRY UPDATING YOUR WEB BROWSER OR GO TO INDIGOGO'S CUSTOMER HAPPINESS PAGE FOR ASSISTANCE, OR FEEL FREE TO CONTACT US DIRECTLY AT mgmillar90@gmail.com. THANKS, AND WE APOLOGIZE FOR ANY HASSLE.

The Southerner's story begins in 1954 when Matthew's grandparents moved with his then infant mother from the foothills of east Tennessee to the boomtown of Detroit, Michigan to work in the auto industry. Many other southern families did the same and naturally their cultural and culinary habits came with them.

The place in Tennessee where Matthew's mother's family comes from is rural and poor, but humble means in the hands of practiced and knowledgeable cooks made simple fare like crispy fried chicken, rich buttery biscuits, peppery cress, and fat, ice cold chunks of juicy watermelon feel like an embarrassment of riches.

Matthew and Katie came together because they both believe that a well laid table surrounded by the people you love makes for good living. They are making this ideal the central  ambition at The Southerner. Add to that a few ounces of fussed over barrel aged liquor or a carefully crafted cocktail which honors the spirit of the spirit, and you have the makings of a perfect summer night. 

And because The Southerner's home in west Michigan is home to a burgeoning food scene and has long been one of the midwest's most vital agricultural producers, we think it'll be the perfect place for such nights to happen. Cider, wine, and cheese makers, brewers, bakers, chefs and restauranteurs and farmers are drawn to this place and its abundant agrarian landscape and like minded peers, not to mention the stunning natural beauty of Lake Michigan. With your help, we can be a part of the next era in the region's history, an era where the world swivels its head to see what we'll be doing next.

What We're Looking For

Though the principal means of financing The Southerner is being sought from private equity capital, we felt a strong inclination to include the community around us in our efforts to get things going. To that end, we have decided to to offer opportunities for our local friends to have a role in helping get things started.

The start up capital we seek will be used to re-equip the kitchen and bar; remodel the dining area; training wages for new staff; purchase of opening inventory; administrative, legal, and professional fees and services; marketing and branding; and contingency operating capital. 

Thanks very much for your interest in this project.

story:
Hey, I'm Skyler. I am 20 and I am Female-to-Male Transgender. Growing up I struggled with depression and just overall confusion about myself and my sophomore year of high school is when I started realizing that I am transgender. Since then I have never had a doubt in my mind about the man I am. So far I have legally changed my name and have had been on hormone replacements for two years in December of this year. The only thing stopping me from feeling so much better about myself is my chest and this is what this page is for!

They say that you know when you have waited too long to have surgery and I can feel myself getting to that point.  I feel sometimes like I can't breathe because I am so uncomfortable in my own body. It's extremely hard to have to bind every day and it puts my health at risk.

What I Need

The surgery, plus travel expenses will be at LEAST $6000, but probably more like $7000 from what I have heard and estimated. 

The Impact

I don't even know how to put into words how much it would truly mean to me if you donated. You'd seriously be making all my dreams come true. A bigger step to happiness. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I'd greatly appreciate you just spreading the word to whomever you can. If not to someone who can donate, at least to someone who will learn something. Together we can teach the world what Transgender, FTM, (etc.) really is so there isn't any confusion or hate. 

Thank you for reading! :)

story:
Do you know what the deadliest animal in the world is?    Most people in South Carolina would probably say snakes. Wrong!


The most deadly animal in the world is the mosquito! As quiet and little as it is, it is responsible for over 1 million deaths per year.  Over 600,000 deaths per year from one disease, Malaria. Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites that are transmitted to people through the bites of infected mosquitoes. Can you imagine one child dying every 30-45 seconds due to a mosquito bite? Most people in the USA will say no way. However, this is a reality in parts of the world. 


We are a textile chemical company located in South Carolina. Our products are used by textile mills to help produce fibers and fabrics. We have also developed a product that we think is a game changer in the fight against insect borne diseases. It is the Skintex® MRIII Cover! Skintex® MRIII is the only EPA registered microencapsulated insect repellent system for textiles. The Skintex® MR III cover is a unique vector tool that is not currently being used to fight insect borne diseases.


We want to introduce the Skintex® MRIII Cover to the area of the world that is most devastated by malaria; Uganda and its surrounding countries. By you helping us, we can supply our Skintex® MRIII Covers to families in Uganda and surrounding countries. The result will be saved lives. 


Creating access to the Skintex® MRIII Covers is important because there has been a change in the areas where insect borne diseases are most prevalent.  With the wars in Africa and the natural disasters that have affected millions in under developed countries, there are millions of people that are transient and have no real shelter. Currently, the main tools used to control the spread of these diseases are the mosquito net and inside residual spraying.  These are not the most useful tools when you have a transient population as we have today. If a family has no home they have no where to hang a bed net or walls to spray. The Skintex® MRIII Cover can help protect these people when they have no structure in which to hang a net or spray. 


How does the Skintex® MRIII Cover work?  It is simple; when the cover is in use the microcapsules burst which releases permethrin onto the textile. This creates a HOTFOOT scenario for a mosquito. When a mosquito lands on the textile and attempts to feed, it will come into contact with permethrin and permethrin filled microcapsules. Once the microcapsules burst, the mosquito is dosed with the released permethrin. The result is a DEAD or KNOCKED DOWN mosquito. In independent WHO tube testing, the cover provides 100% KNOCKDEAD/KNOCKDOWN results. In independent Chamber or Cage testing, the result is the typical amount of landings, but ZERO bites.


Whether it has been independent lab testing, independent field trials or customer feedback, the Skintex® MRIII cover has proven to be very effective at killing disease carrying insects. It has been toxicologically tested and tested for skin contact. It is considered safe for human use.


We want to get as many Skintex® MRIII Covers to the people who need them the most, as fast as possible. To start with, we want to produce at least 50,000 Covers. This will require $800,000. We are ready to go. We just need your help to get started. 


We have partnered with Maryland Information Technology Center, Inc (MITC) and Prime Star Mills to help us create a sustainable infrastructure and distribution of Skintex® MRIII Covers.


What is MITC?   MITC is a not for profit organization located in Rockville, Maryland It is dedicated to performing contract research and studies emphasizing immediate improvement of current national practices of underdeveloped countries. Their goal is for both private and governmental organizations to become equal participants in the global economy in 20-25 years.  As a 501(c)(3) organization MITC uses profits, undesignated grants, and gifts to increase nation building governmental and corporate growth capabilities. This includes activities such as the prevention of malaria and other related diseases.


Why is disease prevention so important to nation building?   Malaria is a huge financial burden for not only a country, but families as well. Countries with high rates of malaria can spend a huge percentage of their national budget trying to prevent the spread of the disease. Malaria is Uganda’s leading cause of morbidity and mortality. According to the Ugandan Ministry of Health, malaria accounts for 25-40% of outpatient visits to health facilities and is responsible for nearly half of inpatient pediatric deaths. Malaria can devastate a family’s financial well being.


What is Prime Star Mills?   Prime Star Mills (PSM) is a textile mill located in Kampala, the capitol of Uganda. PSM will receive the treated fabric and will convert it into the Skintex® MRIII Covers. When the fabric has been converted, PSM will work locally with distributions partners to get the Skintex® MRIII Covers to families in the region. We believe, by having  local mills convert the fabric into the Skintex® MRIII Covers, will create a sense of ownership of the local people. It will also provide local jobs. PSM is currently working with the humanitarian group, Rotary International, as a possible distributor. 


How will the funding be used?   100% of the contributions will be used to produce Skintex® MRIII Covers, create an infrastructure and distribution logistics within Africa. Ultimately, this will lead to families in Africa receiving a new malaria prevention tool. Any funding in excess of the goal will be rolled back into the program so even more families can receive a Skintex® MRIII Cover.


Insect borne diseases will always be a challenge. Over the next 5-10-15 years we expect large growth in products that can help control or eradicate insects that spread these deceases. Our product, The Skintex® MRIII Cover, is a tool that is available today and can play a very significant role. With the millions of displaced people in the world the Skintex® MRIII Cover is ideal. By 2050, our hope is to be able to say the Skintex® MRIII Cover was one of the tools that helped wipe out malaria.


The Skintex® MRIII Cover is a great tool that can be used by families, even in countries where malaria is not present. We have had people place it on the ground under lawn chairs which not only prevented mosquito bites, but also other types of insects from biting their ankles and legs. We have had soccer moms use it at their kid’s soccer games. It is a great camping tool. In addition to the cover, the Skintex® MRIII treatment can be applied to essentially any garment in the market, shirts, pants, hats, tick guards and so on. No matter the scenario, we have always had outstanding reviews for treated garments and gear.


With the Skintex® MRIII Cover's performance in mind, we want you to experience its great benefits while at the same time helping us rid the world of malaria and other insect borne diseases.


Skintex® MRIII Covers can start saving lives today!


The EPA has approved Skintex® MRIII treated covers and apparel for use. We have completed lab testing using third party labs and we have had field trials completed in Africa. All of the results have been outstanding. The feedback from the small amount of people in Africa that has been so lucky to receive a Skintex® MRIII Cover is incredible. With your help we can get the Skintex® MRIII Covers to many more people.


Results from third party lab studies and field studies performed in Africa are below.


WHO Tube study:


African hut studies revealed the following:

1. The use of the Skintex® MRIII Cover reduced indoor resting density of mosquitoes and also reduced mosquito entry into the structures where treated Skintex® MRIII Covers were used, (91.4% indoor resting deterrence and 88.9% entry deterrence).

2. There was a significantly higher mosquito feeding inhibition in huts with treated Skintex® MRIII Covers as compared to huts with untreated covers.

3. There was significantly higher mosquito mortality in huts with the treated Skintex® MRIII Covers compared to huts with untreated covers. The mortality ranged between (92-100%)


African field studies revealed the following:

1. The majority of the respondents found the Skintex® MRIII Cover to be convenient to use in hot areas due to its light fabric.

2. Respondents liked multiple usages of the Skintex® MRIII Covers, including use as bedding and as a wrapper.

3. Most of the respondents who received the treated Skintex® MRIII Covers reported being protected from mosquito bites. Results showed that the Skintex® MRIII Covers was effective.


Please Share. Even if can't contribute funding you can help spread the news about our campaign to save lives. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

where to hang a bed net or walls to spray. The Skintex® MRIII Cover can help
protect these people when they have no structure in which to hang a net or
spray. 

How
does the Skintex® MRIII Cover work?  It is simple; when the cover is in
use the microcapsules burst which releases permethrin onto the textile. This
creates a HOTFOOT scenario for a mosquito. When a mosquito lands on the textile
and attempts to feed, it will come into contact with permethrin and permethrin
filled microcapsules. Once the microcapsules burst, the mosquito is dosed with
the released permethrin. The result is a DEAD or KNOCKED DOWN mosquito. In
independent WHO tube testing, the cover provides 100% KNOCKDEAD/KNOCKDOWN
results. In independent Chamber or Cage testing, the result is the typical
amount of landings, but ZERO bites.

Whether
it has been independent lab testing, independent field trials or customer
feedback, the Skintex® MRIII cover has proven to be very effective at killing
disease carrying insects. It has been toxicologically tested and tested for
skin contact. It is considered safe for human use.

We
want to get as many Skintex® MRIII Covers to the people who need them the most,
as fast as possible. To start with, we want to produce at least 50,000 Covers.
This will require $800,000. We are ready to go. We just need your help to get
started. 
We
have partnered with Maryland
Information Technology Center, Inc (MITC) and Prime Star Mills to help us
create a sustainable infrastructure and distribution of Skintex® MRIII Covers.
What
is MITC?   MITC is a not for profit organization located in Rockville,
Maryland It is dedicated to performing contract research and studies
emphasizing immediate improvement of current national practices of underdeveloped countries. Their goal is for both private and governmental organizations to become equal
participants in the global economy in 20-25 years.  As a 501(c)(3) organization MITC uses
profits, undesignated grants, and gifts to increase nation building
governmental and corporate growth capabilities. This includes activities such
as the prevention of malaria and other related diseases.
Why
is disease prevention so important to nation building?   Malaria is a huge
financial burden for not only a country, but families as well. Countries with
high rates of malaria can spend a huge percentage of their national budget
trying to prevent the spread of the disease. Malaria is Uganda’s leading
cause of morbidity and mortality. According to the Ugandan Ministry of Health,
malaria accounts for 25-40% of outpatient visits to health facilities and
is responsible for nearly half of inpatient pediatric deaths. Malaria can
devastate a family’s financial well being.
What
is Prime Star Mills?   Prime Star Mills (PSM) is a textile mill located in
Kampala, the capitol of Uganda. PSM
will receive the treated fabric and will convert it into the Skintex® MRIII
Covers. When the fabric has been converted, PSM will work locally with
distributions partners to get the Skintex® MRIII Covers to families in the
region. We believe, by having  local mills convert the fabric into the
Skintex® MRIII Covers, will create a sense of ownership of the local people. It
will also provide local jobs. PSM is currently working with the humanitarian
group, Rotary International, as a possible distributor. 

How
will the funding be used?   100% of the contributions will be used to
produce Skintex® MRIII Covers, create an infrastructure and distribution
logistics within Africa. Ultimately, this will
lead to families in Africa receiving a new
malaria prevention tool. Any funding in excess of the goal will be rolled back
into the program so even more families can receive a Skintex® MRIII Cover.

Insect
borne diseases will always be a challenge. Over the next 5-10-15 years we
expect large growth in products that can help control or eradicate insects that
spread these deceases. Our product, The Skintex® MRIII Cover, is a tool that is
available today and can play a very significant role. With the millions of
displaced people in the world the Skintex® MRIII Cover is ideal. By 2050, our
hope is to be able to say the Skintex® MRIII Cover was one of the tools that helped
wipe out malaria.

The
Skintex® MRIII Cover is a great tool that can be used by families, even in
countries where malaria is not present. We have had people place it on the
ground under lawn chairs which not only prevented mosquito bites, but also other
types of insects from biting their ankles and legs. We have had soccer moms use
it at their kid’s soccer games. It is a great camping tool. In addition to the
cover, the Skintex® MRIII treatment can be applied to essentially any garment
in the market, shirts, pants, hats, tick guards and so on. No matter the
scenario, we have always had outstanding reviews for treated garments and gear.
With
the Skintex® MRIII Cover's performance in mind, we want you to experience its
great benefits while at the same time helping us rid the world of malaria and other
insect borne diseases.
Skintex®
MRIII Covers can start saving lives today!
The
EPA has approved Skintex® MRIII treated covers and apparel for use. We
have completed lab testing using third party labs and we have had field trials
completed in Africa. All of the results have been
outstanding. The feedback from the small amount of people in Africa
that has been so lucky to receive a Skintex® MRIII Cover is incredible. With
your help we can get the Skintex® MRIII Covers to many more people.

Results
from third party lab studies and field studies performed in Africa
are below.

WHO
Tube study:
African hut studies revealed the following:
1.
The use of the Skintex® MRIII Cover reduced indoor resting density
of mosquitoes and also reduced mosquito entry into the structures where treated
Skintex® MRIII Covers were used, (91.4% indoor resting deterrence and
88.9% entry deterrence).
2.
There was a significantly higher mosquito feeding inhibition in huts with
treated Skintex®
MRIII Covers as compared to huts with untreated covers.
3.
There was significantly higher mosquito mortality in huts with the treated
Skintex® MRIII Covers compared to huts with untreated covers. The
mortality ranged between (92-100%)

African field
studies revealed the following:
1.
The majority of the respondents found the Skintex® MRIII Cover to be
convenient to use in hot areas due to its light fabric.
2.
Respondents liked multiple usages of the Skintex® MRIII Covers, including use
as bedding and as a wrapper.
3.
Most of the respondents who received the treated Skintex® MRIII Covers reported
being protected from mosquito bites. Results showed that the Skintex®
MRIII Covers was effective.

Please
Share. Even if can't contribute funding you can help spread the news
about our campaign to save lives. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get
the word out.

story:
Green Thumb Juice

We would first of all like to thank you for taking the time to find out more about our campaign. We are Rich & Lacey Adrian from Hamilton, ON. Our company is Green Thumb Juice and we operate out of the Roux Commissary Kitchen in Hamilton. Our goal is simple: To provide healthy options on the streets of Hamilton and surrounding areas.
In January 2014, we started juicing after watching Joe Cross' film Fat, Sick & Nearly Dead. To date we have lot a total of 175 pounds combined. Rich losing 110 pounds and Lacey losing 65 pounds. We have juicing and a plant-based lifestyle to thank for our success.
In May of 2014, we decided to go to Camp Reboot at the Omega Institute in Rhinebeck, NY. We met some of our mentors and some friends from our juicing community, which we started in early January as well. Juicing101.ca was formed to share successes, recipes, stories, and information. We have gained a following and mentor and coach people on a daily basis now. 
After returning home from Camp Reboot, a message from Joe Cross stuck with me. After showing Joe a tattoo I got in his honor, which reads "Reboot For Life", he said to me, "Keep doing what you are doing. You guys are doing a great thing for Canadians, keep pushing forward." We then decided to take Joe's advice and Green Thumb Juice was born.
Our goal is to provide our customers with options. We will focus on a seasonal menu, acquiring as much local produce as possible, and with help from some juicing mentors, create some of the best juice and smoothies out there. Our passion is what keeps our drive in high gear. 

How you can help us

We are seeking $10,000 to help cover the costs we will need to make this campaign successful. Our hopes is that we do not have to purchase another food truck and can move forward with our current truck. We have the passion for success, we just need a little help. 

We appreciate everyone taking the time to visit our campaign. If you can help us out with a donation, please know that we are truly grateful and any amount will help us in our difficult situation. If you are unable to help us out with a donation you can still help us out by spreading the word and sharing this campaign. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools and you can always share this on Facebook, Twitter, etc. 

Once again, we thank you from the bottom of our hearts, and from our family to yours, Cheers!

Rich & Lacey Adrian - Green Thumb Juice, Hamilton, ON

story:
We Dare Two impact the lives of those with Prediabetes and Type 2 Diabetes.

My name is Steve Pashley and I have Type 2 Diabetes.

I founded the Dare Two Foundation because I believe that Design Thinking has the power to impact the lives of people with prediabetes—to increase awareness of the disease and the importance of diagnosis, and motivate healthy behaviors that can help prevent the onset of type 2 diabetes. Dare Two will achieve this goal by applying the Design Thinking process of research, ideation, testing and implementation to create solutions that make a difference in the fight to prevent type 2 diabetes.

Did you know that there are 29.1 million people with diabetes in the US alone? Over 90% of those people have type 2 diabetes. There are an additional 86 million people in the US with prediabetes1. That’s right—1 in 3 Americans has prediabetes!  Only 10% of those 86 million prediabetics have been diagnosed.

By 2050, it's estimated that as many as 1 in 3 Americans could have type 2 diabetes.

Our vision is a world free of type 2 diabetes—and there is reason to hope. A trial run by the National Institute of Health (NIH), the Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP)2, showed that with aggressive health and nutrition intervention, almost 60% of patients with prediabetes were able to reverse their condition.

The Dare Two Foundation is dedicated to raising awareness and diagnosing   millions of people with prediabetes because that is where the opportunity lies. Early diagnosis and aggressive intervention—diet changes, increasing physical activity, monitoring blood sugar and building healthy lifestyles—can help many people with prediabetes reverse their condition. We will prevent type 2 diabetes by stopping it in its tracks—when the warning signs first appear as prediabetes. But we need your help...

We’re running our first annual fundraising campaign to raise $14,500 for startup costs which will cover initial legal, accounting, and insurance fees. This initial funding will also help us get the word out about what we are doing, the risks and health dangers of type 2 diabetes, and ways that Americans can prevent type 2 diabetes in their lives and the lives of those they care about.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $14,500 for startup costs. This initial funding will be used as follows:

    What You'll Get

    You're investing in your future—and your family's future. Your generosity is deeply appreciated.

    We've got great rewards for everyone who contributes:

    • Every donor will will receive a "We Dare Two" blue silicon wristband and be listed on our Donor page.
    • Donate $50 or more you'll receive a "We Dare Two" blue silicone wristband AND be listed as a BRONZE Donor on our website.
    • Donate $100 and you'll receive a "We Dare Two" blue silicone wristband PLUS our brand new "Dare Two/Inspire" t-shirt AND you'll be listed as a SILVER Donor on our website.
    • Donate $250 and you'll receive a "We Dare Two" blue silicone wristband PLUS our brand new "Dare Two/Inspire" t-shirt. You'll be listed as a PLATINUM Donor on our website and receive early access to new product launches.
    • Donate $500 and you'll receive a "We Dare Two" blue silicone wristband PLUS our brand new "Dare Two/Inspire" t-shirt. You'll be listed as a PLATINUM Donor on our website and receive early access to new product launches. Finally, you will receive an invitation to participate in one of our in-person ideation sessions* where you'll have a direct hand in shaping the future of the Dare Two Foundation and our approach to preventing type 2 diabetes.

    The Impact

    Type 2 diabetes costs us all—in direct medical costs, lost productivity, reduced quality of life and the loss of family members too soon.

    The total cost of diagnosed diabetes in 2012 was estimated $245 billion. That's $176 billion in medical costs and $69 billion in lost productivity.

    Diabetes was the seventh leading cause of death in the United States in 2010, listed as the underlying cause of death for 69,000 people. Diabetes was mentioned as a contributing cause of death in 234,000 cases. And diabetes may be dramatically underreported as a cause of death. One study found that only 35-40% of those with diabetes who died had diabetes listed as a cause of death.

    Risks & Challenges

    Type 2 diabetes is a 'hidden' crisis—only 10% of the 86 million people with prediabetes even know they have it. Awareness is key.

    We want to diagnose 77 million new prediabetics.

    Preventing type 2 diabetes requires lifestyle changes and the adoption of a healthy lifestyle - better diet, more physical activity, understanding and monitoring your blood sugar consistently. These are not insignificant changes. We understand that. By applying the Design Thinking process of research, ideation, testing and implementation, we will identify the small opportunities that lead to big changes.

    One example of a small change with the potential for big impact is our concept for the Sugar-Smart Shopper app. The Dare Two Sugar-Smart Shopper App is designed to simplify food shopping for people with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes. The mobile app operates in the most simple manner – scan the bar code of an item in the store and we’ll provide a simple, clear message letting you know if that item is a healthy option for people with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes. Using the iconic red, yellow, green stoplight color palette, we’ll provide straight-forward guidance on each item you scan:

    Considering a loaf of white bread? That’s a big red NO! We’ll send you this simple message:
    “White bread is high in processed sugar and has a high glycemic index.  Consider buying whole wheat bread or, even better, whole grain breads.”

    What about pineapple? That’s a yellow light.
    “Pineapples are high in natural sugars. You can eat some pineapple but try adding high fiber fruits like apples to your basket as well.”

    I love fish. How about the wild-caught salmon? Green light!
    “Wild caught salmon is an excellent source of high-quality protein, vitamins and minerals – and it’s loaded with healthy omega-3 fatty acids. Go for it!”

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can afford to contribute—we understand. There are other ways you can help:

    Spread the Word

    • Please use the share links above to let your friends know about our campaign to prevent type 2 diabetes.
    • Post to Facebook or send a tweet on our behalf.
    • Use #wedaretwo
    • Share with your friends and you can earn a Dare Two/Inspire t-shirt!

    Volunteer

    In order to achieve our goals, we need to grow our volunteer team. Volunteers are the lifeblood of any nonprofit and we need your help. We need volunteers of all types. We're especially looking for designers, developers and marketers to help us create and promote solutions to help prevent type 2 diabetes. Nonprofit experience is a HUGE plus. For more information, please email volunteers@wedaretwo.org or fill out our simple online volunteer form.

    We are also looking to grow our Board of Directors and our Advisory Board in 2015. If you are interested in a board role and would like more information, please email Steve Pashley.

    Share Your Story

    You can provide inspiration to others and motivate them to achieve their goals. If you've overcome prediabetes or you are living with type 2 diabetes and want to share your story, we want to hear it. Post your story in the comments section or send us an email to stories@wedaretwo.org. With your permission, we'll share the most inspiring stories on our website as well!

    Thank You

    Thank you to everyone who's made it this far. Please follow us on twitter www.twitter.com/wedaretwo  or use our hashtag #wedaretwo. Join us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/WeDareTwo and check out our website: wedaretwo.org


    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    1http://www.diabetes.org/diabetes-basics/statist...

    2http://diabetes.niddk.nih.gov/dm/pubs/preventionprogram/

    * In-person Ideation Sessions are in-person workshops held in the Philadelphia, PA area. Your contribution does NOT include any travel or lodging expenses. If you cannot attend, you may designate someone else to attend in your place.

story:
Short Summary

Hello ,

 

My name is Donald Castellano, some know me by my nickname D.J. and here’s my story. Originally married in 1997 at the young age of 17 , over the course of 8 years being a father to five beautiful children I knew life would be full of adventure and hard work ahead to support these children. Working a single job still wasn’t enough to support the family, devastatingly only to end in a divorce in 2007 due to irreconcilable differences. Going our separate ways and allowing her to have the children fulltime while I worked, still getting nowhere in life, I decided to continue my education I originally started before my marriage in 1996.

                While attending school during the daytime (Criminal Justice degree), I also attended night time schooling on my days off (Business & Management degree) to complete it in 2009. I was super proud of finally getting somewhere in life ,being successful towards my children’s future and well being that I decided to take my Criminal Justice degree even further. Moving from one school to the next (due to capacity of finishing an A.S to a B.S.), I stayed steady pursuing my dreams of being a CSI Forensic Examiner for Department of Homeland Security. I knew I would be a big role model to my children, to look up to and wonder why I pursued what I did in matters of my family’s Law Enforcement history. To cherish and be passionate about everything I loved doing, serving the community, protecting their safety, teaching right from wrong while protecting the States from terrorist activities, to say the least, I was there.

                Till one day I got a phone call from my oldest daughter, Hailey’s teacher. Walking into the room I was in shock to see their Mothers new Mother-In-Law, teacher & State Case Worker all at the table. I was in awe, confused and distracted of my children being in harm’s way. The time I had spent trying to become a better father through education, paying my Child Support & becoming a better role model, was the time that they were being hurt… Physically, emotional and traumatically, the living conditions they were in were horrid. The reports were novels long, lice infested hair, loss of weight due to starvation, abuse marks found on them from the nurse but no notification to me from the school. Their mother had kept it all a secret only to fuel herself of addictive habits with the child support & food stamps she received from the State of Florida for over 2 ½ years. A change had to come, this couldn’t be happening to my children.

                With the help of the State of Florida, I was awarded FULL CUSTODY in Early 2010 of all FIVE children miraculously. Something rarely unheard of, being a REAL father and taking the stand of both role models with inspirational outlooks, I was in for a longer road ahead. Devastatingly that year, June 2010, I took two HUGE blows to my family. 1) We lost a most wonderful cousin, whom was a State Trooper for the State of New Jersey which in turn 2) Caused me to lose my job, of being on Bereavement, to return to work early since my mother flew to New Jersey instead of me. I was in shock, in denial that this was happening the way it was in such a moment in my life of turmoil and disbelief, it couldn’t be.

                I took charge, liquidating all of my assets, focusing on raising my children the correct way and getting them back on track since they missed quite a few months of schooling and some. I took a leave of absence with my Bachelors degree at my current University with only a year left, the children needed me the most at this critical timing of their lives.  Three of my children were left back that year in school; my oldest daughters THIRD time being left back almost in a row due to lack of education and attendance being her main problematic area. Additional tutoring after school from myself, additional therapists twice a week ordered for them , family group counseling with the six of us over the course of a couple years was in place and last but not least speech therapy for two of my children due to problematic issues while growing up that was not addressed. They were progressing, F’s,D’s to C’s and up to their current point now of being Honor Roll students, the hard work was paying off. They were creative, developing stories for school that were amazing, awards brought home for best effort and dedication in anything they did, it was a priceless.

                Around the middle of 2011, I started becoming fatigued and in pain. Already bearing a single solitary kidney, always taking good care of my health already, something was wrong for this to happen. I went to my Primary Health Physician to be immediately rushed to the hospital due to high blood pressure. 200+/150+ at first it started… The pain was unbearable; they placed me on one blood pressure medication, only to temporarily work while figuring out what’s going on. Going to a Urologist, Nephrologist to Gastrologist, test after test, it seemed hopeless for a few months. Within a six month time period my Primary Care Physician placed me on 3 different types of blood pressure medications only to refer me to a pain management, since the blood pressure medications weren’t totally fixing the problem. 5 medications in total it took for my blood pressure to come back to somewhat a normal range and out of the stroke(or even death) levels they were at for months straight on end.

                I thought it was over, 6 months straight of tests and no resolution but medications that I would have to take for possibly the rest of my life, only being 31 now, it would be a long time. I had already visited the E.R. 17 times at this point, becoming frequent even with the Doctors in the Emergency section alone! Finally finding out what was going on, my Gastrologist had the results. February 2012 I had undergone a Colonoscopy to find out I had a tight, kinked bowel at the hepatic flexure with possible hernia also developing. This was serious, the tests I have been through and also finding out I have kidney stones again (Third time in 10 months) the pain totally is almost indescribable.  2 months into taking my increase in bp meds, my blood pressure started rising, I returned back to my Primary Care once again. 

                Upon multiple visits and tests again with the new specialist, the doctor declined to do surgery as a resolution on this matter. I don’t smoke, drink or use drugs but still stated due to the onset of the illness it was more of a risk then benefit. Due to the fact of me having a solitary kidney, this MIGHT HAVE BEEN the reason I had the kinked bowel problem. Too much of a “Maybe” was the results of everything and from the inconsistency of the problem the responsibility of surgeon, I was turned down. UNBELIEVABLE…

                This is where we are today, the present day and why I ask for your help. I am in desperate need for assistance so I can get back to doing what I do best, raising my children. I am sick and tired of being sick and tired, there has to be hope out to the public. I have no insurance,noone else to care for my children and therefore it seems where I need to be is what I cannot afford. I have given everything I earned since my childhood to my children, to help them be where they are today only to be stuck at a dead end with my health at a steady declining rate. I have nothing left to give to proceed at this point, so I am hoping for a miracle. Your donations will be used to help support my health issues in the following way:

1)      Travel costs to a recommended specialist for our Third opinion, consultation and quite possibly surgery as needed.

2)      Medical costs for the doctor’s services

3)       Caregiver assistance for my children during the 2-4 months downtime

4)      Any bills accumulated during the period in medical care

5)      Lodging expenses during the time period near the doctor’s offices

 

 

Your help is greatly appreciated; me and my children have a lot of love to give. They have always been taught with manners, respect and to give better than receive. If you cannot donate for the cause, please share also! Use the fantastic sharing tools that Indiegogo has to offer. Sharing is the best love anyone can have and we have a lot of it. We appreciate anything that you have to offer by just being, yourself. Talking over with my children, we thought of many ways to pay the community with the funds we receive and would go as follows. We created a Facebook page due to the criticalness of my health for daily updates which your name would be placed as a memorabilia from helping us. Also higher donors would be compensated an autographed picture in the donating range stated above, last but not least a PERSONAL card/drawing from us to you, thanking for supporting us in this timing. We hope you enjoy the perks as I am always fascinated as the artistic incline my children provide in drawings to me, directly from their heart. Please keep in contact with me and the children, we love SUPPORT also! Thank you and God bless!

 

With love,

Donald Castellano Sr.

Donald Castellano Jr.

Hailey Castellano

Austin Castellano

Emily Castellano

Dillan Castellano
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello ,
 
My name is Donald Castellano, some know me by my nickname D.J. and here’s my story. Originally married in 1997 at the young age of 17 , over the course of 8 years being a father to five beautiful children I knew life would be full of adventure and hard work ahead to support these children. Working a single job still wasn’t enough to support the family, devastatingly only to end in a divorce in 2007 due to irreconcilable differences. Going our separate ways and allowing her to have the children fulltime while I worked, still getting nowhere in life, I decided to continue my education I originally started before my marriage in 1996.
                While attending school during the daytime (Criminal Justice degree), I also attended night time schooling on my days off (Business & Management degree) to complete it in 2009. I was super proud of finally getting somewhere in life ,being successful towards my children’s future and well being that I decided to take my Criminal Justice degree even further. Moving from one school to the next (due to capacity of finishing an A.S to a B.S.), I stayed steady pursuing my dreams of being a CSI Forensic Examiner for Department of Homeland Security. I knew I would be a big role model to my children, to look up to and wonder why I pursued what I did in matters of my family’s Law Enforcement history. To cherish and be passionate about everything I loved doing, serving the community, protecting their safety, teaching right from wrong while protecting the States from terrorist activities, to say the least, I was there.
                Till one day I got a phone call from my oldest daughter, Hailey’s teacher. Walking into the room I was in shock to see their Mothers new Mother-In-Law, teacher & State Case Worker all at the table. I was in awe, confused and distracted of my children being in harm’s way. The time I had spent trying to become a better father through education, paying my Child Support & becoming a better role model, was the time that they were being hurt… Physically, emotional and traumatically, the living conditions they were in were horrid. The reports were novels long, lice infested hair, loss of weight due to starvation, abuse marks found on them from the nurse but no notification to me from the school. Their mother had kept it all a secret only to fuel herself of addictive habits with the child support & food stamps she received from the State of Florida for over 2 ½ years. A change had to come, this couldn’t be happening to my children.
                With the help of the State of Florida, I was awarded FULL CUSTODY in Early 2010 of all FIVE children miraculously. Something rarely unheard of, being a REAL father and taking the stand of both role models with inspirational outlooks, I was in for a longer road ahead. Devastatingly that year, June 2010, I took two HUGE blows to my family. 1) We lost a most wonderful cousin, whom was a State Trooper for the State of New Jersey which in turn 2) Caused me to lose my job, of being on Bereavement, to return to work early since my mother flew to New Jersey instead of me. I was in shock, in denial that this was happening the way it was in such a moment in my life of turmoil and disbelief, it couldn’t be.
                I took charge, liquidating all of my assets, focusing on raising my children the correct way and getting them back on track since they missed quite a few months of schooling and some. I took a leave of absence with my Bachelors degree at my current University with only a year left, the children needed me the most at this critical timing of their lives.  Three of my children were left back that year in school; my oldest daughters THIRD time being left back almost in a row due to lack of education and attendance being her main problematic area. Additional tutoring after school from myself, additional therapists twice a week ordered for them , family group counseling with the six of us over the course of a couple years was in place and last but not least speech therapy for two of my children due to problematic issues while growing up that was not addressed. They were progressing, F’s,D’s to C’s and up to their current point now of being Honor Roll students, the hard work was paying off. They were creative, developing stories for school that were amazing, awards brought home for best effort and dedication in anything they did, it was a priceless.
                Around the middle of 2011, I started becoming fatigued and in pain. Already bearing a single solitary kidney, always taking good care of my health already, something was wrong for this to happen. I went to my Primary Health Physician to be immediately rushed to the hospital due to high blood pressure. 200+/150+ at first it started… The pain was unbearable; they placed me on one blood pressure medication, only to temporarily work while figuring out what’s going on. Going to a Urologist, Nephrologist to Gastrologist, test after test, it seemed hopeless for a few months. Within a six month time period my Primary Care Physician placed me on 3 different types of blood pressure medications only to refer me to a pain management, since the blood pressure medications weren’t totally fixing the problem. 5 medications in total it took for my blood pressure to come back to somewhat a normal range and out of the stroke(or even death) levels they were at for months straight on end.
                I thought it was over, 6 months straight of tests and no resolution but medications that I would have to take for possibly the rest of my life, only being 31 now, it would be a long time. I had already visited the E.R. 17 times at this point, becoming frequent even with the Doctors in the Emergency section alone! Finally finding out what was going on, my Gastrologist had the results. February 2012 I had undergone a Colonoscopy to find out I had a tight, kinked bowel at the hepatic flexure with possible hernia also developing. This was serious, the tests I have been through and also finding out I have kidney stones again (Third time in 10 months) the pain totally is almost indescribable.  2 months into taking my increase in bp meds, my blood pressure started rising, I returned back to my Primary Care once again. 
                Upon multiple visits and tests again with the new specialist, the doctor declined to do surgery as a resolution on this matter. I don’t smoke, drink or use drugs but still stated due to the onset of the illness it was more of a risk then benefit. Due to the fact of me having a solitary kidney, this MIGHT HAVE BEEN the reason I had the kinked bowel problem. Too much of a “Maybe” was the results of everything and from the inconsistency of the problem the responsibility of surgeon, I was turned down. UNBELIEVABLE…
                This is where we are today, the present day and why I ask for your help. I am in desperate need for assistance so I can get back to doing what I do best, raising my children. I am sick and tired of being sick and tired, there has to be hope out to the public. I have no insurance,noone else to care for my children and therefore it seems where I need to be is what I cannot afford. I have given everything I earned since my childhood to my children, to help them be where they are today only to be stuck at a dead end with my health at a steady declining rate. I have nothing left to give to proceed at this point, so I am hoping for a miracle. Your donations will be used to help support my health issues in the following way:
1)      Travel costs to a recommended specialist for our Third opinion, consultation and quite possibly surgery as needed.
2)      Medical costs for the doctor’s services
3)       Caregiver assistance for my children during the 2-4 months downtime
4)      Any bills accumulated during the period in medical care
5)      Lodging expenses during the time period near the doctor’s offices
 
 
Your help is greatly appreciated; me and my children have a lot of love to give. They have always been taught with manners, respect and to give better than receive. If you cannot donate for the cause, please share also! Use the fantastic sharing tools that Indiegogo has to offer. Sharing is the best love anyone can have and we have a lot of it. We appreciate anything that you have to offer by just being, yourself. Talking over with my children, we thought of many ways to pay the community with the funds we receive and would go as follows. We created a Facebook page due to the criticalness of my health for daily updates which your name would be placed as a memorabilia from helping us. Also higher donors would be compensated an autographed picture in the donating range stated above, last but not least a PERSONAL card/drawing from us to you, thanking for supporting us in this timing. We hope you enjoy the perks as I am always fascinated as the artistic incline my children provide in drawings to me, directly from their heart. Please keep in contact with me and the children, we love SUPPORT also! Thank you and God bless!
 
With love,
Donald Castellano Sr.
Donald Castellano Jr.
Hailey Castellano
Austin Castellano
Emily Castellano
Dillan Castellano

story:
Many of you knew Tim as a younger man in Rochester struggling tirelessly for gay rights in the late 1970s and early 1980s; or in San Francisco during the mid-1980s as an AIDS activist; or during the past 25 years in his work to protect children's rights to their genital integrity. Now Tim is in a different kind of struggle.
 
In August 2012 he was diagnosed with high grade, aggressive Stage IV prostate cancer.

Although the cancer had advanced beyond surgical intervention, in retrospect, this was perhaps a blessing. With no urgency for surgery, and because radiation treatments were not yet planned, we recovered from the news and immediately began learning everything we could about prostate cancer, as well as conventional, complementary and alternative treatments.

We learned that his provincial and employer-paid health plans will only pay for invasive or toxic treatments like surgery, radiation and chemotherapy, but we also learned that there are many non-toxic treatments that treat cancer as the systemic disease that it is. Unfortunately, insurance does not cover such holistic treatments and they must be paid out-of-pocket.

Tim has therefore chosen a path to healing that is non-toxic and supportive of the body, mind and spirit. In April he will travel to Germany, where a 'freedom of treatment' law will give him access to treatments that are either unavailable or more expensive in Canada and the U.S.. His goal with these treatments and subsequent followup is to be declared "cancer free" by August 2013.

Unfortunately, when he told his physician here in Vancouver that he first wanted to pursue the alternative holistic, and non-toxic treatment plan, his doctor became visibly agitated and rude. He said there was no place for alternative medicine in cancer and dismissed Tim's six months of research on conventional and alternative methods as "foolish" and "idiotic". He refused to monitor Tim's progress with alternative treatments unless Tim agreed to go down the recommended path of radiation and chemo. In so doing, his doctor revealed his narrow-minded focus on just treating the prostate, rather than the whole person. Cancer is not an isolated disease but a systemic one and must be treated as such.

Tim remains undaunted. He has proven his mettle as a man committed to ending injustices visited upon vulnerable groups. When presented by the personal challenge of cancer, he's shown to me and his friends that he's up to that challenge. Many of you will agree with me when I say that we can't afford to lose such a valuable champion for human rights.

The full cost of treatments, testing, airfare, food and lodging will approach $18,000. After having pre-paid for our travel and accommodations,  the treatments and tests over a three-week period will amount to $12,000.

I know Tim has never been shy about asking for money for human rights causes, but he'd never ask for such support for himself. That's why his friends and I, his husband, are making this appeal for your support on his behalf. We believe now is the time for those of us who love Tim, and who appreciate all the good work he's done for others, to rally to his side.
 
PERKS: Check out the 'perks' to the right. Tim is offering to send you some of the cancer resources that have contributed to his education on this subject over the past six months.
 
TREATMENT UPDATES: Get updates on Tim's treatments! We've started a Tyze account which will allow you to login and follow his progress. All contributors will receive an invitation to register at the Tyze network.
 
CONTRIBUTING AFTER THE CAMPAIGN DEADLINE: For those of you who can't contribute before the 31 March campaign deadline, you can still contribute after that date through Paypal even if you don't have a Paypal account or a positive Paypal balance. You can charge it to a credit card. Just go to Paypal and click the 'Send Money' tab and direct the contribution to: bkjvey@gmail.com
 
In making this appeal for health care funds, I want you to know that no contribution is too large or too small, and I thank you for your support.
