story:
Our First Year at the WAPF

The WAPF was launched in June of 2012. In our first year, WAPF team members (Donors/contributors) have successfully supported 3 heptathletes who represent the United States in the heptathlon. We have hosted and particapted in Community Outreach events that have provided over 600 local youth with the opportunity to be coached and mentored by some of the world's top ranked athletes, including a world record holder. As a club, we achieved two top 10 USA rankings in the heptathlon and brought home one international medal.

Our programs can continue to be strengthened through generous support from people who want to help pave the way for these tremendous young women to not only reach their dreams, but instill a dream in the next generation. We invite you to become a part of the journey today.

 

Vision Statement
The mission of the Women’s Athletic Performance Foundation is to provide overall support for elite American female track & field athletes competing in the heptathlon. By providing the support necessary to continue training, it is the goal of the foundation to improve the performance of the United States at the international level of competition in the women’s heptathlon. Secondarily, the foundation seeks to connect these elite athletes with members of the community of all ages in an effort to enhance physical fitness and leadership through the avenue of sport and exercise.


Outlook in the United States
After college graduation, there is very little opportunity anywhere in the United States for heptathletes to be able to continue to train. As a result, the USA has not faired well at the international level of competition in relation to the number of athletes competing in the event. The WAPF is the first organization of it’s kind in the United States dedicated to providing overall support for women in this event.  

Title IX
Title IX has completely changed the face of women’s athletics. Participation among female athletes is currently at an all time high, and track & field in particular ranks at the top of the list amongst high school athletes in the United States. Although Title IX makes no mention of athletics specifically, the results of this congressional act have greatly impacted women in athletics. The talent pool coming out of high school and college each year is tremendous. As a foundation, it is our goal to be the first entity to provide overall support for elite young women pursuing the heptathlon.  

What our Campaign Fundraiser will Help to Cover

  • Living Stipend for female athletes

  • Youth and Community Outreach Events

  • Health Insurance for female athletes

  • Physical Therapy/Massage/Chiropractic for heptathletes • Travel to competition

It is not enough to simply pursue athletics at the highest level. The WAPF has been extremely active in providing healthy programs for youth to engage in physical activity, self-esteem building, goal setting, and the promotion of active lifestyles. Kids in the community have the opportunity to spend time with and be mentored by world-class athletes who lead by example and demonstrate that it is a worthwhile investment of time and energy to pursue a dream.
story_txt:
Our First Year at the WAPF
The WAPF was launched in June of 2012. In our first year, WAPF team members (Donors/contributors) have successfully supported 3 heptathletes who represent the United States in the heptathlon. We have hosted and particapted in Community Outreach events that have provided over 600 local youth with the opportunity to be coached and mentored by some of the world's top ranked athletes, including a world record holder. As a club, we achieved two top 10 USA rankings in the heptathlon and brought home one international medal. 
Our programs can continue to be strengthened through generous support from people who want to help pave the way for these tremendous young women to not only reach their dreams, but instill a dream in the next generation. We invite you to become a part of the journey today.
 

Vision Statement The mission of the Women’s Athletic Performance Foundation is to provide overall support for elite American female track & field athletes competing in the heptathlon. By providing the support necessary to continue training, it is the goal of the foundation to improve the performance of the United States at the international level of competition in the women’s heptathlon. Secondarily, the foundation seeks to connect these elite athletes with members of the community of all ages in an effort to enhance physical fitness and leadership through the avenue of sport and exercise.Outlook in the United States After college graduation, there is very little opportunity anywhere in the United States for heptathletes to be able to continue to train. story:
The Boggarts Quidditch Club at CSU is a Muggle Quidditch team!

We've been a team for about 3 years now and attend mostly in-state tournaments. We're not the biggest or the strongest, but we have a lot of heart. This year, for the first time ever, our team is going to regionals. That is, if we can get the funding. 
We have a hard time getting the school to acknowledge us, so we know any funding we get from them is going to be limited at best. That isn't going to stop us though! Part of being a Muggle Quidditch player is going for something will all the spirit you can muster. 
If we get the funding we need, you'll get to be apart of our magic (in spirit). We'll be endlessly grateful. We're so excited for the chance to go!

What We Need From You!

Money. We'd also love your support. Follow us on Facebook and Tumblr for regular updates!

What your donation will go towards:

  • Gas Money
  • Hotel rooms for the team (we're close, but you can only fit so many people in one bed)
  • (And if we raise enough money) Food! We're all pretty broke.

Why You're Important

We don't have a lot of fans. We don't have a lot of money. What we do have is heart, and magic to spare. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link! Tell people you know! Come to practices! Come to games!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/csuquidditch/
http://csuboggarts.tumblr.com/

story:
Who am I?

My name is Peggy. I am currently an non-traditional undergrad public health major in my final year at Rutgers in New Brunswick, NJ. I am currently enrolled in an International Public Health course, and would be thrilled if I am selected to participate in the annual Alternative Spring Break trip planned specifically for people who take this class...to see and learn about global public health first hand.

Why Nicaragua?

Two years ago, I had the opportunity to study abroad and remove myself from the US-centric bubble to learn more about health from a global perspective. It provided me with a little taste of what health looked like to the rest of the world as well as the desire to learn more. That's where this trip comes in.

The class I took a few summers ago, while great, was all classroom work. This alternative spring break, set up by the fantastic people at Rutgers' H.O.P.E. (Health Outreach, Promotion, & Education), gives students a chance to 'get their hands dirty,' and experience different aspects of the Nicaraguan health system. I would really love to take part in that experience, and see where it may lead me.

Here's the break down:

The cost of this trip is $1800 (including airfare! Such a deal!) That price includes not just airfare, but:

  • ground transport
  • lodging
  • food (breakfast & dinner)
  • translator services
  • travel insurance
The additional $200 will be used to cover any other travel costs-possible vaccines, etc.

If I reach my goal and exceed it, any additional donations will be used to purchase OTC medicines that the group will be carrying to Nicaragua. I have access to the company store for a large pharmaceutical company, which means I can get:

  • 100 Tylenol or Motrin tablets for $5
  • 24 count box of Immodium AD for $3
  • 8 oz Children's Benadryl for $5...
The list goes on. This may not seem like much, but the clinics that are the recipients of these medications are grateful. According to the WHO, only 6.3% of Nicaragua's population is insured, and there are some extreme disparities in access to health care due to socioeconomic status, gender, geography, and ethnicity. We visit some of those places that have a lack of resources, and provide them what we can. I hope to be able to do my share in contributing.

What we do:

While we are in Nicaragua, we visit a number of different clinics, the US embassy, schools, etc. Here is a sample list of where this experience has taken students in the past:

  • Casa Maternas (Maternity Homes)
  • University of Nicaragua – Health Clinic
  • La Chureca – largest garbage dump in Latin America
  • Los Quinchos Program – which takes children off the streets and encourage them to get an education and a trade skill 
  • Esperanza en Accion (Hope in Action) – fair trade organization
  • United States Embassy 
  • Rural School

What you get-the Perks!

If you decide to donate, along with my extreme gratitude (and a thank you note!), I have a group of perks that might interest you...

  • For $10, along with my gratitude, you might just get a nifty landscape picture from my time in Nicaragua.
  • For $25, I will make sure you are on my list of people to send post cards to while in Nicaragua...I can't promise how legible they'll be (I understand the days are long), but I'll do my best.
  • For $50, along with a post card I will also pick up a small local gift for you, to be sent after I return.
  • For $100, I will send, along with everything else, a unique 2015 poster calendar using pictures from the trip...so you can see what we do when we are there, and know what day it is!
  • For $500, a few lucky people will receive something hand-knit by yours truly. This will be delivered post trip, and is in addition to those items listed above.

If you are unable...

Trust me, I get it. Times are tough. That's why I'm doing this campaign! If you find there is just no way you can contribute financially, I completely understand. If you would be willing to pass on the link to others (through FaceBook, the share tools here, etc), that would be awesome. If you have access to other things you think we may be able to utilize on the trip (condoms, other OTC medications, other medical supplies, etc), please let me know and we can see about donating that way. If you just want to send well-wishes, I'll take those, too (and they don't cost anything!) Either way, I am grateful for all and wish you all good health.

story:
Curious about what percentage of births at your local hospital are cesareans? Is it 20% or 60%?

Let's work together to make these rates public.

 

My name is Jill Arnold. In 2005, I was thrilled to be pregnant with my first child. Toward the end of my healthy pregnancy, I was told I needed a cesarean because my baby was too big. As a curious first timer, I peppered my provider with questions about the risks of the cesarean and the risk of complications from attempting a vaginal delivery. To my great frustration, my requests for data were met only with anecdote and emotion.


What exactly, if not medical evidence, lay behind that recommendation of cesarean? My blog, The Unnecesarean, began in 2008 to document my quest for the answer. The site eventually outgrew my personal exploration, my views shifted and I began investigating how patients and providers alike can benefit from shared decision-making—with access to information such as public reporting of hospital data, e.g. cesarean and vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC) rates. The research on data reporting spawned a new site, CesareanRates.com, which launched in February 2012.


CesareanRates.com was well-received, logging more than 150,000 page views in its first six weeks and its site ranking consequently skyrocketed. It is clear that this site is providing a vital service to the public. I receive a steady stream of questions and requests to build out the site. Why only total cesarean rates? What about risk-adjusted rates? What about better VBAC data? Where is the District of Columbia? It goes on and on.


In response to the flow of requests for more, I would like to say “yes”- but I cannot do it without your help.


Your help is necessary to continue this vital work. Please donate now!


The success of the sites led to an invitation to participate in a federal government-sponsored task force about lowering cesarean rates. I learned that there is a question on many stakeholders’ minds— Does the public even care about cesarean rates rising? Great question, but how can anyone gauge the public’s feelings or thoughts about cesarean rates if there are few places to find specific rates? Now, if the rates are publicly reported at all, they are buried beneath page after page on a department of health web site.


I envision an online resource with accessible, standardized data that would be helpful to both the layperson and medical professional. You can help this vision become a reality by donating now—any amount will help.


If we can raise the funds together, Phase 2 of the site, which will continue until December 31, 2012, will include:

 

  • Building out CesareanRates.com to include regular posts on maternity care topics related to shared decision-making, practice variation, data reporting policy and law and media coverage of obstetrical utilization rates. In addition, I want to introduce a new framework for looking objectively at geographical extremes in obstetrical procedure utilizations rates and using long-standing research on informed choice, medical decision-making and practice variation that steers clear of the distracting and harmful “obstetric vs. natural” or “obstetrician vs. midwife” binary that wastes everyone’s time.

 

  • Updating all currently available data on cesarean utilization, which for many states involves pulling data from six separate pull-down menus with diagnostic related groups and calculating those. In a state with 150 or more hospitals providing maternity care, this is a very time-consuming endeavor, yet necessary if the point of the site is to show the most currently published data.

 

  • Adding additional reported data beyond what is currently found on CesareanRates.com, including VBAC rates, risk-adjusted rates, other obstetrical procedure rates, etc.

 

  • Continuing ongoing work toward elevating patient and public right to data. Hospitals are big business, but the need to obscure administrative data of individual institutions to protect profits ultimately keeps patients in the dark.

 

As for my story- I decided to go in to labor on my own, and learned first-hand why refusing a cesarean is so difficult, even for a so-called “educated” patient. I gave birth to a healthy baby in the hospital, and again to my second daughter in a birth center two years later. I believe that all people deserve the opportunity to access the best information available needed to make medical decisions in conjunction with a supportive care provider and that we can all collectively benefit from pulling back the curtain on local practice patterns and procedure rates.


We all agree that someone needs to do the work of reporting cesarean rates. History shows us that we can’t yet count on a reporting agency to do this because of hospitals’ fears of being exposed. Your donation of any amount says that you value placing the public’s right to data over a hospital’s right to protect their own financial interests.


Please donate today. No amount is too small. Thank you.

story:
My husband, Robert McNeil, was separated from his father 35 years ago due to family differences. Through many years of researching government bureaucracy and uncovering family secrets, my husband found his Daddy in American Samoa.
When Robert found his Father, an American veteran, he discovered his Father is severely debilitated. Both of his legs have been amputated and he is suffering from diabetes as well as other complications due to poor health care. Although surrounded by warm hearted and loving people there are no VA hospitals or facilities in American Samoa for our American warriors. At 80 years of age, Robert's Father will not live long in a third world country. He is in need of a veteran's hospital that covers the specialized care for the warriors who served our great country. It is imperative Dad comes home with his dignity to his family to receive the health care he needs and deserves.

Time is running out, we need your prayers and support to acquire the money it is going to take to make this happen immediately.

Thank You,

Susan McNeil

story:
Short Summary

Gruvi Spirulina Juices are a new line of healthy not from concentrate fruit juice beverages. We are based in Brooklyn, NY. In our line up there are multiple mixes of all natural fruit juices infused with the superfood Spirulina. This idea emerged from the founder of our company, Dr. Bert Benjamin who is a doctor of holistic nutrition. Dr. Benjamin has a passion for health and came up with the concept while on a month long juice fast. Alongside co-founder Jermaine Francis, they developed the brand Gruvi Juices. Partner Derick Jones is the newest member of the team. Gruvi Juices is one of the healthiest lines of juices available on the market. There are no preservatives or processed sugar, all our juices are naturally sweetened from fruits or agave. There are currently three flavors available: Spiruline Green which is a mix of apple, lemon and lime juices; Banana Power which is banana and apple based; and our most popular Fruit Fiesta which is pineapple based.

What is spirulina?

Spirulina is a "superfood". It is the most nutritious, concentrated whole food known to humankind. It has a rich vibrant history and occupies an intriguing biological and ecological niche in the plant kingdom. Spirulina is truly an amazing food full of nutritional workers.

Spirulina has 300% more calcium than milk

Spirulina has 2300% more iron than spinach

Spirulina has 3900% more beta carotene than carrots

Spirulina has 375% more protein than tofu

Spirulina also contains vitamin B12

Three grams of Spirulina have more antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activity than five servings of vegetables.

 

Why is funding needed?

We will use the funding to co-pack these tasty and healthy juices. We co-packed a small run and put it on shelves in New York. The response was so overwhelming that there is a demand to co-pack a larger run. Meeting our goal will allow us to produce two pallets and begin to expand throughout New York. Gaining distribution and getting out to health food stores in the greater New York area are our immediate goals and we need your help to do it. Having tested the market there is definitely a need and want for our healthy and natural juices. With your help we can make this happen. Gruvi is a lifestyle brand supporting yoga, cycling, meditation and all things Gruvi! Check out our pledge list and you too can be enjoying the taste of Gruvi.

 

Thank you!

story:
COOPER

My name is Joan St.Mary.  Cooper is my great-nephew.  He is a sweet, lovable, and happy little boy almost three years old.  Cooper was born with an extremely rare genetic condition causing multiple problems.  He has scoliosis, butterflied vertebrae, fluid in his spine, a missing segment in the divider of his brain and his brain is malformed.  He also has a growth condition, a hole in his heart and a missing vessel in his heart, an enlarged lung, deteriorating optical nerves, and he is deaf in one ear. 

Cooper has already had one surgery on his spine and will require 4 or 5 more spine surgeries.  He also needs surgery on his eyes and he is scheduled for open heart surgery in May.  With each surgery Cooper's risk of paralysis or blindness becomes greater.  His doctors have suggested Cooper's mom should take Cooper to do the things he may never the get the chance to do after his surgeries.  Disneyland was recommended so Cooper could meet Mickey Mouse.

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP

We need donations to help fund Cooper's trip to Disneyland as well as to help his mom with all the uncovered medical expenses.  His mom will have expenses for transportation and meals during his hospital stay.  Cooper will be in the hospital for a minimum of three weeks and then require at home assistance for a minimum of a month, which is not covered by the insurance.

In return for your donations, you will receive our gratitude, as well as the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped improve the quality of Cooper's life.  Please say many prayers for this little boy that all of his surgeries are successful.

Every donation, no matter how large or small, is greatly appreciated.  Thank you so much for your interest.
story_txt:
COOPER
My name is Joan St.Mary.  Cooper is my great-nephew.  He is a sweet, lovable, and happy little boy almost three years old.  Cooper was born with an extremely rare genetic condition causing multiple problems.  He has scoliosis, butterflied vertebrae, fluid in his spine, a missing segment in the divider of his brain and his brain is malformed.  He also has a growth condition, a hole in his heart and a missing vessel in his heart, an enlarged lung, deteriorating optical nerves, and he is deaf in one ear. 
Cooper has already had one surgery on his spine and will require 4 or 5 more spine surgeries.  He also needs surgery on his eyes and he is scheduled for open heart surgery in May.  With each surgery Cooper's risk of paralysis or blindness becomes greater.  His doctors have suggested Cooper's mom should take Cooper to do the things he may never the get the chance to do after his surgeries.  Disneyland was recommended so Cooper could meet Mickey Mouse.
WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP
We need donations to help fund Cooper's trip to Disneyland as well as to help his mom with all the uncovered medical expenses.  His mom will have expenses for transportation and meals during his hospital stay.  Cooper will be in the hospital for a minimum of three weeks and then require at home assistance for a minimum of a month, which is not covered by the insurance.
In return for your donations, you will receive our gratitude, as well as the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped improve the quality of Cooper's life.  Please say many prayers for this little boy that all of his surgeries are successful.
Every donation, no matter how large or small, is greatly appreciated.  Thank you so much for your interest.

story:
The skinny:

 

My name is Austin Sims and I am a transgender individual. I was born female and am living the rest of my life in as the person I was meant to be - an awesome guy with hopes of becoming a pediatrician, a wonderful husband, and an amazing father. I have been taking testosterone since 2010 and my life has been drastically changed for it.

Though my life has changed for the better, there is one more thing that I need to feel complete.

 

-----Surgery.

I need to have my "top surgery" which involves the removal of the breast tissue to create a more masculine chest.  In the state of Oklahoma, one must have a surgery to be able to legally be considered male. I am fairly large chested and have a difficult time hiding my natural chest so binding is my only option and is not, by medical standpoint, healthy longterm.

 
Binding Causes:
  • fluid build up in the lungs
  • inhibited flow of the lymph system
  • back pain
  •  stiff and sore muscles
  •  breathing problems and chest pain
  •  digestion issues
 
 
 
Binding causes great anxiety for me at times and prevents me from being able to attend class or social events. It also interferes with my ability to concentrate on the task at hand, as I am always thinking about surgery and worried I will never be able to have it.

I am asking for your help because I have tried for 3 years to save the funds to be able to feel normal and have been unsuccessful ( money always ends up going to emergency expenses like unplanned car repairs).

 

I am currently working 8 hour days 7 days a week and going to school 4 hours a day Monday-Friday. My other option is a third job, with no down time to fully rest and allow my body to heal.

 
PLEASE TAKE A MOMENT TO LISTEN TO MY INTERVIEW ON THE RICK AND BRAD MORNING RADIO SHOW ON 100.5 THE KATT FM TO SPEAK ABOUT MY EXPERIENCES (4/10/2013). LISTEN HERE: http://www.katt.com/page.php?page_id=332
 

 

 IMPACT

I cannot move forward with my life without this surgery. Because I am not legally considered male, I cannot marry and will have difficulty adopting children, and those two things are the things I want most in the world right now. I'm ready to move forward.

I saw the campaign for Donnie Collins ( http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2285588... ) and was blown away by the support the indiegogo commmunity showed for his cause and can only hope and pray for the same level of support and blessing as well. It would truly change my life in the greatest way possible to be able to reach my goal.

I need to raise $8000 total.

$6500 goes to medical expenses for the surgery, and the rest will go toward travel lodging expenses.

If we ( I say we cause we are working toward this together) aren't able to achieve this goal in the allotted time, the funds raised will stay in an account to be used for surgery until I raise all the funds.

 

If the goal is reached and I receive well over my goal amount, the funds will be donated to the Jim Collins foundation ( just like Donnie Collins' campaign found here http://jimcollinsfoundation.org ) to help others like myself live a life of normalcy as much as is possible. I appreciate any support you can give.

If you are unable to donate, do not dismay! I still need help getting the word out. Methods I am using to spread the word about my campaign are:  window chalk ( writing the link on my rear windshield)  sidewalk chalk (to share the link on the sidewalk in high traffic areas)  flyers Sharing the link below the picture above on social networking sites like Facebook and twitter. If you are local, I would love the company when passing out flyers to businesses and residents! 
 
 
 
 
 

What YOU Receive By Giving

 

By your generous donations, you can receive the following perks:

Handmade candles personally made by me, shipped or delivered to you at no cost.

Sketches of your favorite superhero or cartoon, done by me shipped at no cost.

 

Test Me Bro T-shirts with the molecular structure of Testosterone in RED, BLUE, or BLACK sizes SM-XXL.

 

You can also receive a friendship bracelet, a personal letter of appreciation, and the opportunity to have me serenade a person of your choosing via in person or phone! ( not pictured).

 

 

Thank you for stopping by my site. Please share and like this page, because by doing so you can help spread this cause like a wild fire and help me reach my goal and fulfill my dream!

story:
Gene Skalicky is a husband, father of five, and a grandfather. Like most responsible people, he worries about his children and grandchildren. Even a good parent can turn their head for just a moment and tragedy can strike. How many times have you watched the news and heard about a child who was snatched or who drowned in a pool? How about a child or pet who died after being accidently left in a car on a hot day, or a disoriented patient who wandered off and got lost? What about a child who was just in the next room who had an emergency and needed help? How many times have you lost your spouse or your child in a crowd at the amusement park or at the mall? How many times have you had to yell or whistle for your kids to come in from the yard for dinner? We have designed, developed and patented a product that can help you with all of these situations and more! Our product can truly save lives and help people. Think about the practical everyday applications and markets:

  • Typical parents watching their children
  • Preventing a mentally challenged child or an Alzheimer’s patient from wandering off at night.
  • Locating a lost child in a crowd
  • Quick warning if your child falls into water.
  • Warning if your child is at an unsafe temperature (high or low)
  • Emergency call button so your child can notify you of danger or if he/she is scared
  • Ability to call all of your children to come back to you with the push of a button.
  • Keeping track of children at daycare centers
  • Field trips at school
  • Traveling, camping, hiking, skiing, sporting events, concerts, trips to the zoo or amusement park, ANYWHERE with large crowds.
  • Home Healthcare
  • Nursing homes
  • Keep track of your pets
  • Locate your car
  • Much, much more!

Our company, Sekure Koncepts, and our product, Protecht, has a FOCUS on helping parents protect the ones they love, but you can see there are many other uses. The short video above tells you about the product and its many applications. But let me tell you about our PATENTS and what makes us unique.

  • We do NOT utilize GPS so we work both indoors and outdoors and have NO MONTHLY FEEs
  • NOT line-of-sight technology so works in crowds and THROUGH walls
  • One parent unit can monitor and identify up to X tags at once
  • Two selectable invisible fence ranges for short(20'-30') and longer (70'-90") distances.
  • On-board tracking with audio and visual queues
  • Microprocessors and advanced software in both the parent and child units
  • Specialized custom antenna design
  • Unique (available only to Sekure Koncepts) radio design that allows us to switch frequencies hundreds of times per second. This allows for a very reliable connection between the units
  • No cross talk between units
  • Multi-function with one devise. (Invisible fences, tracking, water, temperature, lost signal, emergency call and call all)
  • LOW COST! Nothing does what we do. Line-of-sight units simply do not work and radio designs cost around $150 and are unreliable. The Protecht unit (one parent and one child) retails for about $79 and and only about $25 for each additional child tag

How will we use the money?

Gene and his partners have spent hundreds of thousands of dollars to make this life saving product available to parents everywhere. He and his colleagues have designed the product and written the software, they have built Alpha and Beta prototypes and tested the product. They have applied for patents (pending, but coming), paid attorneys, hired accounting firms, developed detailed marketing plans, hired a production company, designed tooling and test fixtures and handled hundreds of other details that come with launching a start-up company. Money is still needed for building the tooling and test fixtures, first production run of 500 units (to be tested by schools, nursing homes, daycare centers and families), liability insurance, packaging equipment, marketing and other expenses. In this current economy it is nearly impossible to get banks to let go of money, so YOUR HELP is really needed!

Risks and Challenges

We have proven the technology and we will never stop tweaking the software. We have met with dozens of retailers, schools, daycare centers, home healthcare companies, nursing homes and individual families and the interest level for this product is HIGH. The potential market is large and very diverse. We would like to produce 500 units this year for final field / market tests. The results of these final field tests will tell us whether the end users think our product is as awesome as we do. Assuming they do, our goal is to be in full production by the end of the first quarter of 2013. Our biggest hurdle at this point is the final funding still needed to launch the product. We hope that with the help of Indiegogo we can get this product to the market very soon. If we can save just one child’s life or help one parent find their lost child or let the spouse of an Alzheimer's patient get a good night's sleep without being concerned about their loved one wondering off, it will make our investment well worth it.

story:
Short Summary

My cousin Christina and her husband are under extreme financial stress at the moment. Their six month old daughter has two holes in her heart, and has had trouble gaining weight as a result.  At six months old she weighs less than 9 lb 11oz. The situation has become rather serious and in June she wlll undergo surgery at Children's Hospital in Seattle.  This will require several weeks of travel from Montana and lost wages. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for any contributions that you can afford in your heart to help them cover travel, food and accomodations while in Seattle (expected over 3 weeks).  Additionally this will help offset their rising bills as both Christina and her husband have lost several weeks of work already to tend to their daughters medical needs.  It's expected that she will have a long recovery post surgery.

We are hoping to raise $3500 to cover all costs between now and June.

$25+ donors will receive weekly updates from the family.

$100 donors will receive a personalized YouTube thank you from the family, plus weekly emails

$250 donors will receive all of the above plus handwritten thank you's and a sincere promise to pay-it-forward where we can.

 

The Impact

The funding will make the difference between Tena having her both her parents present at a time when she will need their love and care the most.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tena's parents have set up an account at the Valley Bank of Helena c/o Tena Lucille Bussard.  Tena's Father also has a PayPal account under the name of tmang001@msn.com.  Thank you in advance for all your thoughts and support.  If you can't help on your own, please consider spreading this cause to other family members or supporters who might be able to help.

story:
In just over a month I'll reach the Canadian border and conclude over 9 months of hiking, having covered over 7000 km of wilderness by foot (crossing New Zealand and the US). And I've been growing the beard the whole time.



The Proposition 

All good things must come to and end, and once I'm no longer in the mountains, it's time for the mountain-man beard to go. But in the process, let's do some good and have a laugh at my expense. I'll shave my beard in the style chosen by the most votes and keep  it for one month, with plenty of photos of the process and result. The catch? Votes aren't free, but all money goes to charity. 



The Cause

The Against Malaria Foundation is a highly transparent and effective group that is committed to providing insect-repellent nets to the world's poor to prevent the spread of malaria. This is by far one of the most cost effective ways to improve the quality of life of the those truly in need. The average cost of one net (including cost+distribution) is around $5, which is what I've set as the cost per vote. Just think, while choosing the fate of my facial hair you're also protecting a child from malaria. 

I've also set up the page to automatically send the money to the Against Malaria Foundation at the end of the fundraiser, so if you don't know or trust me, rest easy knowing that I never touch the money.


The Choices



I think most of the basics are covered here*, but I'm going to add one more for hilarity's sake: 

The Two-Face
AKA The 50:50, The Half n' Half. One side shaved clean, the other remains mountain-manly, split right down the middle. I don't really want to sport that for a month, so the voting cost is doubled.


So there it is! Possibly save a life while making me wear half a beard for a month. No brainier!



*I should mention that I'll be shaving my head, too. The hair will be donated to Locks of Love or similar. So picture all beard styles with short hair.

story:
Why You Don't Look & Feel Your Best 

The problem with diets, juice cleanses, and strict fasts are that they never address the underlying cause of why you can’t lose weight, keep it off, and take back your health & vitality. They’re simply missing the key factors that allow you to effortlessly lose weight and reclaim the body you always wanted.

Think about this - if you have to force the weight off through hours of cardio and dieting, how do you plan to ever keep if off for good? You can’t and you won’t. The thing that’s been missing is that to enjoy the total package of health, energy, vitality, and your ideal body, you must rebalance the underlying root causes keeping you stuck where you are right now…


One Dimensional Diets Don't Work    

Not only were fad diet and weight loss supplements not intended to help you keep the weight off, but they’ve set you up to fail thinking that it’s your fault you didn’t follow the plan correctly. Eventually they’ll lead you to believe that “nothing works for me.” 

I’ve heard that thousands of times in my practice and I understand where you’re coming from. And I agree…  Diets (even whole food ones) do not hold the secret to why you don’t see the reflection you’d like to when you look in the mirror. They're missing something, and it’s something that no one seems to be looking at.


The Dr. Cabral Detox Was Born 

For 10 years my wellness & weight loss centers have completed over 150,000 client sessions – making our research data one of the largest weight loss & wellness resources in the world. And 4 years ago, we took our revolutionary body transformation program to a whole new level.

After studying for years overseas in India, Sri Lanka, China, and the Netherlands I discovered how to combine state-of-the-art Functional Medicine with long-forgotten ancient healing traditions. The result was the most powerful, scientifically researched, full-body detoxification weight loss system ever created.

It finally addressed the underlying root causes keeping you from enjoying the life you always wanted at the weight you always dreamed of.


Why It Works

At first I thought the initial client results were a fluke, but then the success stories kept coming. I knew it was formulated to work, but I honestly originally intended it for my private wellness clients that were suffering from immune imbalances and other debilitating health issues. The fringe benefit that came along with these clients getting well again, was always a substantial weight loss.

So, I kept digging deeper into why this formula was working so well to help clients lose weight and keep it off (besides the fact that they all reported elevated mood, clearer thinking, better skin, abundant energy, and improved digestion). It turned out that these 3 products combined held the key to rebalancing the systems of the body that control inflammation, water retention, bloating, fat burning, and metabolism. This is ultimately the key to addressing the underlying causes of why you look bloated and swollen and feel like “blah.”


Targeted Weight Loss


Any fad diet can help you lose weight for a short period of time, but only a true wellness system can help you keep it off for good. The reason is that your body naturally sheds the weight as it returns to health and the Dr. Cabral Detox is intended to allow you to do that the simplest and easiest way possible through a strategic plan to address all your problem areas.

As I said before, weight loss is the symptom – not the cause. The cause of your weight issues may be hormonal, metabolic, adrenal, thyroid, immune, digestive, nutrient deficiencies, or toxicity. Hidden toxicities in one of the #1 reasons I see for people struggling to regain their health & ideal body and that’s why the Dr. Cabral Detox works so quickly and effectively – it gets to the root cause of the problem by addressing the underlying issues! 


Naturopathic Doctor Designed


I spent years studying Naturopathic Medicine, Functional Medicine, Ayurveda Medicine, and many other practices all over the world. My goal was to not force anyone I care for to fit into one medical model, but rather choose the method that would best serve them.

This philosophy led me to design what I’ve seen in my own practice to be the very best way to begin the healing process and shed needless bloating, water retention, and the weight that is keeping you from loving the way you look and feel. 


What's In It?



Scientifically Researched Ingredients


Over the past 20 years I've read tens of thousands of pages of research and tested over 1,000 nutritional supplements in the real world. I've had the privilege to see what works and what doesn't...

This is what allowed me to formulate the cleanest and most powerful detoxification cleanse ever made. It is the answer to what I was searching for when it came to giving my wellness and weight loss clients the best results in the fastest time possible.




Non-GMO


I never knew this until I began working with the top nutrition manufacturer in the US, but unless a nutritional supplement states it is non-GMO it most likely contains GMO ingredients. This is why it's imperative to look for the non-GMO seal and make sure any supplement you choose has done 3rd party testing. 

For everyone's piece of mind, I needed to make sure anything I recommend to my friends, family, and clients is something I truly believe will better their life. And I honestly believe the Dr. Cabral Detox is the best thing you can do for your mind and body. 



7-Day Success Plan



Cabral Community Favorites

After a strategic 2-day full-body detox shake, my Dr. Cabral Detox allows you to consume nourishing foods that will crush any cravings you may have and send your energy levels soaring.  We also make it easy for you by giving you a super simple 3-step guide for building healthy delicious meals. Here are just a few of our Cabral Detox Community Favorites!


6 Reason's You'll Love the Dr. Cabral Detox



7-Day Success Stories


My team and I have completed over 150,000 client appointments and have seen the power of the Dr. Cabral Detox. We love celebrating with our clients and customer community every time they send in their success story and we look forward to seeing yours soon!


Best Product. Best Price. 

The Dr. Cabral Detox is more then 12 different nutritional supplements in one at a fraction of the price! It is literally the best product available at the best price. Compare below for yourself and see how you could be saving at the same time. 


Net Cost is Zero 

The Dr. Cabral Detox is more then 12 different nutritional supplements in one at a fraction of the price! It is literally the best product available at the best price. Compare below for yourself and see how you could be saving at the same time. 


Be Apart of Something Greater

 Did you know that 45% (18,000,000+/year) of all child mortality is caused by under nutrition? Did you also know that vitamins and mineral supplementation for undernourished children was ranked the #1 priority two years in a row?

Our charitable mission is to help at-risk populations in need – specifically pregnant women, new mothers, and children under five – gain access to lifesaving and life changing vitamins and minerals. Vitamin Angels now reaches 30,459,000 at-risk families in 45 countries.

Your purchase of the Doctor Cabral Detox allows us to provide a full year’s supply of those nutrients to the women in children most in need. Join us today in making a difference!


Help When You Need It

We understand you'll have questions and when you do we'll be there ready to help! Our goal is to help you finally reach your goals and achieve the health, body, and vitality you've been searching for. We look forward to hearing from you and seeing your success story soon! 


Dr. Cabral Detox Timeline


FAQ


+ Which Dr. Cabral Detox should I choose?

We recommend that if you are looking to lose 5-10 lbs that you select the 7-day, for 10-15 lbs choose the 14-day, and for 15+ lbs of weight loss choose the 21-day Dr. Cabral Detox. Also, if you have a health issue and you are looking to help detoxify and rebalance your body, the 21-day Dr. Cabral Detox is our best recommendation.

+ Is there anyone who should NOT do the detox?

Please consult your healthcare practitioner if you are under 18, pregnant or lactating, have liver or kidney disease, gallbladder conditions, appendicitis, eating disorder, type 1 diabetes, or if any of your medications are contraindicated with any of these ingredients.

+ When is the Detox shipping? 

The Dr. Cabral Detox will be shipping on January 1st, 2016 (or sooner!). 

+ Is the Dr. Cabral Detox guaranteed to work?  

Yes, we have a 365-day 100% money back guarantee. 

+ What is the crowdfunding investment going towards? 

The crowdfunding will be used to complete the Dr. Cabral Detox packaging and labels so that we can ship it out to you on January 1st. 


Supplement Facts

For more label details please visit www.DrCabralDetox.com/supplement-facts

Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt:
Why You Don't Look & Feel Your Best 



The problem with diets, juice cleanses, and strict fasts are that they never address the underlying cause of why you can’t lose weight, keep it off, and take back your health & vitality. They’re simply missing the key factors that allow you to effortlessly lose weight and reclaim the body you always wanted.
Think about this - if you have to force the weight off through hours of cardio and dieting, how do you plan to ever keep if off for good? You can’t and you won’t. The thing that’s been missing is that to enjoy the total package of health, energy, vitality, and your ideal body, you must rebalance the underlying root causes keeping you stuck where you are right now… 

One Dimensional Diets Don't Work    


Not only were fad diet and weight loss supplements not intended to help you keep the weight off, but they’ve set you up to fail thinking that it’s your fault you didn’t follow the plan correctly. Eventually they’ll lead you to believe that “nothing works for me.” 
I’ve heard that thousands of times in my practice and I understand where you’re coming from. And I agree…  Diets (even whole food ones) do not hold the secret to why you don’t see the reflection you’d like to when you look in the mirror. They're missing something, and it’s something that no one seems to be looking at.

The Dr. Cabral Detox Was Born 





For 10 years my wellness & weight loss centers have completed over 150,000 client sessions – making our research data one of the largest weight loss & wellness resources in the world. And 4 years ago, we took our revolutionary body transformation program to a whole new level.
After studying for years overseas in India, Sri Lanka, China, and the Netherlands I discovered how to combine state-of-the-art Functional Medicine with long-forgotten ancient healing traditions. The result was the most powerful, scientifically researched, full-body detoxification weight loss system ever created.
It finally addressed the underlying root causes keeping you from enjoying the life you always wanted at the weight you always dreamed of.

Why It Works




At first I thought the initial client results were a fluke, but then the success stories kept coming. I knew it was formulated to work, but I honestly originally intended it for my private wellness clients that were suffering from immune imbalances and other debilitating health issues. The fringe benefit that came along with these clients getting well again, was always a substantial weight loss.
So, I kept digging deeper into why this formula was working so well to help clients lose weight and keep it off (besides the fact that they all reported elevated mood, clearer thinking, better skin, abundant energy, and improved digestion). It turned out that these 3 products combined held the key to rebalancing the systems of the body that control inflammation, water retention, bloating, fat burning, and metabolism. This is ultimately the key to addressing the underlying causes of why you look bloated and swollen and feel like “blah.” 


Targeted Weight Loss







Any fad diet can help you lose weight for a short period of time, but only a true wellness system can help you keep it off for good. The reason is that your body naturally sheds the weight as it returns to health and the Dr. Cabral Detox is intended to allow you to do that the simplest and easiest way possible through a strategic plan to address all your problem areas.As I said before, weight loss is the symptom – not the cause. The cause of your weight issues may be hormonal, metabolic, adrenal, thyroid, immune, digestive, nutrient deficiencies, or toxicity. Hidden toxicities in one of the #1 reasons I see for people struggling to regain their health & ideal body and that’s why the Dr. Cabral Detox works so quickly and effectively – it gets to the root cause of the problem by addressing the underlying issues! 
Naturopathic Doctor Designed




I spent years studying Naturopathic Medicine, Functional Medicine, Ayurveda Medicine, and many other practices all over the world. My goal was to not force anyone I care for to fit into one medical model, but rather choose the method that would best serve them.
This philosophy led me to design what I’ve seen in my own practice to be the very best way to begin the healing process and shed needless bloating, water retention, and the weight that is keeping you from loving the way you look and feel. 




What's In It?


Scientifically Researched Ingredients
Over the past 20 years I've read tens of thousands of pages of research and tested over 1,000 nutritional supplements in the real world. I've had the privilege to see what works and what doesn't...

This is what allowed me to formulate the cleanest and most powerful detoxification cleanse ever made. It is the answer to what I was searching for when it came to giving my wellness and weight loss clients the best results in the fastest time possible.

This is why it's imperative to look for the non-GMO seal and make sure any supplement you choose has done 3rd party testing.

story:
Short Summary

Robots are a great learning tool for engineering and coding, and sports are a great tool for making activities fun. We started teaching Sumo Robotics 2 years ago at theClubhou.se (our makerspace in Augusta, GA). Over that time we've learned many lessons and have developed our own kits and curriculum to make teaching and learning super easy and affordable. Our goal is for everyone to be able to build their own robot.

What We Need & What You Get

We are launching Mini Robot Kit 1 (MRK-1) and are taking pre-orders of our prototype kit to ship this February. Every prototype kit pre-order will be numbered and signed by our development team and include the following:

  • P4R75_MRK-1 Robot Board, Bluetooth Compatible
  • Robot Chassis Kit with battle scoop
  • Vision Sensor and motors
  • Sumo Robot League Rookie Manual with multiple lessons in circuitry, coding, and Sumo Robot rules and strategy. 
In addition, school kits include the following options:
  • CAD and .STL files of Robot Chassis Kit for customization
  • 3D Printer
  • Plastic filament in your team colors
  • Battle Ring
  • Soldering Station

The Impact

Our goal is to create the world's most accessible, affordable, and fun robotics education platform. By joining our prototyping community you help us refine our kits and grow Sumo Robot League to include more cities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you want Sumo Robot League in your school? Contact us at Schools@SumoRobotLeague.com and we'll help you create a sumo robotics athletics program.

story:
Our proposal

Have you ever wanted to use a shopping cart but no coin ready to take it out? Wouldn't it be easy to always have a coin waiting on your keychain? The answer is a coin holder shaped like a firefighters helmet!

Help us fund a mold in which this little plastic product can be formed. It is then being sold in great numbers and the benefits all go to the dutch foundation previously mentioned.

And depending on what perk you are attracted to (on your right), you can also enjoy this gadget.

Our Story

The roparun is an annual relay race from Paris to Rotterdam in which 275 teams compete; not by finishing first but by raising the most money for cancer relief. 

My team consists for the main part of firefighters and has a rich history of ending high up in the ranks.We are always looking for new ways of increasing our benefits.

One of the ways we try to do this this year is raising money by selling an everyday self-developed product.
Based on feasability, usefulness and match with the fire brigade, a choice was made for a little plastic firefighters helmet to hang from your keychain that can contain a token or a 50-eurocent coin.

What We Need & What You Get

When developing a (plastic) product, three phases are important and therefore expensive. Commitment is already made for the raw material and the injection molding itself. The costs of the mold however are the main reason we have started this campain. A safe estimate made clear we need 5500 US dollars for having this mold produced.
And when the injection molding eventually starts, an allmost innumerable amount of products can be made. Each of our team members is going to sell copies to his or hers family and friends. Batches of a 1000 copies can and will be sold for a reduced price to competative (firebrigade) teams. Firebrigade related companies are already approached for bying this product as the most appealling gift to their relations.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • When setting up this campaign, we have chosen to tick the box 'not to refund anyones contribution', because we believe that receiving a product is not so much anyones goal; deeper it is about supporting our good cause.
  • When you are a mold maker or injection molder and you are triggered, challenged and determined to beat the 5500 dollar goal yourself, feel absolutely free to contact us. This would mean an enormous boost. (For your info, the product can be formed in in a simple open/close mold and has a projected surface of approximately 2,33 square inch).

story:
OUR STORY
This woman is constantly coping with unimaginable pain, caused by massive symptoms from not less than TEN DIAGNOSIS - each on a serious level.A rare hereditary connective tissue disease Ehlers-DanlosSyndrom have made her used to, that pain is a very "normal thing"This Connective tissue disease is like a bomb in the body, put on slow release and includes many follow diagnoses.
                                       --- 
Cronic asthmatic bronchitis.  - Spinal cord injury. Neuromuscular dysfunctionnn of the urinary bladder without spec. Interstitiel cystitis/painfull bladder syndrome. -  Ehlers-Danlos SYndrome (EDS) Complex long term/cronic nonmalignant pain.  -Traumatic Stress Disorder.Septal perforation. - Depression -  Sleep-apnae(painrealted)
                                         ---
Nevertheless she has managed to complete two different educations.And until 20 years ago managed to have a rich personal and working life
When a slipped disc was diagnosed and a surgery was performed with catastrophic outcome.
She was, among other things inflicted a spinal cord injury that nobody  would take the blame for the failure operation, so she was sent home with unimaginable pains!
 No compensation - not even an excuse !!! And she may, on her own initiative, rehabilitate and learn to walk and live with indescribable pain.  Entirely on her own initiative!
She has fought to have a bearable life, because of an unfailing will to live and great adaptability. Until 3 years ago when a major collapse worsened everything. 
She been given up over the years by all doctors, hospitals all kinds of specialists and have experienced beeing abandoned, everywhere except one place.  She was told that if she would find some treatment on her own initiative, it should be NOW while there were a little strength left.
She found the hyperbaric therapy
Normally NONE of her ten diagnoses is treated in Denmark in the chamber. But she was allowed to get 25 treatments - because she continued to negotiated her way through the system   The treatment had a totally overwhelming effect on her entire state!
                        It made a LIFESAVING DIFFERENCE !!!!!
A fact which is confirmed by Scottish doctors and researcersAfter 20 treatments you have 8-fold the number of stem cells in the body.  They are the ones designed to say "  Where in the body is there damage, I must go there and healâ€
25 treatments are not enough! So she worked her way through the health system, once more, hoping that they would make an exception and help her.Despite a massive clinical picture and the bad predictions AND DESPITE THE OVERWHELMING, VISIBLE EFFECT and scottish physicians' clear and comprehensive documentation  - the answer was no !
If she must be saved action must be taken NOW.
And it requires access to a hyperbaric chamber on a regular basic, the rest of her life - and it gets denied her in the hospital system.
Therefore - we, her friends formed a committee and started this campaign in the hope that it is possible to raise money for a decompression chamber for home treatment.
Se much more about her, her situation, the struggle for the right to be here, even with ten serious diagnoses. And see more about the problems of having so massive diagnosis - and still keep the spirit up !
See also documentation of a amazing treatment
http://chamberforrise.info/                    
http://chamberforrise.info/?cat=5

 
THE IMPACT.
She has fought so hard and we will do everything we can to try make her stay here by trying to raise money for a chamber. This is where you come in - she is on disablehelp, and she is ill on the very expensive way - so there is no way she (or we) can raise this money. It has been hard for her, she would like to make it on her own, but that is not possible.   It is so unfair when suffering in this cathegori can be reduced and life can continue as an effective treatment that works so great on all the severe symptoms !   Worst is that it is due to unwillingness !!!
It is now a year since the last treatment Along the way she have been in contact with a lot of others, wanting this treatment - they were refused  - like she was first.The others gave up - some of them went to other contries to have the treatment there.
It is very hard to fight ilness and beeing disabled and then have to fight so hard to find a treatment that works, when you do - it is available, but you cant have it !
On top of everything else, she was to ill to make the journey to another contry, so she HAD to stay and negociate her way - and she got the 25 treatments !
She has tried to see if it is possible to make some changes, so it will be easier for all to have oxygen treatment. She contacted patientnetworks, politicians, doctors and others.

 

Now her strenght is running out - if she is to be saved- actions must be taken now !
 It is heartbreaking to see a person being thrown around in the system and see all the doctors refuse to gain perspective and realize how serious and lifethreatning the situation is !
Everyone is so specialized that they refuse to see an overview of the situation.
The people who are close, the few doctors who wanted to get acquainted with the situation - all diagnoses and all symptoms -  are in  shock over the state !!!
Take a look at the website and see  what she is facing every single second of a day, week after week, month after month - year after year!   And realize YOU can help make the difference !   This is the last chance - this plea for human charity compassion- help us help her and give her a pressure chamber - and a chance that she can have her life back!
In Denmark you must be registered and account for funds collected under the concept of human compassion - this to prevent fraud.  Afterwards the financial statements must approved by auditor
These things are of course correctly ordered.

What We Need & What You Get.
We need 6500 dollars, then we have so that we can buy a chamber for her. If we should be blessed with more help she could get a stronger, better, larger one.
Along the way we have been overwhelmed by so much sweet and loving care!
It is not possible to express how much it means and how much it inspires to continue the fight - so THANK YOU - a little word that can never express the humble gratitude and joy we have felt the blessings of reaching out for human compassion !!!!
Also for the special contributions - for example Susan Macalinaw from BFC  who took a collection of Rises unique artwork and transferred them into beautifull  embroidery designs and donated the sales to the pressure chamber !It has been fun and encouraging to work together on this, a collaboration that will never be forgotten!
The result can be seen here;
http://www.bfc-creations.com/Designs1000/1074TearsOfJoy/index.html
It is from this series you can choose Perks (except calendar magnets, they are made - the subject is taken from here too)
EVERY donation is greatly appreciated !

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Your assistance is appreciated  in a lot of ways, if you cant help with money - spread the word -  CLIK on the share-links - post a link ! Thank you !

Everyone is so specialized that they refuse to see an overview of the situation.
The people who are close, the few doctors who wanted to get acquainted with the situation - all diagnoses and all symptoms -  are in  shock over the state !!!
Take a look at the website and see  what she is facing every single second of a day, week after week, month after month - year after year!   And realize YOU can help make the difference !   This is the last chance - this plea for human charity compassion- help us help her and give her a pressure chamber - and a chance that she can have her life back! In Denmark you  must be registered and account for funds collected under the concept of human compassion - this to prevent fraud.  Afterwards the financial statements must approved by auditor
These things are of course correctly ordered.
What We Need & What You Get.
We need 6500 dollars, then we have so that we can buy a chamber for her. If we should be blessed with more help she could get a stronger, better, larger one.Along the way we have been overwhelmed by so much sweet and loving care! 
It is not possible to express how much it means and how much it inspires to continue the fight - so THANK YOU - a little word that can never express the humble gratitude and joy we have felt the blessings of reaching out for human compassion !!!!Also for the special contributions - for example Susan Macalinaw from BFC  who took a collection of Rises unique artwork and transferred them into beautifull  embroidery designs and donated the sales to the pressure chamber !It has been fun and encouraging to work together on this, a collaboration that will never be forgotten! 
The result can be seen here;http://www.bfc-creations.com/Designs1000/1074TearsOfJoy/index.html

It is from this series you can choose Perks (except calendar magnets, they are made - the subject is taken from here too)
EVERY donation is greatly appreciated !
 
Other Ways You Can HelpYour assistance is appreciated  in a lot of ways, if you cant help with money - spread the word -  CLIK on the share-links - post a link ! Thank you !

story:
** CHALLENGE TO DOUBLE OUR GOAL!!  EVERY DONATION WILL HELP!

Please help raise money for Gift!

Many people who read this will recognize Gift from her receptionist work at the front desk of the Florida School of Massage, where she has been most visible for the last 13 years.  But many, many others will remember her from being touched in the more unseen places in our everyday lives.  Gift has made it her quiet yet steadfast mission to reach out to populations and organizations that would not otherwise be able to receive massage.  The young parents at Arbor House, the domestically abused at Peaceful Paths, the poor and hungry at St. Francis House, the parents and children and staff at Ronald McDonald House, to name just a few – there are so many grateful strangers and now friends whom Gift has touched through the outreach programs she established at FSM.  Most recently Gift has also been dedicating her time and loving presence to the Student Clinic at the school, adding elements of organization, humor, and sensitivity to an often bustling and unique therapeutic environment.  Last but not least, some may know Gift because you are or were a massage client of hers.  At 5’1” and barely 115 pounds, many of us who have received her massage know that she could give as much as we could take.

Which brings us to the point of this fundraising campaign.  Gift has tirelessly dedicated her life to serving others by giving, extending herself, giving again, and then offering more.  Her co-workers witnessed this every day, the students at FSM commented on it in their final program evaluations, and community organizations dedicated awards to the school because of the work she spearheaded for us with them.

Here is the reason for this crucial call for financial assistance for our friend Gift: 

Back in late July, Gift began to feel some pain in her left leg.  She attributed it to a home-base slide she had done earlier in the summer while playing kickball with her grandchildren.  She limped at first, then began to hobble around, then began to use crutches because she could not put weight on the leg.  In true Gift fashion, she tried every alternative approach to ease the pain: massage from her friends, network chiropractic treatments, and acupuncture.  The pain merely got worse, causing her to finally seek out an allopathic opinion from the kind doctors at Shands Hospital.  An x-ray showed some bone degeneration in the area that caused the physicians to take some further tests. They recommended surgery and Gift reluctantly agreed to the procedure on Thursday, September 6.  Once inside, the surgeon confirmed his suspicion: there were cancerous cells eating at Gift’s left tibia.  He chose to implement a rod into her leg to further prevent any fracture of the weakened bone.

Doctors determined that the cancer in the leg was not a primary site and they aggressively began to search Gift’s body over the next 24-48 hours for the primary site.  Several tests later, they concluded the main tumor was on Gift’s cervix.  For the next day or two, specialists from gynecology, oncology and radiology poked, prodded and talked with Gift about her options – which now included radiation, chemotherapy, and bone-enhancing injections.  Gift, who has always placed life-supporting and natural remedies over conventional life-draining and drug-based options, decided she would attempt to heal herself through alternative methods.  Reminding her to take a day at a time, with nothing set in stone, the medical team blessed her on her way.

Two weeks into what Gift believed was simply a very s-l-o-w recovery, she revisited her surgeon for a check on her leg sutures and progress.  When Gift said she still found it hard to put weight on the leg, the surgeon took another picture.  Much to Gift’s dismay, the bone had degenerated further.  The medical team appeared again and strongly encouraged Gift to start a 10-day course of radiation on the leg only.  She started the next day, and is now in the middle of that process.

Gift does not have health insurance. She has not been able to work since September 5. She has rent to pay, utilities, and now exorbitant medical bills.  We are asking for a simple donation of $5, $10, whatever you can give will help!  Think of a time when Gift extended her hand or heart to you – now is the opportunity to give back to her.  Also note if you give $40 or more you can choose a gift for yourself in return.  Massages are available from the student clinic or the professional clinic, depending on your level of giving.

Gift intends to beat this dis-ease and be around to serve us all for another 54 years!  She has a daughter, three sons, and three grandkids.  So even if you can’t give just a $1 or $2 at this time, a prayer (however known) for her healing and recovery would also go a long way towards her ongoing intention for more peace and love amongst us in the world.

Thanks for your help!

story:
Alec Jacob Torchon, our wonderful son and Jackson's 19-year old brother, is incredibly well loved by family ,friends and all who knew him.  He loved his brother, loved his parents and loved his family - and he knew and felt how much we all loved him. 

He finally got to the point where he was excited about his life, his future and there was no doubt that he was the happiest he may have ever been.    

We are compelled to say that he died accidentally from a foolish mixture of alcohol and a drug that we suspect at this time was a painkiller.  As the Santa Barbara Sheriff told us, he does not understand why college students continually ignore what they know about mixing drugs and alcohol - it kills. This is something that happens to other people, other parents and other families. Yet, this happened to our son AJ, who was on his way to making this world a better place.

We understand no words can express the heartfelt pain we all share.  Jeannette, Ric and Jackson wish to thank you for all your thoughts and prayers.

Please help make AJ's death less wasteful than it already is by warning your teenage friends and family that if they ever see someone at a party drinking and about to put another drug into their body, to stop them and tell that person, "I know of a wonderful young man named AJ that did what you are about to do and he never woke up, never lived the rest of his life, and his family and friends will always miss him."

 “To live in the hearts we leave behind is not to die.”

-Thomas Campbell
 
In lieu of flowers, we kindly request a donation be made to the Alec Torchon Foundation:

The Alec Torchon Foundation has been created in loving memory of our beloved son whose life was taken from the World far too soon.  The mission of the Alec Torchon Foundation is to educate college students and their families on the deadly consequences of alcohol and drug use as well as to ensure that college students have access to the proper level of counseling, support and guidance.   

We love and miss you AJ.  You are loved by so many, and we each will carry you in our hearts forever.

A Little About Our Beloved AJ

AJ was someone who excelled at everything he put his mind into doing. He was an excellent student and graduated from Novato High School in 2011 with a GPA above 4.0. He was  part of the Marin School of the Arts program, where he played drums. He was an excellent musician, in part, due to his overall love of music. From there he went on to attend the University of California at Santa Barbara where he was majoring in BioPsychology. AJ had a passion for many things during his all too brief life; a love for his family, his friends, his music and so much more. He may leave us in body but his spirit will live on within us forever.

A Few Of AJ’s Favorite Quotations 

“You don’t want to be overlooked, but you don’t want to be looked over too much.” -- Aesop Rock

“When you’ve never been moved its really hard to move on.” -- Michael Larson (Eyedea)

“You can lead a horse to fresh water but you can’t teach it how to be okay when you decide to leave.” -- Eyedea

“Its beautiful the way agony connects us to the living. I think of the world when I hurt, and keep on existing in the now.” - Eyedea

“I wont forget the times you helped me find my feet when I was buried in my head.” -- Eyedea

story:
Surgery "is going to change my life completely," said Surgeons For Smiles (SFS) patient, Filmon Haile (featured above with his family), in a recent interview with the Capital Gazette.

As a child, Filmon received radiation therapy to treat a tumor in his face. However, the radiation prevented growth and as a result, Filmon had a facial deformity that his home country, Eritrea, did not have the medical capacity to treat.

That’s where we step in. SFS arranged for Filmon to travel to Annapolis, Maryland for a complex surgery performed by SFS founder, Dr. Edward Zebovitz.

From Annapolis to Eritrea, the reach of SFS is expanding. Not only are we bringing high-quality surgeries to underserved regions of the world, but now we have partnered with Anne Arundel Medical Center to bring patients to our home base in Annapolis to receive the care they need.

This September our founder, Dr. Edward Zebovitz, makes his 13th surgical trip to Eritrea, where he works alongside national hero Dr. Laynesh to provide free surgeries in a country hit by war and poverty.

SFS averages 25 free surgeries in less than a week! We invite you to contribute to this effort.

A contribution of $250 will fund an entire Cleft Lip/Cleft Palate operation; a donation of $75 covers stitches for 4 surgeries.  
A donation of any amount makes a difference when every cent goes directly towards surgery and care.

story:
Turning Point: Teaching people to live their lives to the fullest

More people will live their lives to the fullest by learning resilience – the ability to bend without breaking.


About Turning Point

Turning Point: The Center for Hope and Healing offers programs and services to people who are living with a serious or chronic illness and their loved ones. Turning Point is a 501(c)(3) organization, and depends on philanthropic support to deliver all programs free of charge.

While we focus on serving people with a serious or chronic illness, our programs can help everyone – healthy or not – reduce anxiety, depression and stress.

Our participants find friends and support, but we are not a traditional support group. Our research-based programs, presented by credentialed professionals, have a curriculum and we teach specific skills.

But what does that really mean?

It means Louise, diagnosed with Parkinson's disease, learns practical skills to cope with the ups and downs that accompany a neurological illness.

It means Rhonda finds a way to overcome compassion fatigue and take care of herself as well as her husband, who has cancer.

It means Liz, a young woman with a brain tumor, discovers a new tribe of friends – people who truly understand her challenges and disappointments.

It means Dave, who lives with heart disease, learns yoga, which reduces his blood pressure.

It means siblings Emma and Oliver meet other children and teens who have a parent with a serious illness.

And it means that since 2001, more than 90,000 people in the Kansas City area have reduced their anxiety and depression, better managed their pain, adjusted to a new normal and have lived their lives to the fullest – even while coping with a physical illness.


If You Give

Currently, we have the resources to serve people with chronic illness only in the Kansas City area. We are unable to reach people who are homebound, who live farther away or who are simply interested in building resilience. No other organization in the country provides the services we do free of charge.

If you help us reach our $50,000 goal, we will create online, interactive versions of our 10 most popular programs. We will be able to reach so many more people around the country and around the world, providing more care, hope and healing. If we raise funds beyond our goal, we will create additional programs.

All programs will remain free of charge.

With your gift, you will receive perks that will help you develop resilience, too.

Please help us expand our reach. We may be able to help you, a family member, a friend or a neighbor – no matter where you live.

story:
Short Summary

With Prop 37 bringing worldwide attention and awareness to the fact that people care about what's in their food, why is it that Canada is behind on bringing attention to Genetically Modified Organisms in our food chain?  We WILL change that. 

Canada has long boasted about better regulations on food then other countries, however the pace at which biotechnology and major corporations are moving is changing that drastically. We must remember our politicians are only human, and have the same oversights many consumers have in regards to our food.

Together Zach and Benzel have started the petition to begin mandatory labeling of GMOs in Ontario.  We are also simultaneously running an awareness campaign geared towards youth and the general public. With a growing online presence, cultivating media appearances, and the FREE Wellness & Lifestyle seminars we have already completed, it is our hope to take this to other cities in the Province as part of a Wellness/GMO Awareness Tour.

Studies show a link between the GM foods and the rise in Autism, as well as digestive disorders like IBS and Crohns. There are over 50 other countries worldwide that either require mandatory labeling or have outright bans on GMO foods. Our CHILDREN ingest the largest amount of products that may be Genetically Engineered, yet still here on the western side of the world we have over 300 million hectares of GMO crops and ZERO labeling!

 


'IF IT'S GMO YOU SHOULD KNOW!' - our petition slogan

What We Need & What You Get

We have already arranged a few press appearance, received a great deal of positive feedback and held over 5 FREE public educational seminars.

This is a firm belief we hold that comes from the heart. We began this mission because of that, however the reality is that we need your help and support to continue this campaign, our seminar series, and take this show on the road in the form of a multi-city TOUR.

 

COSTS INCLUDE


*Travel Expenses for core team members - gas, hotels, bus/train tickets

*Admin/Production Costs - Web design, adding unlimited long distance to our phone plans for 6 months, graphic design and printing costs for flyers stickers and other materials, cost of a publicist for 6 month contract, occasional venue rentals for space to run our seminars, rentals of camera's and paying operators and editors to help us with Viral Videos.

We have the perks listed additionally. Check them out!

The Impact

The GMO Campaign is already underway:  Zach the lead team member has already run 5 FREE wellness seminars educating the public on GMO's and other health issues.

He has also made multiple press appearances regarding GMOs and overall health. These include such media outlets as Press For Truth TV, Global TV, and ThatChannel.com

With your help we hope to run more FREE seminars, as well as tour to Schools, Conventions, and Radio/T.V stations to share the message and promote our petition.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you can't donate PLEASE, support us by promoting the campaign and sharing it on your facebook or twitter.  You can also SIGN THE PETITION :)

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
