story:
Short Summary

Brixton Mary is a beautiful, precious, sweet 1 year old baby girl who is FIGHTING a rare childhood cancer called Pleuropulmonary Blastoma (PPB). Her cancerous tumor was discovered when she was just 6 weeks old and removed when she was 6 months old. Although doctors feel confident they removed the entire tumor, PPB is a very aggressive type of cancer that has a high rate of re-occurence in young children under the age of 5. There are currently only approximately 380 cases WORLDWIDE reported since the early 1980's when it was first discovered. Research indicates chemotherapy is the best route to take to ensure survival for children with this diagnosis; to reduce risk of re-occurence. Brixton will be receiving chemotherapy over the next 9 months. For those of you who are not aware, chemotherapy on a small child is frightening, exhausting, saddening, and extremely hard on a child as well as the parents and family. LET'S UNITE AND FIGHT THIS AWFUL DISEASE! 

What We Need

Although the Collins family has insurance, they will need at LEAST $5,000 just to help cover co-pays for inpatient hospital stays. In addition to medical expenses, there are other major costs associated with caring for a child with cancer.  Although we know that the costs will far exceed $5,000, we didn't want to set an overwhelming goal and our hope is to actually surpass our goal significantly!

The financial assistance they need will also include: outpatient visits, medication costs, travel, gas, enhanced nutrition, lost pay for mom and dad due to missed work days, etc. The family lives roughly 75 miles away from Rady Children's hospital where they need to travel at minimum, once per week for the next 9 months. The gas costs alone are astronomical for this family. 

The Impact

Your contribution will enhance the quality of life for this precious girl and her family. The stress of the disease itself is enough to make a child more sick let alone the financial stress. Let's work together and help relieve financial burden so that Brixton's mom and dad can focus all of their energy on this sweet girl and her brothers! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contributions are tremedously appreciated. However, if you are not able to donate, we ask you to share this page with everyone you know. Post the link on facebook. We ask for your prayers, positive thoughts, good energy and love sent Brixton's way. Let's unite and HELP Brixton FIGHT CANCER. PLEASE SHARE IN EMAILS AND ANY OTHER COMMUNITY WEBSITES. Help us spread the word about this campaign. We really appreciate all of your kindness and support during this difficult time.  Please feel free to add a message in the comments tab and take a look at the updates on Brixton's progress. Thank you very much! Together, we can show our LOVE and help BRAVE BRIXTON BEAT CANCER!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Brixton Mary is a beautiful, precious, sweet 1 year old baby girl who is FIGHTING a rare childhood cancer called Pleuropulmonary Blastoma (PPB). Her cancerous tumor was discovered when she was just 6 weeks old and removed when she was 6 months old. Although doctors feel confident they removed the entire tumor, PPB is a very aggressive type of cancer that has a high rate of re-occurence in young children under the age of 5. There are currently only approximately 380 cases WORLDWIDE reported since the early 1980's when it was first discovered. Research indicates chemotherapy is the best route to take to ensure survival for children with this diagnosis; to reduce risk of re-occurence. Brixton will be receiving chemotherapy over the next 9 months. For those of you who are not aware, chemotherapy on a small child is frightening, exhausting, saddening, and extremely hard on a child as well as the parents and family. LET'S UNITE AND FIGHT THIS AWFUL DISEASE! 


What We Need
Although the Collins family has insurance, they will need at LEAST $5,000 just to help cover co-pays for inpatient hospital stays. In addition to medical expenses, there are other major costs associated with caring for a child with cancer.  Although we know that the costs will far exceed $5,000, we didn't want to set an overwhelming goal and our hope is to actually surpass our goal significantly!
The financial assistance they need will also include: outpatient visits, medication costs, travel, gas, enhanced nutrition, lost pay for mom and dad due to missed work days, etc. The family lives roughly 75 miles away from Rady Children's hospital where they need to travel at minimum, once per week for the next 9 months. The gas costs alone are astronomical for this family. 


The Impact
Your contribution will enhance the quality of life for this precious girl and her family. The stress of the disease itself is enough to make a child more sick let alone the financial stress. Let's work together and help relieve financial burden so that Brixton's mom and dad can focus all of their energy on this sweet girl and her brothers! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Monetary contributions are tremedously appreciated. However, if you are not able to donate, we ask you to share this page with everyone you know. Post the link on facebook. We ask for your prayers, positive thoughts, good energy and love sent Brixton's way. Let's unite and HELP Brixton FIGHT CANCER. PLEASE SHARE IN EMAILS AND ANY OTHER COMMUNITY WEBSITES. Help us spread the word about this campaign. We really appreciate all of your kindness and support during this difficult time.  Please feel free to add a message in the comments tab and take a look at the updates on Brixton's progress. Thank you very much! Together, we can show our LOVE and help BRAVE BRIXTON BEAT CANCER!!

story:
Let me introduce you to Pristine Farms, and Grandma.  On the farm, we reared tropical fish exclusively--until recently.  Grandma changed that.


Around the age of 75 she was diagnosed with cancer.  We tried to get her to have the needed surgery but she refused.  “I’m too old to go through all that mess.”  After many attempts, I found out her real reason for not wanting the surgery.  She had heard of the horrors of chemo-therapy and was fearful of having to go through it. (You may know someone that had chemo and understand the problems they may have had.)  She lived many years more without complications before passing.

Chemotherapy patients while suffering with cancer, face additional challenges.  Chemotherapy often not only causes the patient physical problems, but also alters the taste of foods, imparting a metallic taste to the foods once enjoyed and needed in the patient’s fight against the cancer.  This in turn causes the patient to avoid these foods and additionally, often causes a drastic loss in weight.

For many, Miracle Fruit,  a small red berry, has the ability to eliminate the bad taste of foods caused by chemotherapy.  Weight loss caused by the patients avoiding the “metallic tasting foods” could be drastically reduced or eliminated by Miracle fruit.  With an enjoyable, nutritious diet weight-loss could be minimized giving patients stronger, healthier bodies to fight the cancer. 

See the following research articles regarding chemotherapy and miracle fruit.

  • http://www.oncologypractice.com/jso/journal/0702.html
  • http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23022943?report=abstract

                         

            Miracle Fruit Blossoms                        Miracles on the Bush

                        

                 Close up Miracles              Miracles can be Small and Wonderful 

 We also felt that the online price of the fruit would create undo additional stress for people suffering through the agony of cancer and chemotherapy.  At this point, we have spent a year working on getting our cost of production down, way down compared to the online price.  Now, we need your help in reducing the cost to the patients even more. (Hopefully, to just shipping cost)

In the U.S. the ACS states that there are nearly 1 million patients undergoing chemotherapy a year.  We estimate that our minimum goal ($21,000) will supply 200-500 chemo-patients with Miracle fruit during their treatment.  The number of patients served will depend on the length of each patient’s treatment and the total funds raised.

http://chemocare.com/chemotherapy/what-is-chemotherapy/how-long-is-chemotherapy-given.aspx#.UjfVaMYqiSo

We need your support to serve a larger number of chemo-patients. If you cannot help financially at this time you can still make a difference. Let everyone in your circle know about this campaign. Email, text, tweet, etc.  Share with everyone you know this link and encourage them to check out this cause. You can also use the easy link options provided by Indiegogo

HELP SHARE MIRACLES

Thanks for your caring support.

Leo, Jennifer, Steve, and Christine

story:
From YNN News:

 

She is confined to her bed in the living room. Doreen Bertolone is now quadriplegic. She's a victim of chronic progressive multiple sclerosis.

"I hadn't been feeling good," says Doreen, "and they finally sent me to a neurologist, and I was diagnosed with MS."

That was 18 years ago. All those pictures on the wall show the progression of Doreen's illness, from walking with a cane, to now using a specially-designed wheelchair.

"It's the worst kind of multiple sclerosis; there's no remission," says Dan. "It was rough, watching her get chipped away like that."

Dan and Doreen married in 1975. Her sickness began nineteen years later, when their three young triplets were just seven-years-old. But through working and parenting, and even fighting back pains from lifting his wife around the house, Dan has never let illness interfere with marriage.

"I got her to all the weddings, I got her to all the graduations, I got her to all the kids' functions and sporting events," says Dan. "I mean, how many teacher conferences can you go to? But we got to them all."

Which brings us to the Bertolone family van. At ten years old, with 140,000 miles behind it, the van has seen better days. The most important part of the van for Doreen is the handicap-accessible ramp-and-door device, but it doesn't even work right: it struggles to open, and needs help to shut. There's also a gaping hole, where you can see clear through to the inside.

In light of the van's condition, the Bertolone's five grown children have banded together to buy a new handicap-accessible van through fundraising on Indiegogo.  Now, they're waiting for donations... and maybe a miracle.

"Picture growing up and seeing both of them kind of struggle and suffer," says Donna Swiech, one of Dan and Doreen's triplet daughters. "That's what we've had to deal with. And the hardest thing you can see is two people you love, suffer.

"So they really deserve it."

story:
Our Story

My name is Jessica and I was diagnosed with Stage 3a Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (breast cancer) on April 11, 2011. Immediately following my diagnosis, I went into intense rounds of chemotherapy treatments of adriamycin / cytoxin (4 bi-weekly cycles) followed by taxol (4 b-weekly cycles) followed by complete mastectomy (left side) and a modified radical mastectomy with lymph node removal (right side) All that intense chemo in my body caused all the hair on my body to fall out, nausea, fatigue, mental fog, and loss of both my breasts leaving me with ugly scars instead and what looks like deformity until I have my reconstruction done, which even then will not remove the scars. After going through months of treatments and recovery, it was discovered that when the removed tissue and lymph nodes were tested, 4 out of 5 tested positive for active cancer cells. 

It was recommended by 3 out of 4 doctors that I take on another round of chemotherapy before entering into radiation treatments just to be sure. I did as the doctor said and within the first two rounds of treatments, my white cell counts tanked and I had to stop treatments until they raised themselves back to a normal range. This was my wake up call. I was technically, said to be cancer free, this was just a precaution, and it was killing my body more than it was helping it. There had to be another way to do this. Killing my body so that it doesn't kill me seems like an oxymoron. Something had to change.

In the weeks between stopping treatment and the scheduled restart date, I began to do my research. I read every article, book, interview, research report that I could get my hands on. I watched videos and interviews. I emailed extensively with survivors of holistic treatment and listened to their stories of success. It was time to change. I made drastic changes to my diet and lifestyle. I began drinking gallons of water a day, eating only natural whole foods, avoiding all things processed and damaged, and began a vegan lifestyle. I immediately started seeing a difference. My hair began growing back, I had more energy, and I knew that something was right inside of me. 

When going into my followup with my oncologist, I decided to refuse all further treatments and begin to heal the natural way. "Dr. John McDougall is a Physician and nutrition expert who teaches better health through vegetarian cuisine. John A. McDougall, MD. has been studying, writing and speaking out about the effects of nutrition on disease for over 30 years." I have chosen Dr. McDougall to be my primary physician for the remainder of my treatment. He offers a 10 ten day program which must be completed in order to become one of his patients. The problem is that insurance does not cover alternative care. Thats where you come in... 

The Impact

This is a way of helping insure that I can live the rest of my life cancer free and to know that I will not relapse with a vengeance. This is my way of obtaining full health and knowing that I am living in the way that God has intending me to live. It will provide me with a testimony that God not only brought me through this battle but made me stronger through it. You will be helping me to become who I know God created me to be and through that I know I can handle anything. 


What We Need

The total cost of the program plus airfare and travel expenses is just over $5500. Because insurance will not cover the cost of care from this particular doctor, I am starting from zero. I was unable to raise the funds to attend the 10 day program in January, so I am aiming to become his patient and attend the program in March. In order to process the funds raised, I have until the 1st of March to brings the funds in. I know there isn't a whole lot of time, but I know that it is possible. I just need help.


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Use the share tool and tell your friends, family, and total strangers. Give what you can. Every little bit helps. 

If you can't give, pray. Pray that God continues to guide my steps and that my body is restored back to complete and total health. Your prayers mean just as much to me as your contribution to my treatments.

story:
On June 16,2013 I was in a near fatal car crash with my brother. I broke every vertebra in my spine while my brother broke 3 ribs and his collar bone. My Mother and Stepfather moved out of the house the week of the accident taking their belongings and moving to Texas. They emptied our bank accounts and took the money we had collected to pay the rent and bills. I had surgery on September 3, 2013 at Highland Alameda County Medical Center to have titanium rods, pins and plates to repair my spine. It will be a year before I will know if I can work again. All of the agencies I have spoken with have  told me that they do not have the funding, space or resources to assist our family, specifically because of my disability and, my lack of income.

The impact of this donation campaign will assist us in finding a place to live while I recover from my surgery and take care of basic needs like paying rent, fixing the donated car (that needs to be repaired) so my brother can go back to work full time and assist me in taking my children to and from school, taking to my physical therapy and numerous follow-up medical appointments at Highland Medical Center in Oakland. My Brother Jason has been my primary caregiver and support system before and since the accident.  

I have applied for Social Services (welfare for myself and my children). I have also applied for Social Security and Social Security Disability but these processes take time.

My Brother and I just went through the eviction hearing process on August 11, 2013 and as long as we vacate the house before December 10,2013 (about 60 days)  we will not be charged for back rent, have a court eviction on our records and will have a positive rental reference from our Landlords. 

Anything you wish to give is a blessing and we are truly thankful for your kindness and compassion.

Respectfully,

Kimberly M. McCreary

 We are asking for this amount because we don't know the future or my future needs. Don't worry if you don't have it pray for us. Just remember PENNIES spend too! We accept prayer, well wishes, spare change and connections to resources. With so little time left I cannot be choosy about what I receive. I am just happy people are willing to help. Thank you!


Before the accident my younger Brother Jason and I decided to pool our resources to take care of my Mother (who has serious health issues) and Stepfather and my two sons. We believed that everything we did was to help us all move forward and become self sufficient and have stability in our lives.

It became very clear 6 months in that the money my Brother and I were contributing to the household was not being used towards rent and bills. When we both asked where the money was going we never got a clear answer. Our Landlord was kind and understanding to a point but it was clear that something very strange was going on. In March 2013 I reached out to every public service agency looking for assistance in paying rent and our utility bills and/or finding a cheaper place to live. We were unsuccessful due to the demands of families in similar situations.


Thank you for your time and resources it is  greatly appreciated.

story:
Why fund Jenny?

Jenny is a badass voluptuous yogini who is passionate about body-positive yoga and is ready to take her practice to the next level by becoming a curvy yoga teacher!

  • Jenny has been an avid yoga practitioner for almost three years
  • Much like a Consulting Detective, she gives freely of her time and talent at YogaQuest
  • Jenny inspires others both on and off the mat
  • Your contribution will allow Jenny to pursue her dream

"This woman already kicks ass, but if she were a certified yoga instructor?  Watch out, known world."--Xena, Warrior Princess

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for you:

  • Jenny needs this money to make a deposit towards her training
  • Without this deposit, Jenny can't guarantee her spot and start working towards her dream
  • When you donate, you will get some awesome yoga-related swag
  • Three words: FUTURE YOGIC AWESOMENESS

"I look forward to the day she can grip me tight and raise me from perdition.  Or adjust my downdog."--Some sad-eyed angel in a trenchcoat

The Impact

The difference your contribution makes:

  • Minneapolis will finally have a certified Curvy Yoga instructor
  • Jenny will be able to teach yogis of all sizes to love the bodies they live in
  • Her geeky contributions to YogaQuest will be expanded beyond scriptwriting,  narration, and humorous cautionary tales about her failed marriages
  • She'll finally be able to teach the nerdy goth yoga class of her dreams
  • Please help Jenny to continue to inspire others both on and off the mat

"Jenny's body positivity and belief in health at any size create a welcome environment for yogis of all body types and fitness levels at YogaQuest. With her teacher training, I know that Jenny will be able to reach many others and show them that yoga is for every body."--Kris Anne (yes, occasionally a non-fictional character is willing to provide a testimonial!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Jenny's campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for looking at Jenny's page!

story:
Tata-Punch redefines boxing in an innovative way.

Tata-Punch ,a smart fitness product,brings science and fun to your boxing workout with an entertaining mobile APP.

Tata-Punch guides the boxer with light up sensors that are able to analyze each punch and teach important fighting techniques.The workout will improve your ability as boxer while giving you the perfect physique. Tata-Punch’s training system is a fun and thrilling way for beginning boxers to fall in love with the sport as they learn and get shape.

 


 

Tata-Punch can be combined with the mobile app to achieve a variety of sport modes that keep your boxing workout exciting.  The app also allows you to find like-minded boxing partners with whom you can spar, share photos, and enjoy your training.

Personal mode: customize training to fit your needs and schedule so that you get the perfect workout every time.

Training mode: use the light-up sensors to train your reaction time, speed, and strength.

Game mode: allows two or more users to train together and do their workouts to music creating a unique, fun, and exciting exercise experience.

In addition, Tata-Punch tracks and provides expert analysis of your stats including punch power, speed, reaction time, and the number of calories burned.  The data is portrayed in a graph helping you to visualize and track your improvement.  Tata-Punch is like having your very own boxing coach.

The app allows users to take photos and share their achievements on social media during the course of a workout.

 Up to 4 Tata-Punch pads can connect to a single app for a competitive multiplayer mode. 

The hardware of Tata-Punch uses interactive light and sound technology.  You can follow the lights on the pad to learn boxing techniques and train your responses.  The voice technology motivates users to train harder, and gives helpful directions and analysis of stats so that users can become aware of their strengths and weaknesses.

 

Bluetooth connectivity makes Tata-Punch the perfect combination of exercise and technology .

Durable microfiber material designed with a unique pressure sensing system for more precision.

 

Do not try this at home!

The Tata-Punch can be taken anywhere and is perfect for the gym, the office, or at home.  Tata-Punch makes training fun for boxers of all ages and skill levels.

 

 

Attention!

Boxing is an intense exercise that can easily lead to injury.  Please use the Tata-Punch pad under the guidance of professionals when learning to use the product.

To avoid and unwanted injury because boxing is an intense exercise can easily lead to wrist, ankle and other bone dislocation injury, please play with the tata-punch pad under the guidance of professionals to warm up and use the product.

Do not use weapons to puncture the product, or hard objects (metal, sticks, ect.) to beat violently on the pad.

It is recommended that minors use under the guidance of a coach or guardian as to not injure themselves.

This product is NOT waterproof, please use in a dry area.

This product is NOT fire proof, please keep away from an open flame.

 

Warranty

A free one year limited warranty is included in your Tata-Punch purchase.  

Please fill out your warranty card upon receiving the product with your relevant information; Name, Username, address, date of purchase, product name model and equipment number. If warranty service is required, the warranty card must be produced for identification.

Accidental damage due to improper use, unauthorized maintenance, dismantling, or improper storage which lead to equipment failure are not covered under warranty.

story:
Introducing the GoPUCC!

The most versatile, multipurpose, collapsible shaker bottle!

 

We all know hydration is extremely important in our lives to maintain fitness and overall well-being. Now I know what you're thinking, there are hundreds of thousands of types of other bottles out there, why the GoPUCC?

I'll get to that in a second...

Everyone drinks different beverages besides water (i.e. coffee, pre-workout, post-workout protein shakes, meal replacement shakes, adult beverages, the list goes on..). Of these, each bottle is usually specialized to accept ONE particular drink. A water bottle is a water bottle, a shaker bottle is a shaker bottle, and a coffee cup is a coffee cup. Many of them are all great, but also consist of many parts and are difficult to clean and maintain in our busy lifestyle. Some of them are noisy, some you can't get out that nasty protein smell, and some just are not aesthetically pleasing.

It is time to bring it back to the basics, but innovate. This is where the GoPUCC was born. For the "on-the-go" person, you likely are traveling somewhere all the time. By foot, by bike, by car, by plane. You probably carry a phone and wallet with you all the time and often leave your hydration bottle somewhere. On the contrary, you might also have a cabinet full of all of these types of specialized bottles to accommodate for the beverages listed above. 

This is where the GoPUCC bridges the gap.

A durable, military-grade bottle you can carry with you everywhere.

 

 

 

Like many of you, we knew there was a better way. You no longer need to carry multiple bottles with you. With GoPUCC, you just need one. You can take this bottle camping, eat soups/oatmeal/cereal out of it. You name it!

 

 

 Going to a party? Cheers to some beer with it! Even make the perfect mixed drinks with your GoPUCC! The days of putting your name with a marker on a disposable cup are gone!  

 

 

The GoPUCC is a new innovative hydration bottle that accommodates any beverage you want to take with you, using the same bottle. If you want to go to work with a coffee, and later fill it up with water, to use it after the gym and put your protein in there, you can do it all with one bottle! In between these, the GoPUCC collapses into a "puck" like shape (I bet you didn't guess that one!) to eliminate wasted space in the event you need to travel. Who has room in their luggage for an empty water bottle? Space is important, and we know from firsthand experience.

The GoPUCC was founded by two military veterans and developed by athletes just like you who want the "jack of all trades" type of bottle that is conducive to your active lifestyle.

In this case, less is more. We did all the hard work for you so you can live with your GoPUCC and know that you can enjoy your coffee, pre-workout, post workout, water and even adult beverage from just one bottle, anywhere you go!

Join us as a Founding Backer and claim your new Personal Utility Collapsible Canteen!

 

About Us

 

Brandon (blue shirt) is a 13 year active duty Air Force veteran, CrossFit Level 2 Trainer, Husband, and Father of two. He has always had a passion for fitness and helping people improve their lives through fitness. He prides himself in seeing others make improvements and living a better quality of life. He loves watching any Disney movie with his kids, a good pizza and a beer on the weekends.

John (green shirt) is a 12 year active duty Marine, CrossFit Level 2 Trainer, Owner of CrossFit Valley Springs in Northern California, Husband, and Father of two. John has also dedicated his passion in fitness by opening up his own CrossFit gym aside from being active duty Marine and continues to thrive on other peoples' accomplishments.

As a Veteran Owned Business, Brandon and John have 100% organically developed and funded the GoPUCC venture. We cannot wait to bring Founding Backers into the mix to bring this to market! Thanks for reading.

story:
Erica and Phil say...

Our friend Stephen Bacon is fighting cancer at the moment and going through chemotherapy. When we asked if we could help by doing a spot of fundraising for him.. (he is unable to work and therefore on basic benefits), he asked us to do his fundraising for a new charity called Cancer is a Drag who give financial support and wellbeing to people and their families living with cancer. Cancer is a Drag supported Stephen when he first had financial worries and he would love to give support back to them and fellow sufferers through our fundraising. 

On Sunday 10th August, Erica will be taking part in Ride London - the 100 mile cycle ride around London and Surrey. 

Phil will be running the Loch Ness Marathon on the 28th September - 26 miles and 385 yards.

Can you help us to help Stephen to help others living with cancer? Please sponsor us no matter how small, and spread the word!

story:
The iHeart System measures Aortic Stiffness, the best indicator of your biological health. iHeart measures your pulse for a 30 second non-invasive test that provides immediate results: your physiological age.

The iHeart System empowers people with knowledge about their physical state they wouldn't otherwise know. 

Why care about Aortic Stiffness?
Aortic stiffness has been linked to an individual’s risk of developing cardiovascular disease and their overall health. By using the iHeart device, people can view information they need and motivation to make positive lifestyle choices. 
iHeart is a fully developed and tested fingertip pulse analysis system linked to iPhones and iPads. It is ready for commercial production. We need your help to manufacture iHeart in quantity and support R & D, leading to other personal health monitoring products in the pipeline.


The iHeart device measures your pulse for 30 seconds and provides immediate results on your iPhone or iPad loaded with the free iHeart Physiological Age application. With positive lifestyle choices you can actually watch yourself get physiologically younger day by day.  

The iHeart Oximeter has the highest sampling rate of any pulse oximeter on the market. The iHeart System can see so deep into the pulse that distinct waves are found that allow us to determine aortic stiffness. 






The iHeart device has market leading resolution and sampling speed, there are no other oximeters like it. The iHeart can see deep into your pulse to define waves in the blood flow. This provides accurate measurement of aortic pulse wave velocity and paired with our app and measurement methods (patent pending) determine your physiological age. 



 

The fingertip sensor connects via Bluetooth 4.0 to your iPad or iPhone loaded with our free Physiological Age app. The test takes 30 seconds and results are immediate. Results are stored on your own personal iheartalive.com website.

Screenshot of a test 15 seconds in. 


Results Screen


Trending Screen


Past results and trending graphs are stored both on the user's iPhone and/or iPad as well as their www.iheartalive.com personal webpage. 

This device will allow the user to understand the dynamic nature of their body
and see how different choices are effecting their body internally. 

We have a fully functional and successfully beta tested product and iOs application which will be sent out February, 2015 to early adopters. 

The iHeart Physiological Age Monitor system has been validated against aortic pulse wave velocity testing using the gold standard method of aortic stiffness testing. Click here for scientific literature :

http://www.iheartalive.com/faqs#studies-that-prove

A recent study shows that there's a strong relationship between aerobic exercise and arterial stiffness. The more vigorous the exercise, the better the effect. Check it out here.

This campaign is so important to us as a small Canadian startup to help provide funding to sell our first 500 devices! 



As a small tech startup we need funding to manufacture and make our orders! We will be sending our product to early adopters February, 2015. 




Dr. Jess Goodman, MD
Founder + CEO

Jess is a Physician in General Practice with experience in wearable personal health monitoring device development. He is passionate about giving individuals better ways to visualize, monitor, manage and improve their health.

“15 years ago Moy Lin Shin, a Taoist Monk and my Tai Chi teacher, asked me to show people health benefits associated with stretching between the heart and the kidneys. Surprisingly, the medical scientific literature confirmed that the stiffer your Aorta (and your body’s core) the greater your chance of developing illness. iHeart allows people to easily visualize and follow improvements in core mobility with exercise, good diet and stress reduction. iHeart, promised to a Taoist monk, delivered to you.”



SARAH GOODMAN
Director of Marketing & Public Relations

Sarah’s experience in marketing and public relations as well as her designations as both a registered holistic nutritionist (RHN) and certified personal trainer (CPT) provide her with the knowledge and skills to be an effective communications professional for the Vitalsines team.

“I have a personal experience with iHeart. I’ve had three knee surgeries in my life, two of which were in a three week period last year. Using iHeart, I was able to monitor my recovery in a very different way than I had after previous injuries. Watching my iHeart readings improve, and my physiological age drop, provided insight I had never had before. It gave me such great motivation and bodily awareness. I still use iHeart daily to see how my body changes and reacts to both positive and negative stimulus.”



BENOIT LEWDEN MSc, Engineering
Director of Application Development

Ben is an engineer with experience in biosignal analysis, server based secure data management, oximeter arterial pulse signal acquisition and analysis. He is also an expert in Android and iPhone App development, web site programming, real time data communication/notification and PhD level research study design. 

“The iHeart project is a perfect example of the reasons I love what I do. I get to utilize top notch technology and analyze data in very novel ways to create a product that will be used by people. I'm especially enthusiastic about this project because it had a direct effect on my life. I started to work on it a few months after I quit smoking and got to witness the real-time changes in my own arterial pulse wave as the months went by. It was a great motivation and I'd like to share this experience with others.”

As a company, we are dedicated to helping people understand what’s happening in their bodies and how they can optimize health naturally. Our goal is to help motivate people to change for the better, and by doing so improve their health and life in general.

So come on, get younger with iHeart. 



Your contribution will allow for a larger group of people to gain awareness of the iHeart system, which has the opportunity to change lives through positive motivation. 

iHeart Physiological Age Monitor is one of a roll out of devices that will be launched by VitalSines, Inc under the iHeart Name.


Aortic Stiffness is a powerful proven indicator of internal health. Over 100 articles in the medical scientific literature have shown aortic stiffness as a valid indicator of heart health and overall health. 

iHeart is designed to be used by health oriented individuals aged 18-70.

NO iheart is not a medical device. It is a health and wellness educational tool. iHeart should not be used as a diagnostic tool. It is not intended to be used for any medical diagnosis or management of any medical condition.  

We will being shipping in February, 2015.


If you can't contribute but want to help, please spread the word about iHeart through twitter, facebook, and Indiegogo share tools! 

       

Please note that our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all questions and comments that are left on the comments page but the easiest way to get immediate assistance is to email our Support Team

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please contact  sarah@iheartalive.com

story:
"Training Pants" in Adult Sizes - Round 2

Many older kids, teens and adults have trouble staying completely dry, or just want the confidence that a daytime pant can give! These wonderful undies give you a waterproof outer shell of PUL in classic white or fun "big Kid" prints covering two thirsty layers of microfiber, and a soft and reassuring terry-cotton inner layer for three total layers of absorbency. On the advice of our backers we have added a little to the rise of the pant, to offer better backside coverage and less of a bikini-feel.

Great for those who dribble or leak but don't need a bulky diaper; and those who want to be able to quickly pull them down when they do make it to the toilet.

After our last campaign here, we ended up needing more pants that we made, so we're launching a second round to refill our shelves and introduce new prints.

For this run we are offering the most popular size:
Size 7 Fits waists from 30" to 42" with a max-stretch of 45"

Available Styles: (Shown on diapers, don't worry we're making trainers!)

What We Need & What You Get

Similar to our previous campaigns we have already pre-ordered and paid for this production run. We are looking to raise $500 or more to put back into our production budget for the next item we launch.

For those who help us we have some nice perks available, which include:

Get the Prints you want! Pre-ordering through Indiegogo lets you lock in your print choices now, ensuring the prints you love don't sell out before you get yours!

Save Money! We expect these pants to retail for $19-22 depending on size. You can snag one for $15, or pay as little as $12 each when you pre-order a multi-pack!

story:
My mother RoseMarie has had the biggest impact on my life, she was diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer in January and doctors are giving her only 9months - 2 years to live. My mother has a kind heart, she feeds the homeless under the bridge, and ministers God's word around the world. We need America's help to get her healed.

Good news

  • We found  Gerson Therepy Clinic in Mexico, The cost is $5,500 a week, and she needs to be there atleast 2 weeks, to get her body cleaned out, and teach us the juicing lifestyle, the juicer they said she needs is about $2400 and two round trip airfare tickets. 

    The Gerson Therapy is a natural treatment that activates the body’s extraordinary ability to heal itself through an organic, vegetarian diet, raw juices, coffee enemas and natural supplements.

    With its whole-body approach to healing, the Gerson Therapy naturally reactivates your body’s magnificent ability to heal itself – with no damaging side effects. This a powerful, natural treatment boosts the body’s own immune system to heal cancer, arthritis, heart disease, allergies, and many other degenerative diseases. Dr. Max Gerson developed the Gerson Therapy in the 1930s, initially as a treatment for his own debilitating migraines, and eventually as a treatment for degenerative diseases such as skin tuberculosis, diabetes and, most famously, cancer.

My mother RoseMarie has had the biggest impact on my life, she was diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer in January and doctors are giving her only 9months - 2 years to live. My mother has a kind heart, she feeds the homeless under the bridge, and ministers God's word around the world. We need America's help to get her healed.

Good news
We found  Gerson Therepy Clinic in Mexico, The cost is $5,500 a week, and she needs to be there atleast 2 weeks, to get her body cleaned out, and teach us the juicing lifestyle, the juicer they said she needs is about $2400 and two round trip airfare tickets.
